 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>If there are no members entitled to vote on the dissolution of the corporation, the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets will be deemed authorized upon its adoption by the board.<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>15►<field>fn.fnref="15"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00GP1T"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(b).<f_break></footnote.body></footnote> However, the plan must also be approved by any governmental body or officer whose approval was required for the formation of the corporation.<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>16►<field>fn.fnref="16"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I002NDF"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(c).<f_break>Research References<f_break>►<field>rc.ref.id="I005GIB"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897.<f_break>Nonjudicial dissolution of not-for-profit corporation, ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089N7"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>.<f_break></footnote.body></footnote> Moreover, approval of the attorney general also is required for a charitable corporation or for any noncharitable corporation that holds assets at the time of dissolution legally required to be used for a particular purpose. <footnote><footnote.body><f_break>17►<field>fn.fnref="17"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I002NDI"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(d)(1).<f_break></footnote.body></footnote> Application to the attorney general for such approval is by verified petition, with the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets and certified copies of the consents prescribed by law annexed thereto. <footnote><footnote.body><f_break>18►<field>fn.fnref="18"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I005GIE"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(d)(2).<f_break>Research References<f_break>►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089NA"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897.<f_break>Nonjudicial dissolution of not-for-profit corporation, ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00B2S6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>.<f_break></footnote.body></footnote>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>After the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets has been adopted, authorized, approved and carried out pursuant to the terms of the plan within the time period set forth pursuant to statute, a certificate of dissolution, entitled &ldquo;“Certificate of Dissolution of (Name of Corporation) Under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVX2"</field>Section 1003 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law,&rdquo;” and containing the information required by the statute must be signed and, if required by statute, after the Attorney General has affixed thereon his or her consent to the dissolution, delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>19►<field>fn.fnref="19"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I002NEN"</field>N-PCL &s;§1003(a).<f_break>Research References<f_break>►<field>rc.ref.id="I005GJJ"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897.<f_break>Nonjudicial dissolution of not-for-profit corporation, ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089OF"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>.<f_break></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate must set forth the following information:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>a. The corporation's name and, if its name has been changed, the name under which it was formed;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>b. The date its certificate of incorporation was filed by the Department of State;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>c. The name and address of each of its officers and directors;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>d. A statement as to whether the corporation is a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>e. A statement as to whether or not the corporation holds assets at the time of dissolution, which are legally required to be used for a particular purpose;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>f. That the corporation elects to dissolve;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>g. The manner in which the dissolution was authorized; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>h. A statement that, prior to delivery of such certificate of dissolution to the Department of State for filing, the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets <trace.deleted/>be<trace>en</trace> approved by the Attorney General or a justice of the <trace>s</trace>upreme <trace>c</trace>ourt, if such approval is required. <trace>A copy of the approval of the attorney general or of the court order must be attached to the certificate of dissolution. </trace>In the case of a corporation, other than a corporation incorporated pursuant to the article governing public cemetery corporations, that has no assets to distribute, or has no assets to distribute other than a reserve not to exceed $25,000 for the purpose of paying ordinary and necessary expenses of winding up its affairs including attorney and accountant fees, and liabilities not in excess of $10,000 at the time of dissolution, a statement that a copy of the plan of dissolution that contains the statement prescribed by statute has been duly filed with the Attorney General, if required.2<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>20►<field>fn.fnref="20"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I002NEP"</field>N-PCL &s;§1003(a).<f_break></footnote.body></footnote>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>If Attorney General approval or approval by a governmental body or officer of the dissolution is required, such approval must be endorsed on or annexed to the certificate.<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>21►<field>fn.fnref="21"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I005GJL"</field>N-PCL &s;§1003(b).<f_break>Research References<f_break>►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089OH"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897.<f_break>Nonjudicial dissolution of not-for-profit corporation, ►<field>rc.ref.id="I002NKD"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>.<f_break></footnote.body></footnote> The Law further provides that the Department of State may not file the certificate of dissolution unless the consent of the State Department of Taxation and Finance to the dissolution is attached to the certificate.<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>22►<field>fn.fnref="22"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I005GP9"</field>N-PCL &s;§1004.<f_break>Research References<f_break>►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089U5"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897.<f_break>Certificate of dissolution, ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00B2Z1"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>.<f_break></footnote.body></footnote> Upon filing the certificate, the corporation is then dissolved.<footnote><footnote.body><f_break>23►<field>fn.fnref="23"</field><f_break>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|56|30:52"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00DW3X"</field>N-PCL &s;§1004.<f_break>Research References<f_break>►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GP8T"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897.<f_break>Certificate of dissolution, ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00JIDP"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>.<f_break></footnote.body></footnote>
2. Checklists
30:53. Checklist-- Actions to be taken prior to incorporation of existing association

NFP
CHK
FCV
FTR
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>1. Calling a meeting of all the members to decide the issue of incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>2. Sending a notice of the meeting to all the members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>3. Passing a resolution, by a majority of the members, authorizing incorporation of the association and execution of the certificate of incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>4. Formation, by election, appointment, or otherwise, of a committee of members specifically authorized to incorporate the association and execute the certificate of incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>5. Recording minutes of the meeting containing the vote of the membership authorizing incorporation of the association and execution of certificate of incorporation and formation of a committee of members to accomplish the incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>6. Preparing affidavit that incorporation has been authorized.

Item 4.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"</field>The certificate of incorporation of what was previous to incorporation an unincorporated not-for-profit association or group must have annexed thereto an affidavit of the subscribers of such certificate, stating that they constitute a majority of the members of a committee duly authorized to incorporate such association or group. ►<field>st.ref.id="I002NKI"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(b).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I005GPE"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3375
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089UA"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§7<trace>1</trace>
30:54. Checklist-- Matters to be considered in selecting a corporate name
COL
NFP
CHK
FTR
FCV
EBL
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>1. The name must contain one of the following: &ldquo;“corporation,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“incorporated,&rdquo;” or &ldquo;“limited,&rdquo;” or an abbreviation of one of such words (unless the corporation is formed for charitable or religious purposes or for purposes requiring special approval or is a bar association).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>2. The name must not contain any word or phrase, or abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, that indicates or implies that the corporation is organized for any purpose other than one or more of the purposes permitted by its certificate of incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>3. The name must be distinguishable from the names of corporations of any kind or a fictitious name of an authorized foreign corporation, as such names appear on the Department of State's index of names of existing domestic and authorized foreign corporations.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>4. The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, the use of which is prohibited or restricted by statute.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>5. The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, in a context that indicates or implies that the corporation is authorized for any purpose or is possessed in the state of any power other than a purpose for which, or a power with which, the corporation may be and is formed or the foreign corporation is authorized.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>6. The name must not, with certain exceptions, contain any of certain, specified words or phrases, or any abbreviation or derivative of such words or phrases, such as &ldquo;“bank,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“casualty,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“doctor,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“endowment,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“insurance,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“lawyer,&rdquo;” &ldquo;“surety,&rdquo;” and &ldquo;“underwriter.&rdquo;”
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>7. The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, in a context that will tend to mislead the public into believing that the corporation is an agency or instrumentality of the United States or the State of New York, or a subdivision thereof, or is a public corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>8. The name must not contain the word &ldquo;“cooperative&rdquo;” or an abbreviation, contraction, or derivative of such word.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>9. The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, that, separately or in context, is indecent or obscene or ridicules or degrades any person, group, belief, business, or agency of government or indicates or implies any unlawful activity.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>10. The name need not be in the English language as long as it is written in English letters or characters.

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>This checklist is based on ►<field>st.ref.id="I060PCM"</field>N-PCL &s;§301.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"</field>For discussion of corporate name, reservation, and change of name, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I002NLQ"</field>&s;§30:46.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I005GQM"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3382
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089VI"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>164 to 176</trace>
30:55. Checklist-- Matters that must be stated in certificate of incorporation
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CHK
EBL
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>1. Name of the corporation, which must satisfy the requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>2. If an existing unincorporated association is being incorporated, the name of that association.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>3. Statement that the corporation is organized pursuant to the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>4. Statement that the corporation is a corporation as defined in ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B30E"</field>Section 102(a)(5) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>5. Purpose or purposes for which it is formed, it being sufficient to state that the purpose of the corporation is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law as a charitable or noncharitable corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>6. Whether it is a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DW5A"</field>Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>7. If it is not formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body, a statement that no such consent or approval is required.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>8. County within the state in which the office of the corporation is to be located.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>9. The post office address of an office outside the state, if any, where books and records of account are to be kept.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>10. The names and addresses of the initial directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>11. Duration of the corporation if other than perpetual.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>12. Designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process on the corporation and the post office address within or outside the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of process against the corporation served <trace>up</trace>on <trace.deleted/><trace>him or her</trace>.<trace> The corporation may include an email address to which the Secretary of State may email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her.</trace>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>13. Name and address within the state of corporation's registered agent, if any, and a statement that such registered agent is to be the agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>14. Statement concerning approvals or consents.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>15. Statements, if any, concerning special not-for-profit corporations.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>16. Any other provision(s) permitted by law concerning regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation (including types or classes of membership and distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation) or required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>17. Signature(s) of incorporator(s).

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;“Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation) Under ►<field>st.ref.id="I002NLV"</field>Section 402 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law.&rdquo;” ►<field>st.ref.id="I005GQR"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>This checklist is based on the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I0089VN"</field>N-PCL &s;§402.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>For discussion concerning the contents of a certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00B30J"</field>&s;§30:39.
Item 1.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00DW5F"</field>N-PCL &s;§301 sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00GPAB"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3375
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00JIF7"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>164 to 176</trace>
Item 5.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>A corporation may be formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I002NRI"</field>N-PCL &s;§201.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I005GWE"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>57, 58</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>421</trace>
Item 6.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A1A"</field>N-PCL &s;§201.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>For complete discussion of types of not-for-profit corporations, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00B366"</field>&s;§30:35.
Item 9.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law requires every not-for-profit corporation to keep, at the office of the corporation, correct and complete books and records of account and minutes of the proceedings of its members, board, and executive committee, if any, and to keep at such office or at the office of its transfer agent or registrar in this state a list or record containing the names and addresses of all members, the class or classes of membership or capital certificates and the number of capital certificates held by each, and the dates when they respectively became the holders of record thereof. However, the corporation may keep its books and records of account in an office of the corporation without the state, as specified in its certificate of incorporation. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I060OYM"</field>N-PCL &s;§621(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05WH9A"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§3<trace>96</trace>
Item 12.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A1C"</field>N-PCL &s;§304(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State.<trace> The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B368"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a)(6).

Item 13.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I002NRN"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(a). In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation, (see ►<field>st.ref.id="I005GWJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§304(a)) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A1F"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a)(6).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>The corporation's registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed or authorized to conduct business in the State of New York under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or other state statute. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B36B"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DWB7"</field>N-PCL &s;§306.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GPG3"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(b). This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I060OYC"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§801(b)(8), 802(c)(3).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05S9JO"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1062, 1063</trace>
Item 16.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"</field>The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05O1UC"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DWB9"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§7<trace>1</trace>, 7<trace>2</trace>
30:56. Checklist-- Matters that may be included in either the certificate of incorporation or bylaws
COL
NFP
CHK
FTR
FCV
EBL
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>1. Limitations, if any, on the general powers of the corporation provided for in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>2. Membership qualifications if the corporation is to have members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>3. When the corporation is to have two or more classes of members, the designation of such classes and the relative rights and limitations of the different classes of members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>4. Voting, property, and other rights and privileges of members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>a. Where a member is entitled to vote, the member shall have no more than nor less than one vote, except that if a corporation has an organization as a member, the certificate or bylaws may provide that such organization shall be entitled to votes substantially proportionate to its membership.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>b. Certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, either absolutely or contingently, that the members of any class are not entitled to vote or may otherwise limit or define the voting powers of the members or the respective classes of members, but no such denial, limitation, or definition of voting rights will be effective unless at the time one or more classes of members, singly or in the aggregate, are entitled to full voting rights.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>c. Whenever any corporate action, other than the election of directors, is to be taken by vote of the members, it must, except as otherwise provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the certificate of incorporation, or the bylaws, be authorized by a majority of the votes cast at a meeting of members by the members entitled to vote thereon.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>d. Greater requirements as to quorum and votes of members than required by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>e. Reservation to the members of the power to make, alter, and repeal bylaws.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>f. Denial of right to vote by proxy.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>g. Cumulative voting rights.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>h. Transferability of membership in the corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>5. Authorization of initiation fees, dues, assessments, fines, and other penalties and provisions for the enforcement of their collection.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>6. Right of directors to appoint committees to manage business affairs.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>7. Qualifications of directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>8. Provisions as to election or appointment of directors and their terms of office.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>9. Restrictions on holding meetings of directors within or outside State of New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>10. Quorum requirements as to directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>11. Provision, if desired, that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board or that the President is authorized to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>12. Number, time, and manner of choosing qualifications, term of office, official designations, powers, duties, and compensation of officers.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>13. Appointment and authority of executive or other committees of directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>14. Right of officers to be ex-officio members of board of directors.

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>Matter that is likely to be subject to frequent change should be placed in the bylaws because the certificate of incorporation can be amended by the membership only in compliance with statutory procedures. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I002NSX"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§801 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I002NYL"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I005H3H"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>147 to 153</trace>
Item 1.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I008A8D"</field>N-PCL &s;§202(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3D9"</field>N-PCL &s;§202.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>For complete discussion of powers, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00DWI5"</field>&s;§30:35.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GPN1"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§42<trace>1</trace>
Item 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I002NYN"</field>N-PCL &s;§601<trace>.</trace>
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I008A8F"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§823</trace>
Item 3.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3DB"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(a). If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DWI7"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including, but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I002NYQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I005H3M"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§823</trace>
Item 4a.
Research References
 ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A8I"</field>N-PCL &s;§611(e).
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I002NYS"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§916</trace>
Item 4b.
Research References
 ►<field>st.ref.id="I005H3O"</field>N-PCL &s;§612.
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I008A8K"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§916</trace>
Item 4c.

 ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3DG"</field>N-PCL &s;§613(b)
Item 4d.
Research References
 ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DWIC"</field>N-PCL &s;§615(a).
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GPN8"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§912</trace>
Item 4e.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I060OK2"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05WGUQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05S95E"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§127</trace>
Item 4f.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>A member entitled to vote may vote in person or, unless the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws otherwise provide, by proxy executed in writing by the member or by that member's agent. A proxy will not be valid after 11 months from the date of its execution unless otherwise provided in the proxy. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3DI"</field>N-PCL &s;§609(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DWIE"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>943 to 946</trace>
Item 4g.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00GPNA"</field>N-PCL &s;§617.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide that in all elections for directors every member entitled to vote will have the right to cumulate his or her vote and to give one candidate a number of votes equal to his or her vote multiplied by the number of directors to be elected or to distribute such votes on the same principle among as many candidates as he or she thinks fit. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00JIS6"</field>N-PCL &s;§617. The implication is that if cumulative voting is not provided for in either the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, it will not be permitted in directors' elections.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I002O00"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§917</trace>
Item 4h.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>Membership certificates or cards are not transferable. If the certificate of incorporation or bylaws permits transfer of membership, upon each such transfer the certificate or card issued to a former member will be surrendered, and a new certificate or card will be issued to the new member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I060OHM"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(d).
Item 5.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05WGSA"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05S92Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>828, 829</trace>
Item 6.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field><trace>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees.</trace>To the extent provided in the resolution, or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05O1DM"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DWJM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>592 to 594</trace>
Item 7.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>The certificate of incorporation or bylaws may prescribe qualifications for directors. A director must, however, be at least 18 years of age, except in the case of certain specified youth groups. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GPOI"</field>N-PCL &s;§701.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00JITE"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>535</trace>
Item 8.
Research References
 ►<field>st.ref.id="I003RV2"</field>N-PCL &s;§703(b)
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006KZY"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>537</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>541</trace>
Item 9.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>Meetings of the board of directors may be held either within or outside the state, unless otherwise provided by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009E4U"</field>N-PCL &s;§710(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C79Q"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>595 to 607</trace>
Item 10.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F0EM"</field>N-PCL &s;§707. See ►<field>cc.ref.id="I003RV4"</field>Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep't 2014) stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006L00"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§605</trace>
Item 11.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003RV7"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006L03"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
Item 12.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009E4Z"</field>N-PCL &s;§713.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>A corporation may pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C79V"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00F0ER"</field>Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer's life insurance policy as affecting right to policy, 56 A.L.R.3d 1086 (secs. 3(a), 3(b) superseded in part by Construction and Application of "Key Man" Life Insurance, 12 A.L.R.7th Art. 6).
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00HTJN"</field>Test in stockholders' actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I003RV9"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>789</trace>
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006L05"</field>Reasonableness of Corporate Officer's Compensation, 4 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 425
Item 13.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field><trace> The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace>To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009E51"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C79X"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace>592 to 594</trace>
Item 14.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00F0ET"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(d).

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|61|30:57"</field>(a) Regular meetings.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|61|30:57"</field>(1) Location.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|61|30:57"</field>(2) Date and time.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|61|30:57"</field>(3) Notices.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|61|30:57"</field>(3) Notice.

Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I003S2C"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499
30:58. Checklist-- Matters to be considered when drafting constitution or articles of organization of a social club
FTR
FCV
COL
NFP
CHK
EBL
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>1. Name of club and principal location.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>2. Purposes and powers of club.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) Specific purposes and powers.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) Operate as nonprofit organization for benefit of members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Substantially all activities to be for that purpose.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) No part of net earnings to inure to benefit of any private shareholder.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(3) Comply in all respects with ►<field>st.ref.id="I006L78"</field>Section 501(c)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(c) General powers.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Buy, hold, sell, exchange, mortgage, lease property of all kinds.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Invest and reinvest funds and property.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(3) Accept, hold, sell, and transfer gifts.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>3. Membership and operation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) Whether stock issued.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) No right to dividends.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) No rights of members to net earnings of organization except as permitted by Internal Revenue Code.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(c) Classes of membership.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Qualifications.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Voting and other rights.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(d) Membership to entail payment of fees and assessments.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(e) Annual meeting of members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Time and place.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Quorum and voting requirements.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>4. Control and management of club.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) Board of trustees or directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Number.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Power to fill vacancies.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) Actions reserved to members and not in power of board.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(c) Initial board membership.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Names and addresses.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Term.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(d) Election of board members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Qualifications of board members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Time, place, notification of members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(3) Members of shareholders as quorum.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(4) Manner of election and voting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>5. Power of board to adopt and amend bylaws.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) Procedure.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) Vote required.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(1) Board members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(2) Club members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>6. Officers.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) Qualifications.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) Titles.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(c) Duties.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(d) Method of appointment.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>7. Amendment of articles of organization.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) By board.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) By members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(c) Procedure.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(d) Quorum and voting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>8. Additional matters if club is incorporated.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(a) Name and address of each incorporator.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(b) Name of initial registered agent.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(c) Address of initial registered office.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|62|30:58"</field>(d) Comply with state and local laws and ordinances regarding alcoholic liquors.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"</field>1. Name of the designating corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"</field>2. Statement that the agent is resigning as registered agent for the designating corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"</field>3. The date the certificate of incorporation or the application for authority of the designating corporation was filed by the Department of State.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"</field>4. Statement that the agent has sent a copy of the certificate of resignation by registered mail to the designating corporation at the post office address on file in the Department of State specified for the mailing of process or, if such address is the address of the registered agent, then to the office of the designating corporation in the jurisdiction of its formation or incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"</field>5. Signature of resigning agent.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"</field>6. Date.

30:60. Checklist-- Matters that must be included in a certificate of dissolution

COL
NFP
CHK
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>1. Name of the corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>2. If the name of the corporation has been changed, the name under which it was formed.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>3. Date on which the corporation's certificate of incorporation was filed by the Department of State.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>4. Name and address of each of the corporation's officers and directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>5. Statement as to whether the corporation is a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>6. Statement as to whether or not the corporation holds assets at the time of authorization of its plan of dissolution and distribution of assets as provided by statute which are legally required to be used for a particular purpose.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>7. Statement that the corporation elects to dissolve.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>8. Manner in which the dissolution was authorized.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>9. Statement that the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets has been approved by the Attorney General or by a justice of the Supreme Court, if such approval is required.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>10. Signature(s).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>11. Date.

Item 8.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"</field>If the dissolution of the corporation is authorized by a vote of the directors and/or members of the corporation that is less than that ordinarily required by the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or any other applicable law, as permitted by statute, then the certificate of dissolution must so state. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LED"</field>N-PCL &s;§1003(a)(7).
30:61. Checklist-- Matters that must be included in a certificate of surrender of authority by a foreign not-for-profit corporation
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CHK
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>1. Name of the foreign corporation as it appears on the index of names of existing domestic and authorized foreign corporations of any kind in the Department of State and the fictitious name the corporation has agreed to use in the State of New York pursuant to law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>2. The jurisdiction of its incorporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>3. Date it was authorized to conduct activities in the State of New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>4. Statement that the corporation surrenders its authority to conduct activities in New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>5. Statement that the corporation revokes the authority of its registered agent, if any, previously designated and consents that process against it in any action or special proceeding may be served on the Secretary of State.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>6. A post office address within or without the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation that may be served on the Secretary of State.<trace> The corporation may include an email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her.</trace>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>7. Signature of an officer of or attorney-in-fact for the foreign corporation or a trustee, receiver, or other liquidator of the corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>8. Date.

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>This checklist is based on ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EJ9"</field>N-PCL &s;§1311(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;“Certificate of Surrender of Authority of (Name of Corporation) Under ►<field>st.ref.id="I05YFWI"</field>Section 1311 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.&rdquo;” ►<field>st.ref.id="I05U876"</field>N-PCL &s;§1311(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>The Department of State will not file such certificate unless the consent of the state tax commission to the surrender of authority is attached thereto. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q0HU"</field>N-PCL &s;§1311(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"</field>The authority of the foreign corporation to conduct activities in New York will terminate on the filing by the Department of State of the certificate of surrender of authority. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7PA"</field>N-PCL &s;§1311(c).

►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>[name of member]


 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>You are hereby notified that there will be a meeting of the members of [name of association] at [address of meeting], [name of city], [name of county], State of New York, on [date of meeting], at [time of meeting], for the purpose of voting on a resolution to incorporate the association as a not-for-profit corporation under the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I003SAR"</field>Sections 101 et seq. of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law. A copy of the resolution is attached to this notice.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>[OPTIONAL: Any member unable to attend the above meeting in person may vote by proxy, in writing, dated and signed by such member, authorizing someone present at the meeting to cast the member's vote.]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>[OPTIONAL: Any member unable to attend the above meeting in person may vote by mail, provided such vote, in writing and signed by the member, is received at the above address not later than the time of the meeting.]

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Attachments]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>The certificate of incorporation of what was previous to incorporation an unincorporated not-for-profit association or group must have annexed thereto an affidavit of the subscribers of such certificate, stating that they constitute a majority of the members of a committee duly authorized to incorporate such association or group. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LFN"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>All members in good standing of an association have a legally enforceable right to attend the meetings of the society and participate in its deliberations and decisions. ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009EKJ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>18</trace>.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>Notice of a meeting of a voluntary association must include the time, place, and object of the meeting. ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00C7PF"</field>Goller v. Stubenhaus, 77 Misc. 29, 134 N.Y.S. 1043 (Sup 1912).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"</field>Where the laws for the internal government of the association ordain the time or manner of giving notice, notice to members must be given as so prescribed. ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00F0UB"</field>In re Bandanza, 132 Misc. 817, 230 N.Y.S. 460 (Sup 1928).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00HTZ7"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Associations &key;17<trace>1</trace>
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I003SGF"</field><trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006LLB"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009EQ7"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>18</trace>
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C7V3"</field>Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &ss;§§<trace>17</trace>

Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and, for that purpose, to execute and file with the Department of State the certificate of incorporation of the corporation to be formed.

30:66. Request for extension of reservation of corporate name

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5483ea01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>REQUEST FOR EXTENSION OF RESERVATIONOF NAME 
 ►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I023HK2"</field>
►<field>table.resize="same"</field><field>table.tabstyle="text"</field>
►<field>tgroup.cols="2"</field>
►<field>colspec.colname="1"</field><field>colspec.colnum="1"</field><field>colspec.colwidth="1*"</field>
►<field>colspec.colname="2"</field><field>colspec.colnum="2"</field><field>colspec.colwidth="19*"</field>


►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>To:

►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>Department of State, State of New York


 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"</field>I am the applicant named in the attached certificate of reservation issued by the Department of State on [date of issue], reserving the name [name of corporation] for use by the domestic not-for-profit corporation intended to be formed by the applicant.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"</field>I hereby request that the reservation be extended for an additional 60 days beyond the original expiration period that ends on [end date of expiration period], pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LMN"</field>Section 303(d) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, for the reason that [description of reason for extension].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"</field>No other request for extension has been filed by me.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of request]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of applicant]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Address of applicant]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Attachments]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"</field>The Secretary of State may extend the reservation of corporate name for additional periods of not more than 60 days each, upon the written request of the applicant, the applicant's attorney, or agent delivered to the Department of State, to be filed before the expiration of the reservation period then in effect. The request must have attached to it the certificate of reservation of name. No more than two such extensions will be granted. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009ERJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§303(d).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"</field>The request for extension of reservation of corporation name must be signed by the original applicant, the applicant's attorney, or his or her agent. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7WF"</field>N-PCL &s;§303(f).

 ►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I023QN7"</field>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"</field>The undersigned is the applicant for reservation of the corporate name of [name of corporation], as evidenced by the attached certificate of reservation issued to applicant on [date of issue].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"</field>The reserved period will expire on [expiry date of period].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"</field>Pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I003SNH"</field>Section 303(e) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the undersigned hereby requests that the Department of State cancel the reservation.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"</field>The request to cancel the reservation of corporation name must be signed by the original applicant, the applicant's attorney, or his or her agent. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EX9"</field>N-PCL &s;§303(f).
