2. Formation
a. Certificate of Incorporation
(1) In General
30:68. Certificate of incorporation
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54901f01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF [NAME OF CORPORATION] UNDER ►<field>st.ref.id="I003SUP"</field>SECTION 402 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>We, the undersigned, acting as incorporators of a corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, do hereby adopt the following Certificate of Incorporation for such corporation:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  NAME
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The name of the corporation is [name of corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  NOT-FOR-PROFIT STATUS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>This corporation is a &ldquo;“corporation&rdquo;” as defined in ►<field>sst.ref.id="I006LZL"</field>Subparagraph (a)(5) of Section 102 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  PURPOSES AND POWERS
►<field>sel.tp="alt"</field>[EITHER:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The [purpose/purposes] for which the corporation is formed [is/are]: [description of purposes as authorized under N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law].[OR:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The purpose for which the corporation is formed is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law as a [charitable/noncharitable] corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>In addition to the foregoing corporate purposes, the corporation shall have and exercise all of the general and special powers of corporations set forth in ►<field>st.ref.id="I003SUR"</field>Section 202 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  CORPORATE TYPE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The corporation is a [charitable/noncharitable] corporation under ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LZN"</field>Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  LOCATION OF CORPORATE OFFICE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The office of the corporation shall be located in [name of county], State of New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>[OPTIONAL: The books and records of account kept by the corporation pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I003SUU"</field>Section 621 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law shall be kept at an office outside the state, which office shall be located at [address of office], [name of city], [name of state] [zip code of office].]
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VI  INITIAL DIRECTORS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The initial Board of Directors shall be [number of directors] in number, their names and addresses being as follows: [names of initial directors] and [addresses of initial directors].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  DURATION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The duration of this corporation shall be [perpetual/from the date this certificate is filed by the Department of State until [date of expiration]/[specification of time period] from the date of filing of this certificate of incorporation/[specification of duration of corporation]].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VIII  DESIGNATION OF SECRETARY OF STATE ASAGENT FOR SERVICE OF PROCESS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The corporation designates the Secretary of State of the State of New York as its agent upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address of the corporation [within/outside] the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State is as follows: [mailing address of corporation], [name of city], [name of state] [zip code of corporation].<trace><finstr>[OPTIONAL: The email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been served electronically upon the Secretary of State is: [email address of corporation]]</finstr>.</trace>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IX  DESIGNATION OF REGISTERED AGENT FORSERVICE OF PROCESS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>[OPTIONAL: The corporation additionally designates [[name of individual], whose post office address is [post address of individual], [name of city], State of New York [zip code of individual]/[name of corporation], [incorporated under the laws of the State of New York/a foreign corporation authorized to do business in the State of New York], with offices at [address of corporation], [name of city], State of New York [zip code of office] as its agent upon whom process against it may be served].]
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE X  ADDITIONAL PROVISIONS FOR SPECIAL NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATIONS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>[OPTIONAL: [Specification of additional provisions].]
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XI  APPROVALS AND CONSENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The corporation [is/is not] formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. [No consent or approval is required/Such consent or approval is attached].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XII  ADDITIONAL PROVISIONS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>[OPTIONAL: [List of additional provisions].]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of certificate of incorporation]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Names of incorporators]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Addresses of incorporators]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Acknowledgments]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The fee for filing a certificate of incorporation, which is subject to change, is $75. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003SVZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§104-A(e).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The certificate of incorporation must be signed by each incorporator with his or her name and address included in the certificate and delivered to the Department of State. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006M0V"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>If the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an existing unincorporated association or group, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009F5R"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>For discussion of certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05YEPO"</field>&ss;§§30:68 et seq.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>For checklists of matters that must and matters that may be included in the certificate, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05U70C"</field>&ss;§§30:55 to 30:57.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>For form of affidavit of subscribers of the certificate that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee authorized to incorporate the association or group, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05PZB0"</field>&s;§30:73.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C8AP"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379
ARTICLE I. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1FL"</field>N-PCL &s;§301 sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00HUKH"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>164 to 176</trace>
ARTICLE III. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>A corporation may be formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I003T1P"</field>N-PCL &s;§201.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006M6L"</field>N-PCL &s;§202.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009FBH"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>57, 58</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>421</trace>
ARTICLE IV. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05YEE8"</field>N-PCL &s;§201.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>For complete discussion of types of not-for-profit corporations, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05U6OW"</field>&s;§30:35.
ARTICLE VI. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The board of directors of a not-for-profit corporation must consist of three or more directors; the initial number of directors is implied by the listing of names and addresses of the initial directors in the certificate of incorporation. Thereafter, the number (never less than three) may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or of the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number of directors will be three. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FBJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§702(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C8GF"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§7<trace>1</trace>
ARTICLE VIII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1LB"</field>N-PCL &s;§304(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State. <trace>The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. </trace>►<field>st.ref.id="I00HUQ7"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a)(6).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00KNV3"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§7<trace>1</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>1062</trace>
ARTICLE IX. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I003T1U"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(a). In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation (see ►<field>st.ref.id="I006M6Q"</field>N-PCL &s;§304(a)) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FBM"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a)(7).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The corporation's registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed or authorized to conduct business in the State of New York under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or other state statute. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8GI"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1LE"</field>N-PCL &s;§306.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05YEDY"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(b). This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05U6OM"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§801(b)(8), 802(c)(3).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05LR9Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1062, 1063</trace>
ARTICLE XII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003T32"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"</field>The additional provisions should regulate the internal affairs of the corporation, such as the types or classes of membership or the distribution of assets for different purposes (e.g. for dissolution, final liquidation, or as required by government officials or entities as a requirement for filing a certificate of incorporation). The provisions need to <trace>be </trace>consistent with the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law and other applicable state statutes and regulations.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006M7Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§7<trace>1</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>72</trace>

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|75|30:69"</field>The above form<trace>, revised 12/22,</trace> is available from the New York State Department of State, ►<field>url.ref.id="I003T34"</field><url>http://www.dos.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006M80"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374

<trace>30: 69 . 50. Certificate of incorporation-- Previously unincorporated association </trace>

<trace>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF <finstr>[NAME OF CORPORATION]</finstr> UNDER § 402 OF THE NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK</trace>

<trace><p>We, the undersigned, being each natural persons of eighteen years or over, desiring to form a</trace>
<trace>corporation pursuant to the provisions of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York, hereby certify:</trace>
<trace><p>FIRST: The name of the corporation is <finstr>[name of corporation]</finstr> (hereinafter,</trace>
<trace>the “Corporation”).</trace>
<trace><p>SECOND: The Corporation is a not-for-profit corporation as defined in Section 102(a)(5) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</trace>
<trace><p>THIRD: The corporation is a charitable corporation under Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit</trace>
<trace>Corporation Law.</trace>
<trace><p>FOURTH: The Corporation is not formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any New York State official, department, board, agency, or other body and, accordingly, no consent or approval is required.</trace>
<trace><p>FIFTH: The principal office of the Corporation will be located in <finstr>[name of county]</finstr> County, New York. </trace>
<trace><p>SIXTH: The purposes for which the Corporation is to be formed are for charitable purposes</trace>
<trace>within the meaning of Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 as amended (the “Code”). The more specific and primary purposes for which this Corporation is formed are:</trace>
<trace><p>(a) To engage in charitable fundraising for the purposes of collaboration and to develop and</trace>
<trace>promote the educational purposes of cultivating knowledge of <finstr>[specification of topic]</finstr>.</trace>
<trace><p>(b) To exercise all the powers and privileges and to perform all of the duties and</trace>
<trace>obligations of the Corporation as set forth in the Corporation’s Bylaws, including all of the</trace>
<trace>general powers set forth in Section 202 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, together with the</trace>
<trace>power to solicit and receive grants, bequests and contributions for these stated purposes.</trace>
<trace><p>(c) To make and perform any contracts and do any other acts and things through the</trace>
<trace>exercise of any power suitable, convenient, proper, or incidental for the accomplishment of</trace>
<trace>any of the powers enumerated herein or in the said Bylaws, including to fix, levy, collect and</trace>
<trace>enforce payment by any lawful means of any charges or assessments imposed pursuant to the</trace>
<trace>terms of the Bylaws, and to pay all expenses in connection therewith, including all office and</trace>
<trace>other expenses incident to the conduct of the business of the Corporation, and to do any other</trace>
<trace>act or thing incidental to or connected with the foregoing purposes, or in the advancement</trace>
<trace>thereof, but not for the pecuniary profit or financial gain of its members, directors, or officers</trace>
<trace>except as permitted under Article 5 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</trace>
<trace><p>SEVENTH: The Corporation has not been formed for pecuniary profit or financial gain, and no part of the assets, income, or profit of the Corporation is distributable to, or inures to the benefit of, its directors, officers, or members except to the extent permitted under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. Notwithstanding any of the provision of this Certificate of Incorporation, the Corporation shall not conduct activities not permitted to be carried on: (i) by a corporation exempt from federal income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the Code; or (ii) by a corporation, contributions to which are deductible under Section 170(c)(2) of the Code; or (iii) any activities prohibited by Section 501(c)(3) of the Code, and no substantial part of the activities of the corporation shall be carrying on propaganda, or otherwise attempting to</trace>
<trace>influence legislation (except as otherwise provided by Internal Revenue Code Section 501(h)) or</trace>
<trace>participating in, or intervening in (including the publication or distribution of statements), any</trace>
<trace>political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office.</trace>
<trace><p>EIGHTH: Upon the winding up and dissolution of the Corporation, the assets of the Corporation remaining after payment of, or provision for payment of, all debts and liabilities of the Corporation shall be distributed to an organization or organizations recognized as exempt under Section 501(c)(3) of the Code.</trace>
<trace><p>NINTH: No part of the net earnings of the Corporation shall inure to the benefit of any member, trustee, director, officer of the Corporation, or any private individual, except that reasonable compensation may be paid for services rendered. No such member, trustee, director or officer of the Corporation, nor any private individual, shall be entitled to share in the distribution of any of the corporate assets upon dissolution of the Corporation.</trace>
<trace><p>TENTH: The Corporation shall have members, the qualifications, terms, and rights of which</trace>
<trace>shall be set by the Bylaws of the Corporation.</trace>
<trace><p>ELEVENTH: The Corporation shall be managed and operated by a board of directors, the number of which is to be no less than <finstr>[minimum number of members]</finstr>, elected as set forth in the Bylaws and in a number as set in accordance with the requirements of the Bylaws of the Corporation.</trace>
<trace><p>TWELFTH: The names and addresses of the initial directors are: <finstr>[names and addresses of initial directors]</finstr></trace>
<trace><p>THIRTEENTH: The duration of the Corporation shall be perpetual.</trace>
<trace><p>FOURTEENTH: The Secretary of State of the State of New York is hereby designated the agent of the Corporation upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address to which the Secretary of State shall mail a copy of any process against the Corporation served upon him or her as agent of the Corporation is: <finstr>[specification of post office address]</finstr></trace>
<trace><p>FIFTEENTH: The directors, officers, and members of the Corporation shall be indemnified by the Corporation to the fullest extent permitted by law, but not in any manner not permitted by, nor prohibited by, applicable law. More specifically, but not in limitation of the foregoing:</trace>
<trace><p>(a) General Rights and Duties of Defense and Indemnity. No director, officer, or</trace>
<trace>member of the Corporation shall be personally liable to the Corporation or its members for</trace>
<trace>damages for any breach of duty in such capacity unless said breach of duty, whether an act or</trace>
<trace>omission, is found by judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction (or by other adjudication)</trace>
<trace>to have been committed in bad faith or to have involved intentional misconduct or knowing</trace>
<trace>violation of the law, or that the person charged personally gained a financial profit or other</trace>
<trace>advantage to which such person was not legally entitled, or that the such person’s act(s) or</trace>
<trace>omission(s) materially or criminally violated the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of</trace>
<trace>New York. Each person who serves as a director, officer, or member of the Corporation while</trace>
<trace>this Article is in effect shall be deemed to be doing so in reliance on the provisions of this</trace>
<trace>Article, and neither the amendment or repeal of this Article, nor the adoption of any Bylaw</trace>
<trace>inconsistent with this Article, shall apply to or have any effect on the liability or alleged</trace>
<trace>liability of any such director, officer, or member for, arising out of, based upon, or in</trace>
<trace>connection with any acts or omissions of such person occurring prior to the amendment,</trace>
<trace>repeal, or adoption of any inconsistent provision. The provisions of this Article are cumulative</trace>
<trace>and shall be in addition to and independent of any and all other limitations upon, or</trace>
<trace>eliminations of, the liabilities of directors, officers, and members of the Corporation, as such,</trace>
<trace>whether such limitations or eliminations arise under or are created by any law, rule,</trace>
<trace>regulation, bylaw, agreement, vote of members or disinterested directors, or otherwise. The</trace>
<trace>Corporation shall also indemnify, to the fullest extent now or hereafter provided for or</trace>
<trace>permitted by law, each person involved in or made or threatened to be made a party to any</trace>
<trace>action, suit, claim, proceeding, arbitration, alternative dispute resolution mechanism,</trace>
<trace>investigation, administrative or legislative hearing, or any other actual, threatened, pending or</trace>
<trace>completed proceeding, whether civil, administrative, or criminal, or whether formal or</trace>
<trace>informal, and including an action by or in the right of the Corporation or any other</trace>
<trace>corporation, partnership, joint venture, trust, employee benefit plan or other enterprise,</trace>
<trace>whether profit or non-profit (any such entity, other than the Corporation, being hereinafter</trace>
<trace>referred to as an “Enterprise”), and further including all appeals therein (any such process and</trace>
<trace>all appeals being hereafter referred to as a “Proceeding”), by reason of the fact that such</trace>
<trace>person, or such person’s testator or intestate, is or was a director, officer, or member of the</trace>
<trace>Corporation, or while so serving such person acted in an official capacity as a director, officer,</trace>
<trace>or member in any other Enterprise, as against any and all judgments, fines, costs, penalties,</trace>
<trace>amounts paid in settlement and expenses, including attorneys’ fees, as are actually and</trace>
<trace>reasonably incurred as a result of or in connection with any Proceeding, except as may be</trace>
<trace>limited or otherwise so provided below.</trace>
<trace><p>(b) Specific Rules for Derivative Actions. The Corporation, by virtue of Section 722 of the</trace>
<trace>Not-for-Profit Corporation law, shall indemnify any person made party to an action by or in</trace>
<trace>the right of the Corporation to procure a judgment in its favor by reason of the fact that such person, or such person’s testator or intestate, is or was a director, officer, or member of the</trace>
<trace>Corporation, against the reasonable expenses, including attorneys’ fees, actually and</trace>
<trace>necessarily incurred by any such person in connection with the defense of such action, or in</trace>
<trace>connection with an appeal therein, except in relation to matters as to which such director,</trace>
<trace>officer, or member is adjudged to have breached such person’s duty to the Corporation under</trace>
<trace>Section 717 of the Not-for Profit Corporation Law. Such indemnification shall in no case include</trace>
<trace>amounts paid in settling or otherwise disposing of a threatened action, or a pending action</trace>
<trace>with or without court approval, or expenses incurred in defending a threatened action, or a</trace>
<trace>pending action which is settled or otherwise disposed of without court approval.</trace>
<trace><p>(c) Interpretations and Intent of Provisions. Whenever a defense or indemnity is claimed</trace>
<trace>by any person and this Certificate of Incorporation references a breach of duty, commission of</trace>
<trace>a breach in bad faith, intentional misconduct, a knowing violation of law, or a personal gain</trace>
<trace>for which there was no legal entitlement, it shall be a defense by the claimant that while a</trace>
<trace>director, officer, or member, such person acted in good faith for a purpose that such person</trace>
<trace>reasonably believed to be in the best interests of the Corporation or that such person had no</trace>
<trace>reasonable cause to believe that their conduct was unlawful. The termination of any action or</trace>
<trace>proceeding by judgment, settlement, conviction, or upon a plea of nolo contendere, or its</trace>
<trace>equivalent, shall not in itself create a presumption that any such director, officer, or member</trace>
<trace>did not act in good faith or for a purpose that was reasonably believed to be in the best</trace>
<trace>interests of the Corporation, or that such person had reasonable cause to believe that the</trace>
<trace>applicable conduct was unlawful. It is the intent of this Article to require the Corporation to</trace>
<trace>indemnify the persons referred to herein for the aforementioned judgments, fines, penalties,</trace>
<trace>amounts paid in settlement, etc., whenever such indemnification could lawfully be permitted</trace>
<trace>by express provisions of a Certificate of Incorporation, and the indemnification required by</trace>
<trace>this Article shall not be limited by the absence of an express recital of such circumstances. In</trace>
<trace>making any determination regarding any person’s entitlement to indemnification hereunder it</trace>
<trace>shall be presumed that such person is entitled to indemnification and the Corporation shall</trace>
<trace>have the burden of proving the contrary.</trace>
<trace><p>(d) Insurance and Agreements. The Corporation may, with the approval of the Board of</trace>
<trace>Directors, enter into an agreement with any person who is, or is about to become, a director,</trace>
<trace>officer, member, employee, or agent of the Corporation, or who is serving, or is about to serve</trace>
<trace>at the request of the Corporation as such in any Enterprise, and such agreement may provide</trace>
<trace>for indemnification of such person and advancement of expenses to such person upon terms,</trace>
<trace>and to the extent, not prohibited by law. The failure to enter into any such agreement shall not</trace>
<trace>affect or limit the rights of any such person under this Article.</trace>
<trace><p>(e) Non-exclusivity. The provisions of this Article shall not be exclusive and shall include,</trace>
<trace>by implication, any and all rights and remedies available to the Corporation, the directors,</trace>
<trace>officers, and members by statute or otherwise, including but not limited to the purchase and</trace>
<trace>maintenance of insurance to fund the aforementioned indemnification pursuant to Section 726 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</trace>
<trace><p>(f) Limitations and Procedure. In limitation of the foregoing, no act or omission of any</trace>
<trace>director, officer, or member, to the extent it provides any benefit to said director, officer, or</trace>
<trace>member, shall be defended or indemnified by or at the expense of the Corporation whenever</trace>
<trace>the limitations and restrictions of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or § 501(c)(3) of the Code </trace>
<trace>shall prohibit such defense or indemnity. Further, no indemnification shall be made to or on behalf of any such person if a judgment or other final adjudication adverse to such person establishes that such person's acts were material to the cause of action so adjudicated and: (i) committed in bad faith; or (ii) the result of active and deliberate dishonesty; or (iii) such person personally gained in fact a financial profit or other advantage to which such person was not legally entitled. In addition, no indemnification shall be made with respect to any Proceeding initiated by any person against the Corporation or any other director, officer, or member thereof, other than to enforce the terms of this Article, unless such Proceeding was authorized by the Board of Directors. Further, no indemnification shall be made with respect to any settlement or compromise of any Proceeding unless and until the Corporation has consented to such settlement or compromise. Written notice of any Proceeding for which indemnification may be sought by any person shall be given to the Corporation as soon as practicable; however, an individual's failure to provide such notice shall not relieve the Corporation of its indemnification obligations hereunder, except to the extent that the Corporation has been prejudiced by its failure to receive such notice in a timely manner. The Corporation shall then be permitted (but not required) to participate in the defense of any such proceeding or, unless conflicts of interest or position exist between such person and the Corporation in the conduct of such defense, to assume such defense. In the event that the Corporation assumes the defense of any such Proceeding, the legal counsel selected by the Corporation shall be deemed acceptable to such person, and after such an assumption the Corporation shall not be liable to such person for any legal or other expenses subsequently incurred unless such expenses have been expressly authorized by the Corporation. In the event that the Corporation participates in but does not assume the defense in a Proceeding, the person claiming indemnity may select counsel, subject to such person's duty to cooperate in good faith with the Corporation in respect of any common defense or common use of counsels, unless doing so would be inappropriate due to actual or potential differing interests between or among such parties.</trace>
<trace><p> IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned incorporators, each being at least eighteen (18) years of age, have made, subscribed and caused to be acknowledged this Certificate of Incorporation this <finstr>[ordinal number of day]</finstr> day of <finstr>[name of month]</finstr>, <finstr>[identification of year]</finstr>.</trace>

<trace>______________ <br>[Names of incorporators ]</trace>

►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF [NAME OF CORPORATION] UNDER ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FCW"</field>SECTION 402 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>We, the undersigned, acting as incorporators of a corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, which corporation has previously operated as an unincorporated association under the name of [name of corporation], do hereby adopt the following Certificate of Incorporation for such corporation:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  NAME
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The name of the corporation is [name of corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  NOT-FOR-PROFIT STATUS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>This corporation is a &ldquo;“corporation&rdquo;” as defined in ►<field>st.ref.id="I003T37"</field>Subparagraph (a)(5) of Section 102 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  PURPOSES AND POWERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The specific and primary purpose for which this corporation is organized is to provide social and recreational facilities for its members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The general purposes for which this corporation is organized are: [specification of general purposes for incorporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>This corporation shall have and exercise all rights and powers conferred upon not-for-profit corporations under the laws of the State of New York, generally, and specifically as provided in ►<field>st.ref.id="I006M83"</field>Section 202 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, provided, however, that this corporation is not empowered to engage in any activity that in itself is not in furtherance of its purposes as set forth in subparagraphs (a) through (c) of this ARTICLE III.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  CORPORATE TYPE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The corporation shall be a [charitable/noncharitable] corporation under ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FCZ"</field>Section 201 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  LOCATION OF CORPORATE OFFICE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The office of the corporation shall be located in [name of county], New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>[OPTIONAL: The books and records of account kept by the corporation pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I003T8U"</field>Section 621 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law shall be kept at an office outside the state, which office shall be located at [address of office], [name of city], [name of state], [zip code of office].]
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VI  INITIAL DIRECTORS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The first Board of Directors shall be [number of directors] in number, their names and addresses being as follows:

►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>[residential address 7]


►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  DURATION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The duration of this corporation shall be [perpetual/from the date this certificate is filed by the Department of State until [date of expiration]/[specification of time period] from the date of filing of this certificate of incorporation/[specification of duration of corporation]].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VIII  DESIGNATION OF SECRETARY OF STATE ASAGENT FOR SERVICE OF PROCESS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The corporation designates the Secretary of State of the State of New York as its agent upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address of the corporation [within/outside] the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State is as follows: [mailing address of corporation], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state] [zip code of corporation].<trace> <finstr>[OPTIONAL: The email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been served electronically upon the Secretary of State is: [email address of corporation]]</finstr>.</trace>

►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IX  DESIGNATION OF REGISTERED AGENT FORSERVICE OF PROCESS[EITHER:]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The corporation additionally designates [name of individual], whose post office address is [post office address of individual], [name of city], State of New York [zip code of individual] as its agent upon whom process against it may be served.[OR:]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The corporation additionally designates [name of other corporation], [incorporated under the laws of the State of New York/a foreign corporation authorized to do business in the State of New York], with offices at [post office address of other corporation's office], [name of city], State of New York [zip code of other corporation's office] as its agent upon whom process against it may be served.[OR:]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>No additional registered agent is designated for service of process. The Secretary of State of the State of New York, however, is the corporation's agent upon whom process against it may be served, as provided by ARTICLE VIII.<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE X  APPROVALS AND CONSENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The corporation [is/is not] formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. [No consent or approval is required/Such consent or approval is attached].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XI  MEMBERSHIP
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The authorized number, qualifications, and manner of admission of members of this corporation; the different classes of membership, if any; the property, voting, and other rights and privileges of members; the liability of members for dues and/or assessments and the method of collection of such dues and assessments; and the termination and transfer of membership [are as follows: [specification of terms of membership]/shall be as set forth in the bylaws of this corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XII  MANAGEMENT OF CORPORATE AFFAIRS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(a). Board of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The powers of this corporation shall be exercised, its properties controlled, and its affairs conducted by a board of [number of directors] directors. The number of directors provided for in this Certificate of Incorporation may be changed by a bylaw duly adopted by the members entitled to vote.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(b). Election of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The method of electing directors shall be [as follows: [specification of method of election]/as set forth in the bylaws].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(c). Elective Officers. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The officers of this corporation shall be a President, a Vice President, a secretary, and a treasurer. Other offices and officers may be established or appointed by members of this corporation at any regular annual meeting or any special meeting of members called for such purpose. The qualifications, the time, and manner of electing or appointing the duties of, the terms of office of, and the manner of removing officers shall be [as follows: [specification of manner of election]/as set forth in the bylaws].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(c). Committees. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>This corporation shall have at least two [type of committees] committees, as follows: The [name of authority] shall elect annually, from its members, an executive committee of [number of persons] persons and an admission committee of [number of persons] persons. The powers and duties of these committees shall be as specified in the bylaws. Other committees and their powers and duties may be specified in the bylaws or may be appointed from time to time by the [name of authority].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XIII  INCOME FROM PUBLIC EVENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>If this [club/association/[title of entity]] holds any events in which members of the general public are invited to participate for a fee, the net proceeds, if any, attributable to such participation by nonmembers will be paid over to an organization that is exempt from federal income tax under ►<field>st.ref.id="I003T8Z"</field>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of [identification of year] on an annual basis, unless this corporation itself is a tax-exempt organization under ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MDV"</field>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XIV  BYLAWS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>Bylaws shall be hereafter adopted at the first meeting of the Board of Directors. Such bylaws may be amended or repealed, in whole or in part, by action of the Board of Directors or by the members at any regular or special meeting of the members called for such purpose. Any duly enacted amendments to the bylaws shall be binding on all members of this corporation, including those who may have voted against them.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XV  AMENDMENT OF CERTIFICATE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>Amendments to this Certificate of Incorporation may be proposed by a resolution adopted by the Board of Directors and presented to a quorum of the members for their vote at an annual meeting or any special meeting called for such purpose. Amendments may be adopted by a vote of at least [two-thirds/[number of voting members]] of a quorum of members present and voting either in person or by proxy.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XVI  DISSOLUTION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>This corporation shall be dissolved and its affairs wound up [specification of manner of voluntary dissolution].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The method of distribution of assets on dissolution shall be [as follows [specification of method of dissolution]/as set forth in the bylaws].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XVII  MISCELLANEOUS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>[Text of additional provisions].

Notes to Form

ARTICLE I. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I003TA7"</field>N-PCL &s;§301<trace.deleted/> sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006MF3"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009FJZ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>164 to 176</trace>
ARTICLES II and XIII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>If the incorporated club wishes also to operate as an organization exempt from the payment of federal and state income taxes, it should be remembered that the tax exemption provided by ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8OV"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(a) for organizations described in ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1TR"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(c)(7) applies only to clubs that are organized and operated exclusively for pleasure, recreation, and other nonprofitable purposes but does not apply to any club if any part of its net earnings inures to the benefit of any private shareholder. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HUYN"</field>26 C.F.R. &s;§1.501(c)(7)-1(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The certificate of incorporation is discussed in ►<field>x.ref.id="I05YDX8"</field>&ss;§§30:68 et seq.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>Checklists of matters that must and may be included in the certificate of incorporation are set forth in ►<field>x.ref.id="I05U67W"</field>&ss;§§30:55, 30:56.
ARTICLE III. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>A corporation may be formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FK1"</field>N-PCL &s;§201.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8OX"</field>N-PCL &s;§202.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00F1TT"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>57, 58</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>421</trace>
ARTICLE IV. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003TFX"</field>N-PCL &s;§201.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>For complete discussion of types of not-for-profit corporations, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I006MKT"</field>&s;§30:35.
ARTICLE VI. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The board of directors of a not-for-profit corporation must consist of three or more directors; the initial number of directors is implied by the listing of names and addresses of the initial directors in the certificate of incorporation. Thereafter, the number (never less than three) may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or of the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number of directors will be three. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FPP"</field>N-PCL &s;§702(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I003TFZ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§7<trace>1</trace>
ARTICLE VIII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MKV"</field>N-PCL &s;§304(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State. <trace>The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. </trace>►<field>st.ref.id="I009FPR"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a)(6).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C8UN"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§7<trace>1</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>1062</trace>
ARTICLE IX. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1ZJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(a). In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation (see ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HV4F"</field>N-PCL &s;§304(a)) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00KO9B"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(a)(7).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The corporation's registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed, or authorized to conduct business, in the State of New York, under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law or other state statute. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00NHE7"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I003TG2"</field>N-PCL &s;§306.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MKY"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(b). This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FPU"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§801(b)(8), 802(c)(3).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00F1ZM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1062, 1063</trace>
ARTICLE XVI. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>A nonjudicial dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation must be initiated by the adoption by its board of directors of a plan for its dissolution and the distribution of its assets. This plan must implement any provision in the certificate of incorporation prescribing the distributive rights of its members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003TG4"</field>N-PCL &s;§1001(a). If the corporation is a charitable corporation and has no assets to distribute and no liabilities at the time of dissolution, the plan of dissolution must include a statement to that effect. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006ML0"</field>N-PCL &s;§1001(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>Upon adopting a plan of dissolution and distribution of assets, the board must submit it to a vote of the members. The plan must be approved at a meeting of members by two-thirds vote as provided by statute, provided, however, that if the corporation is a charitable corporation, other than a corporation incorporated pursuant to the law governing public cemetery corporations, the vote required by the corporation's board of directors for adoption of the plan of dissolution of such a corporation or by the corporation's members for the authorization thereof will be:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>(1) In the case of a vote by the board of directors: (i) the number of directors required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law; or (ii) if the number of directors actually holding office as such at the time of the vote to adopt the plan is less than the number required to constitute a quorum of directors under the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or any other applicable law, the remaining directors unanimously; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>(2) In the case of a vote by the members, (i) the number of members required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law; or (ii) by the vote of members authorized by an order of the Supreme Court pursuant to statute permitting the corporation to dispense with the applicable quorum requirement. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FPW"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(a). If there are no members entitled to vote on the dissolution of the corporation, the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets is deemed authorized upon its adoption by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8US"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>Whenever a statute creating or authorizing the formation of a corporation requires approval by a governmental body or officer for the formation of such corporation, dissolution may not be authorized without the approval of such body or officer. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003TG6"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The plan of dissolution and distribution of assets must have annexed thereto the approval of the Attorney General in the case of a charitable corporation and in the case of any noncharitable corporation which holds assets at the time of dissolution legally required to be used for a particular purpose. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006ML2"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(d)(1). Application to the Attorney General for such approval is by verified petition, with the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets and certified copies of the consents prescribed by this provision annexed thereto. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FPY"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(d)(2).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>In lieu of the vote of members referred to above, nonjudicial dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation can be effected by written or electronic consent of the members without a meeting, as the statute states that whenever members may take action by vote, such action may be taken without a meeting on written or electronic consent of all the members entitled to vote thereon. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8UU"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(a). Written or electronic consent thus given by all members entitled to vote has the same effect as a unanimous vote of members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1ZQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(b). Moreover, when there are no members of record, such action may be taken on the written consent signed by a majority in interest of the subscribers for capital certificates whose subscriptions have been accepted or their successors in interest or, if no subscription has been accepted, on the written consent signed by the incorporator or a majority of the incorporators. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HV4M"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(c). Under such circumstances, when there are two or more incorporators, if any dies or is for any reason unable to act, the other or others may act, but, if there is no incorporator able to act, any person for whom an incorporator was acting as agent may act in his or her stead, or, if such other person also dies or is for any reason unable to act, his or her legal representative may act. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00KO9I"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law makes special provisions for the dissolution of an incorporated firefighter's benevolent association created by act of the legislature. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003THC"</field>N-PCL &s;§1013. Likewise, special statutory provisions exist for the dissolution of a Young Men's or a Young Women's Christian Association which ceases to carry out the objects set forth in its certificate of incorporation, according to the general rules of the national board of such associations, or abandons or discontinues for one year the use of any of its property for such objects. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MM8"</field>N-PCL &s;§1404(d).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05YDIY"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>
ARTICLE XVII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05U5TM"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"</field>The additional provisions should only be provisions required or permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for the regulations of the internal affairs of a corporation.

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54a13601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF [NAME OF CORPORATION] UNDER ►<field>st.ref.id="I05PY4A"</field>SECTION 402 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>We, the undersigned, acting as incorporators of a corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, do hereby adopt the following Certificate of Incorporation for such corporation:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  NAME
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The name of the corporation is [name of corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  NOT-FOR-PROFIT STATUS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>This corporation is a &ldquo;“corporation&rdquo;” as defined in ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8W2"</field>Subparagraph (a)(5) of Section 102 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  PURPOSES AND POWERS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The specific and primary purposes for which this corporation is organized are as follows:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>To unite the graduates of the [name of hospital] School of Nursing in order to promote the highest excellence in the science and art of nursing and to cultivate closer professional relationship and good fellowship among the graduates of the school.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>To advance the interest of the [name of hospital] School of Nursing in the expectation and hope of making it one of the foremost among institutions of its type in the United States.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>To cooperate with District No. [number of district] of the [name of state nurses' association] and with the American Nurses Association in the promotion of the professional and educational enhancement of nursing.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(d). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>To extend aid to those in need and to provide for the care of sick members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(e). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>To create, manage, and control a fund, to be known as the &ldquo;“Alumni Fund,&rdquo;” and for that purpose acquire and hold real and personal property. The principal of such fund, or the income to be derived therefrom, may be transferred to the [name of hospital] School of Nursing, or used for and applied to such object or objects connected with the [name of hospital] School of Nursing as the alumni corporation shall direct.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(f). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>This corporation shall have and exercise all rights and powers conferred upon not-for-profit corporations under the laws of the State of New York, generally, and specifically as provided in ►<field>st.ref.id="I003TN2"</field>Section 202 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, provided, however, that this corporation is not empowered to engage in any activity that in itself is not in furtherance of its purposes as set forth in subparagraphs (a) through (e) of this Article III.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  CORPORATE TYPE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The corporation shall be a [charitable/noncharitable] corporation under ►<field>st.ref.id="I05YD7I"</field>Section 201 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  LOCATION OF CORPORATE OFFICE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The office of the corporation shall be located in [name of county], New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>[OPTIONAL: The books and records of account kept by the corporation pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I05U5I6"</field>Section 621 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law shall be kept at an office outside the state, which office shall be located at [address of office], [name of city], [name of state] [zip code of office].]

►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  DURATION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The duration of this corporation shall be [perpetual/from the date this certificate is filed by the Department of State until [date of expiration]/[specification of time period] from the date of filing of this certificate of incorporation/[specification of duration of corporation]].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VIII  DESIGNATION OF SECRETARY OF STATE ASGENT FOR SERVICE OF PROCESS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The corporation designates the Secretary of State of the State of New York as its agent upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address of the corporation [within/outside] the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State is as follows: [mailing address of corporation], [name of city], [name of state] [zip code of corporation].<trace> <finstr>[OPTIONAL: The email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been served electronically upon the Secretary of State is: [email address of corporation]]</finstr>.</trace>

►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IX  DESIGNATION OF REGISTERED AGENT FORSERVICE OF PROCESS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>[OPTIONAL: The corporation additionally designates [[name of individual], whose post office address is [post office address of individual], [name of city], State of New York [zip code of individual]/[name of corporation], incorporated under the laws of the State of New York/a foreign corporation authorized to do business in the State of New York, with offices at [office address of foreign corporation], [name of city], [name of county], State of New York [zip code of office]] as its agent upon whom process against it may be served.]
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE X  APPROVALS AND CONSENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The corporation [is/is not] formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. [No consent or approval is required/Such consent or approval is attached].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XI  POWERS, DUTIES, AND PRIVILEGES OF MEMBERS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The powers, duties, and privileges of the members of the corporation shall be such as are specified in the bylaws of the corporation. All provisions in this certificate of incorporation, or in the bylaws of the corporation, for the regulation and conduct of the affairs of the corporation and the qualifications for membership in the corporation are expressly intended to be in furtherance, and not in limitation or exclusion, of the powers conferred by statute.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XII  ALUMNI FUND
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The Board of Directors shall have the custody and management of the Alumni Fund but shall not dispose of the whole or any part of the principal of any invested fund except as authorized by a two-thirds vote of the members of the corporation present at an annual meeting of such members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XIII  BYLAWS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>Bylaws will be hereafter adopted at the first meeting of the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors of the corporation may adopt, alter, and repeal any bylaw, subject to the power of the members of the corporation to change or repeal same.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XIV  AMENDMENT OF CERTIFICATE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>Amendments to this certificate of incorporation may be proposed by a resolution adopted by the Board of Directors and presented to a quorum of the members for their vote at an annual meeting or any special meeting called for such purpose. Amendments may be adopted by a vote of at least [two-thirds/[number of voting members]] of a quorum of members present and voting [either in person/by proxy].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XV  DISSOLUTION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>This corporation shall be dissolved and its affairs wound up [specification of manner of voluntary dissolution].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The method of distribution of assets on dissolution shall be as set forth in the bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XVI  MISCELLANEOUS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>[List of additional provisions required or permitted to be set forth in certificate of incorporation by N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for regulation of internal affairs of corporation].

Notes to Form

Tax Notes 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>Incorporating under a not-for-profit act does not automatically cause a corporation to be tax-exempt. It must also meet the Code requirements for exempt organizations, including those governing both the formal documents establishing the organization and the operational requirements for the organizations. Each organization must meet the specific requirements of the tax law that governs its type. Even if tax-exempt, a corporation is taxed on its unrelated business income.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>Alumni associations are exempt if they are organized to promote the welfare of the university, are operated as an integral part of the university, and are subject to the control of the university insofar as policies and disbursements are concerned. ►<field>st.ref.id="I003TOF"</field>Rev. Rul. 60-143, 1960-1 C.B. 192.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The alumni of any college or university or of one or more colleges or schools of any university may be incorporated by executing and filing a certificate pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MTB"</field>Article 4 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. Such a corporation is considered a special not-for-profit corporation. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FY7"</field>N-PCL &s;§1407(a).
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The certificate of incorporation is discussed in ►<field>x.ref.id="I00C933"</field>&ss;§§30:68 et seq.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>Checklists of matters that must and may be included in the certificate of incorporation are set forth in ►<field>x.ref.id="I00F27Z"</field>&ss;§§30:55, 30:56.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00HVCV"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I003TOH"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>58</trace>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"</field>The section of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law that makes provision for alumni corporations set forth no requirements as to consents or approvals. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FY9"</field>N-PCL &s;§1407.

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|78|30:72"</field>Every certificate or other instrument which is required under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law to be signed and delivered to the Department of State for filing shall, except as otherwise specified in the section providing for such certificate, be signed either by an officer, director, attorney-in-fact or duly authorized person. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0041JJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§104(d).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|78|30:72"</field>The name and the capacity in which any person signs such certificate must be included in the certificate. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006UOF"</field>N-PCL &s;§104(d).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|78|30:72"</field>With respect to paragraph A in the foregoing form, note that written or electronic consent given by all the members entitled to vote thereon has the same effect as a unanimous vote of such members, and any certificate delivered to the Department of State, with respect to such authorization, must recite that the authorization was by unanimous written consent. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009NTB"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(b).

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|79|30:73"</field>If the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an existing unincorporated association or group, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0041JO"</field>N-PCL &s;§402(b).

(2) Purpose Clause for Particular Types of Social Clubs or Associations
30:74. Athletic club
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54afdc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|80|30:74"</field>The specific and primary purposes for which this club is formed are to promote and encourage all kinds of field and athletic sports; to promote and encourage the sport, pleasure, exercise, and recreation of its members; to establish and maintain an athletic club to provide for the enjoyment, entertainment, and physical improvement and fitness of its members; to promote sociability and friendship among its members; and to manage and conduct entertainments, excursions, and social meetings.

30:75. Glider club
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54b24d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"</field>The specific and primary purposes for which this club is formed are to promote and encourage interest in aviation and particularly motorless flight, soaring, and glider operation and all allied sciences for the benefit of members of the Corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"</field>To purchase, lease, or otherwise acquire and own, use, and operate and sell or otherwise dispose of real and personal property, including but not limited to airplanes, gliders, sail planes, airports, hangars, and all other aircraft equipment and services for this equipment that may be incidental to the use and operation of the equipment, along with any other real or personal property or other facilities that may be required for the use of its members.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"</field>To do any other act or thing incidental to or connected with the foregoing purposes or in advancement of these purposes, but not for profit.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"</field>The enumeration of the specific purposes and powers in this statement of purpose does not limit or restrict the general powers of the Corporation and the enjoyment or exercise of these powers, as conferred by the laws of the State of New York upon corporations organized under the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.

30:76. Inline skating club
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54b4be01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|82|30:76"</field>The specific and primary purposes for which this club is formed are to promote and encourage the sport of inline skating; to encourage the pleasure, exercise, and recreation of its members; to organize and sponsor club outings and other social activities; to promote the construction and maintenance of paths appropriate for or dedicated to inline skating; to collect and disseminate information valuable to inline skaters of New York; to maintain a clubhouse for social enjoyment; to purchase, lease, and improve real estate or other property that may be required for the maintenance of a clubhouse; and to promote sociability and friendship among its members.

<trace>30:77.50. Civic pride</trace>

<trace>The purposes for which this corporation is formed are: (a) to promote civic pride in the <finstr>[type of municipality]</finstr> of <finstr>[name of municipality]</finstr> and surrounding communities for the benefit of all citizens of the area through the sponsorship of community-related activities or events both sporting and social ; and (b) to do any other act or thing incidental to or connected with the foregoing purposes or in advancement thereof, but not for the pecuniary profit or financial gain of its members, directors, or officers, except as permitted under Article 5 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York</trace>

MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54c84601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"</field>The [name of party] Party Central Committee of [name of county], referred to below as the Committee, shall be the official body and representative of the [name of party] Party in [name of county] and shall perform the duties imposed on it by statute. The Committee is charged by law with the management and control of the Party campaigns in the county under the general direction of the State Central Committee of the [name of party] Party, and, to carry out that duty, the Committee shall do everything it considers necessary and desirable:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"</field>To seek, develop, and elect [name of party] Party candidates at every election;
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"</field>To strengthen the [name of party] Party in every way, particularly by establishing and supporting viable constituent organizations within each legislative district in the county by creating and maintaining official and permanent precinct and campaign organizations throughout the county, by maintaining proper liaison with the state central committee and with all recognized volunteer organizations in the county, and by making known the position of the [name of party] Party on national, state, and local issues, after proper consideration of national and state party platforms and policy, and on such other issues as the committee deems to be appropriate;
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"</field>To maintain the official fund-raising organization for the [name of party] Party within the county; and
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(d). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"</field>To perform other duties and services for the [name of party] Party.

<trace>30:87.50. Youth sports</trace>
