<trace>FTR</trace>
<trace>COL</trace>
<trace>NFP</trace>
<trace>CLS</trace>
<trace>TEM</trace>
<trace>MTD</trace>
<trace> The purpose of the Corporation is to promote youth boys ’ and girls’ sports in the <finstr>[specification of geographic area]</finstr> area and to further promote the development of leadership, sportsmanship, tolerance, discipline, athlet ic ability and to nurture youth fitness, service to the community, and love of sports. The organization is specifically organized for charitable and educational purposes, mores specifically to educate the youth of <finstr>[specification of geographic area]</finstr> regarding fitness, sportsmanship, and a variety of sports.</trace>

►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|94|30:88"</field>To promote fellowship and extend acquaintances by means of social gatherings and lectures.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|94|30:88"</field>To promote social intercourse among the members by means of dances, dinners, musicals, and other kindred forms of entertainment.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|94|30:88"</field>To engage, generally, in any causes or objects similar to the above-mentioned in order to promote the cultural, social, literary, and mental welfare of the members.

30:92. Wildlife conservation society
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id54e59201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|98|30:92"</field>The specific and primary purposes for which this [society/[type of entity]] is formed are to dedicate itself by social and educational means to the conservation and propagation of the fish, game, and wildlife of the State of New York and throughout the United States of America; to support true sportsmanship in a lawful manner among those who hunt and fish; to promote and encourage field sports and good fellowship; to encourage support of the fish and game laws of the State of New York and of the nation; to work for the respect and acknowledgment of just rights of property owners; and to work for, support, and encourage a close relationship between property owners and sportsmen.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"</field>To solicit, collect, and otherwise raise money or other property and distribute it as may be deemed best for the promotion of conservation.

30:96.50. Provision of shelter to stray animals
CLS
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="I0cf764a03b7b11ee89ac8b38cb0993c7"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|104|30:96.50"</field>The purpose for which this non-profit [type of entity] is formed is to prevent cruelty to unwanted animals by providing shelter and care for lost, stray and abandoned animals. This [type of entity] is not organized for the private gain of any person. The specific purposes for which this corporation is formed are exclusively charitable within the meaning of ►<field>st.ref.id="I0042KE"</field>&s;§501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.
Notes to Form

<trace.deleted/>
<trace.deleted/>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|104|30:96.50"</field>The New York Not-for-Profit Corporations Law specially defines corporation to exclude any purpose that is for pecuniary profit or financial gain, and prohibits use of corporate assets, income, or profit to benefit members, directors or officers (except to the extent otherwise permitted by statute). ►<field>st.ref.id="I006VPA"</field>N-PCL &s;§102(a)(5).

<trace>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"</field>For complete discussion of purposes, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05XVTK"</field>&s;§30:35.</trace>

<trace>30:24.50. LGBT social club</trace>
<trace>FCV</trace>
<trace>FTR</trace>
<trace>COL</trace>
<trace>NFP</trace>
<trace>CLS</trace>
<trace>TEM</trace>
<trace>MTD</trace>
<trace> ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="I9aa137003fa111e6b356a92de1b1c32a"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>This association is formed for the purpose of providing its members who identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transexual (&ldquo;“LGBT&rdquo;”) a social gathering organization. This association will be authorized as follows:</trace>
<trace> </trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>A. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To operate and manage the association to provide a support and educational organization for the LGBT community;</trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>B. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To organize social gathering for the association;</trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>C. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To organize public forums and gatherings to educate on LGBT issues;</trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>D. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To provide opportunities for networking for business and other purposes among LGBT members;</trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>E. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To plan weekend or other trips for the association members;</trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>F. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To raise funds and provide other support for the LGBT community; and</trace>
<trace>►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>G. </trace>
<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"</field>To take any other action or provide any other support as the members deem proper and necessary.</trace>
<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"</field>For complete discussion of purposes, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05XVTK"</field>&s;§30:35.</trace>

b. Bylaws
(1) In General
30:97. Bylaws-- Social club

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id550a3101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>BYLAWS OF [NAME OF CLUB] A NEW YORK NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Address of club], [name of city], [name of county]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>State of New York
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  OFFICES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.1. Principal Office. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The principal office of the club in the State of New York shall be located at [office address of club], in [name of city], [name of county].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.2. Other Offices. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The club may have such other offices, either within or outside [name of county], State of New York, as the board of trustees may determine or as the affairs of the club may require from time to time.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.1. Classes of Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The club shall have [number of classes] [class/classes] of members. The designation of such [class/classes] and the qualifications and rights of the members of such [class/classes] shall be as follows: [list of designation], [list of qualifications] and [list of rights of members].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.2. Admission. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>An applicant will be admitted to membership in the club only on making application for such membership and on being elected by the board of directors. Applications for membership will be in such form as shall be prescribed by the board of directors. An affirmative vote of [number of members] members of the board of directors will be required for election.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.3. Voting Rights. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Each member will be entitled to one vote on each matter submitted to a vote of the members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4. Suspension or Expulsion of Members. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>If a complaint against any member shall be signed by [number of members] other members and filed with the secretary, the secretary shall bring the matter to the notice of the board of directors within [number of days] days of the date of the complaint. The board of directors shall then request an explanation from the accused member, and if the accused member fails to explain or, after a fair hearing, is unable to justify his or her conduct, the board of directors is empowered to inflict a fine or to pass a resolution suspending or expelling the accused member from the club [OPTIONAL: such resolution not to take effect until affirmed by a majority vote of the board of directors specially summoned to consider the resolution].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(a). Grounds for Suspension. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A majority of the board of directors shall have power to suspend or expel members for willful infractions of the house rules or of any bylaw of the club, for acts or conduct that they may deem disorderly or injurious or hostile to the interests of the objects of the club, or for acts or conduct calculated to disturb the order, peace, or harmony of the club or to impair the good name of the club.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(b). Appeal by Member. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The offender may appeal from the sentence of suspension or expulsion, as provided in these bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(b)(1). Preliminary Notice and Hearing. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Prior to the expulsion or suspension of a member, the member shall be entitled to a notice and hearing before the board of directors or before a committee of the board of directors, whichever the accused member may elect.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(b)(2). Notice of Appeal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A member expelled or suspended from the club by determination of the board of directors may appeal such action within [number of days] days after notice of the determination is posted on the bulletin board, by filing with the secretary a written notice of his or her appeal and the reasons supporting such appeal.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(b)(3). Time for Hearing Appeal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>All appeals shall be heard at a meeting of the membership, to be called for that purpose by the board of directors, within [number of days] days after notice of the appeal has been filed with the secretary.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(b)(4). Procedure. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The President or Vice President shall preside at such meetings, and the cause of suspension or expulsion shall be reported in writing by the board of directors, with a statement of facts on which their determination was founded, a copy of which will be furnished to the appellant at least [number of days] days before the meeting, at which time a copy of the determination shall also be filed with the secretary. At the appeal meeting, the appellant shall present his or her defense in writing, to which one member of the board of directors may reply orally. The appellant or any one member in the appellant's behalf may then answer orally, and a director may speak in support of the charge; thereafter, no further discussion will be allowed.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.4(b)(5). Disposition of Appeal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The presiding officer shall then put the question to the membership, as follows: &ldquo;“Shall the determination of the board of directors in this case be affirmed?&rdquo;” If a majority of those present vote in the affirmative, the determination will stand as the final judgment of the club. If less than a majority of those present vote in the affirmative, then the determination of the board of directors will be reversed and the appellant will be immediately restored to full membership rights and privileges, and the board of directors shall be precluded from again suspending or expelling the member for the same offense based on the same facts and occurring at the same time and place as alleged in the original complaint.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.5. Resignation. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any member may resign by filing a written resignation with the secretary, but such resignation shall not relieve the member so resigning of the obligation to pay any dues, assessments, or other charges theretofore accrued and unpaid.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.6. Reinstatement. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>On written request signed by a former member and filed with the secretary, the board of directors may, by the affirmative vote of two-thirds of the members of the board, reinstate such former member to membership on such terms as the board of directors may deem appropriate.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.7. Transfer of Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Membership in this club [is/is not] [transferable/assignable]. [OPTIONAL: However, no such transfer is valid unless the proposed transfer is submitted to the board of directors in writing and is approved by a majority vote of the entire board. No such transfer shall become effective until the secretary of the club is notified of the transfer in writing. The secretary must then record the transfer in the membership book. In no event, however, shall membership certificates issued by the club be transferable. Upon transfer of membership, the transferring member shall surrender his or her membership certificate, and a new certificate shall be issued to the transferee.]
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.8. Termination of Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Membership will terminate on the death or resignation of a member, the transfer of his or her membership in accordance with these bylaws, or on the member's expulsion by the board of directors. Upon such termination, any right, title, or interest of the member in or to the property and assets of the club will cease.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  MEETINGS OF MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.1. Annual Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>An annual meeting of the members shall be held on the [ordinal number of day] day in the month of [name of month] in each year, at the hour of [time of annual meeting], for the purpose of electing directors and for the transaction of such other business as may come before the meeting. If the day fixed for the annual meeting shall be a legal holiday in the State of New York, such meeting shall be held on the next succeeding business day. If the election of directors shall not be held on the day designated in these bylaws for any annual meeting or at any adjournment thereof, the board of directors shall cause the election to be held at a special meeting of the members as soon thereafter as is convenient.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.2. Special Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the President, a majority of the board of directors, or not less than [fraction of votes] of the members having voting rights.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.3. Place of Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors may designate any place, either within or outside the State of New York, as the place of meeting for any annual meeting or for any special meeting called by the board of directors. If no designation is made or if a special meeting be otherwise called, the place of meeting shall be the registered office of the club in the State of New York. However, if all of the members shall meet at any time and place, either within or outside the State of New York, and consent to the holding of a meeting, such meeting shall be valid without call or notice, and at such meeting any corporate action may be taken.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.4. Notice of Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Written or printed notice stating the place, day, and hour of any meeting of members shall be delivered, either personally or by mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting, not less than [number of days] nor more than [number of days] days before the date of such meeting, or in the case of a removal of one or more directors, a merger, consolidation, dissolution, or sale, lease, or exchange of assets not less than [number of days] nor more than [number of days] days before the date of such meeting, by or at the direction of the President, the secretary, or the officers or persons calling the meeting. In case of a special meeting or when required by statute or by these bylaws, the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called shall be stated in the notice. If mailed, the notice of a meeting shall be deemed to be delivered when deposited in the United States mail addressed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the records of the club, with postage prepaid.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.5. Informal Action by Members. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any action required by law to be taken at a meeting of the members or any action that may be taken at a meeting of members may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing, setting forth the action to be taken, shall be signed by all of the members entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter thereof.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.6. Quorum. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The members holding [percentage of votes]&percnt;% of the votes that may be cast at any meeting shall constitute a quorum at such meeting. If a quorum is not present at any meeting of members, a majority of the members present may adjourn the meeting from time to time without further notice.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.7. Proxies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>At any meeting of members, a member entitled to vote may vote by proxy executed in writing by the member or by his or her authorized attorney in fact. No proxy shall be valid after [specification of time period] from the date of its execution, unless otherwise provided in the proxy.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.8. Voting by Mail. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Where directors are to be elected by members, such election may be conducted by mail in such manner as the board of directors shall determine.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.9. Cumulative Voting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>At any election for directors of the club, each and every member entitled to vote may cumulate his or her vote by giving one candidate as many votes as the number of such directors multiplied by his or her vote shall equal or by distributing such votes on the same principle among any number of such candidates. Any member who intends to cumulate his or her votes shall give written notice of such intention to the secretary of the club on or before the day preceding the election at which such member intends to cumulate his or her votes.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  BOARD OF DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.1. General Powers. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The affairs of the club shall be managed by its board of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.2. Number, Tenure, and Qualifications. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The number of directors shall be [number of directors]. Directors shall be elected at each annual meeting of members, and each director shall hold office until the next annual meeting of members and until his or her successor shall have been elected and qualified. Directors [must/need not] be members of the club.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.3. Regular Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>[The board of directors shall hold regular meetings at least once a month on such date and at such hour as may, from time to time, be agreed upon/A regular annual meeting of the board of directors shall be held without other notice than this bylaw, immediately after, and at the same place, as the annual meeting of members]. The board of directors may provide by resolution the time and place, either within or outside the State of New York, for the holding of additional regular meetings of the board without other notice than such resolution.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.4. Special Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Special meetings of the board of directors may be called by or at the request of the President or any [number of directors] directors. The person or persons authorized to call special meetings of the board may fix any place, either within or outside the state, as the place for holding any special meeting of the board called by them.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.5. Telephone Conference Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any or all directors may participate in a meeting of the board or a committee of the board by means of conference telephone or any means of communication by which all persons participating in the meeting are able to hear each other.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.6. Notice. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Notice of any special meeting of the board of directors shall be given at least [specification of time period] prior to such meeting by written notice delivered personally or sent by mail or telegram to each director at his or her address as shown by the records of the club. If mailed, such notice shall be deemed to be delivered when deposited in the United States mail in a sealed envelope so addressed, with postage prepaid. If notice be given by telegram, such notice shall be deemed to be delivered when the telegram is delivered to the telegraph company. Any director may waive notice of any meeting. The attendance of a director at any meeting will constitute a waiver of notice of such meeting, except where a director attends a meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business because the meeting is not lawfully called or convened. The business to be transacted at the meeting need not be specified in the notice or waiver of notice of such meeting, unless specifically required by law or by these bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.7. Quorum. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A majority of the board of directors shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at any meeting of the board, but, if less than a majority of the directors are present at the meeting, a majority of the directors present may adjourn the meeting from time to time without further notice.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.8. Manner of Acting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The act of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present shall be the act of the board of directors, unless the act of a greater number is required by law or by these bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.10. Vacancies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any vacancy occurring in the board of directors shall be filled by the affirmative vote of a majority of the remaining directors though less than a quorum of the board of directors. A director elected to fill a vacancy shall hold office until the next annual meeting at which the election of directors is in the regular order of business and until his or her successor is elected or appointed and qualified.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any directorship to be filled by reason of an increase in the number of directors shall be filled by election at an annual meeting or at a special meeting of members called for that purpose. If no members have the right to vote, the directorship shall be filled by [description of procedure of filling up vacancy].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.11. Compensation. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>[The board of directors, by the affirmative vote of a majority of the directors then in office, shall have the authority to establish reasonable compensation of all directors for services to the club as directors, officers, or otherwise/Directors as such shall not receive any stated salaries for their services as directors, but, by resolution of the board of directors, a fixed sum and expenses of attendance, if any, may be allowed for attendance at such regular and special meetings of the board; but nothing in these bylaws shall be construed to preclude any director from serving the club in any other capacity and receiving compensation for such service/Directors as such shall not receive any stated salaries for their services, but] by resolution of the board of directors, any director may be indemnified for expenses and costs, including attorney's fees, actually and necessarily incurred in connection with any claim asserted against that director, by action in court or otherwise, by reason of his or her being or having been such director, except in relation to matters as to which he or she shall have been guilty of negligence or misconduct in respect of the matter in which indemnity is sought.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.1. Officers. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The officers of the club shall be a President, one or more Vice Presidents (the number to be determined by the board of directors), a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as may be elected in accordance with the provisions of this article. The board of directors may elect or appoint such other officers, including one or more assistant secretaries and one or more assistant treasurers, as it shall deem desirable, such officers to have the authority and to perform the duties prescribed, from time to time, by the board of directors. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, provided that no officer shall execute, acknowledge, or verify any instrument in more than one capacity if the instrument is required by law or by these bylaws to be executed, acknowledged, or verified by two or more officers.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.2. Election and Term of Office. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The officers of the club shall be elected annually by the board of directors at the regular annual meeting of the board of directors. If the election of officers shall not be held at such meeting, such election shall be held as soon thereafter as is convenient. New offices may be created and filled at any meeting of the board of directors. Each officer shall hold office until his or her successor shall have been elected and qualified.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.3. Removal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any officer elected or appointed by the board of directors may be removed by the board of directors whenever in its judgment the best interests of the club would be served thereby, but such removal shall be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the officer so removed.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.4. Vacancies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A vacancy in any office because of death, resignation, removal, disqualification, or otherwise may be filled by the board of directors for the unexpired portion of the term.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.5. President. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The President shall be the principal executive officer of the club and shall, in general, supervise and control all of the business and affairs of the club. The President shall preside at all meetings of the members and of the board of directors. The President may sign, with the secretary or any other proper officer of the club authorized by the board of directors, any deeds, mortgages, bonds, contracts, or other instruments that the board of directors have authorized to be executed, except in cases where the signing and execution thereof shall be expressly delegated by the board of directors or by these bylaws or by statute to some other officer or agent of the club. In general, the President shall perform all duties incident to the office of President and such other duties as may be prescribed by the board of directors from time to time.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.6. Vice President. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>In the absence of the President or in event of an inability or refusal to act, the [Vice President/Vice Presidents in the order of their election] shall perform the duties of the President and, when so acting, shall have all the powers of and be subject to all the restrictions on the President. Any Vice President shall perform such other duties as, from time to time, may be assigned by the President or by the board of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.7. Treasurer. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>If required by the board of directors, the treasurer shall give a bond for the faithful discharge of his or her duties in such sum and with such surety or sureties as the board of directors shall determine. The treasurer shall have charge and custody of and be responsible for all funds and securities of the club; receive and give receipts for money due and payable to the club from any source whatsoever, and deposit all such monies in the name of the club in such banks, trust companies, or other depositories as shall be selected by the board of directors and, in general, perform all the duties incident to the office of treasurer and such other duties as, from time to time, may be assigned by the President or by the board of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.8. Secretary. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The secretary shall keep the minutes of the meetings of the members and of the board of directors in one or more books provided for that purpose; see that all notices are given in accordance with the provisions of these bylaws or as required by law; be custodian of the corporate records and of the corporate seal of the club and see that the corporate seal of the club is affixed to all documents, the execution of which on behalf of the club under its seal is authorized in accordance with the provisions of these bylaws; keep a register of the post office address of each member which shall be furnished to the secretary by such member; and in general perform all duties incident to the office of secretary and such other duties as, from time to time, may be assigned by the President or by the board of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.9. Assistant Treasurers and Assistant Secretaries. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>If required by the board of directors, the assistant treasurers shall give bonds for the faithful discharge of their duties in such sums and with such sureties as the board of directors shall determine. The assistant treasurers and assistant secretaries, in general, shall perform such duties as shall be assigned to them by the treasurer or the secretary or by the President or the board of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VI  COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.1. Executive Committee. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Internal management and conduct of the business of the club shall, by resolution adopted by a majority of the board of directors in office, be vested in an executive committee composed of [number of persons] persons. Members of the committee shall be appointed by resolution of the board of directors. [All/At least [number of members]] members of the committee shall be directors of the club. The executive committee is authorized to hire and discharge employees, to make all contracts and authorize all transactions in the ordinary course of business of the club, and to do all things necessary or incident thereto. This designation and the delegation thereto of authority shall not operate to relieve the board of directors or any individual director of any responsibility imposed by law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The executive committee may act by unanimous written agreement of its members or by a majority vote of its members at any regularly called meeting of which all members have had reasonable notice. The committee shall, at each regular meeting of the board of directors and from time to time when requested by the board, make a full report of all business transacted by the committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.2. Other Committees of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors, by resolution adopted by a majority of the directors in office, may designate other committees, each of which shall consist of two or more directors, which committees, to the extent provided in the resolution, shall have and shall exercise the authority of the board of directors. The designation of such committees and the delegation of authority to them shall not operate to relieve the board of directors or any individual director of any responsibility imposed by law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A committee designated may perform the functions of any officer and the functions of any two or more officers may be performed by a single committee, including the functions of both President and secretary.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.3. Other Committees. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Other committees not having and exercising the authority of the board of directors in the management of the club may be designated by a resolution adopted by a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present. [OPTIONAL: Except as otherwise provided in such resolution, members of each such committee shall be members of the club, and the President of the club shall appoint the members thereof.] Any member thereof may be removed by the person or persons authorized to appoint such member whenever in that person's or those persons' judgment the best interests of the club will be served by such removal.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.4. Term of Office. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Each member of a committee shall continue as such until the next annual meeting of the board of directors and until a successor is appointed, unless the committee shall be sooner terminated, or unless the member shall be removed from the committee, or unless the member shall cease to qualify as a member of the committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.5. Chair. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>One member of each committee shall be appointed to chair the committee by the person or persons authorized to appoint the committee members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.6. Vacancies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Vacancies in the membership of any committee may be filled by appointments made in the same manner as provided in the case of the original appointments.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.7. Quorum. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the resolution of the board of directors designating a committee, a majority of the whole committee shall constitute a quorum and the act of a majority of the members present at a meeting at which a quorum is present shall be the act of the committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.8. Rules. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Each committee may adopt rules for its own government not inconsistent with these bylaws or with rules adopted by the board of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  CONTRACTS, CHECKS, DEPOSITS, AND FUNDS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 7.1. Contracts. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors may authorize any officer or officers, agent or agents of the club, in addition to the officers so authorized by these bylaws, to enter into any contract or to execute and deliver any instrument in the name of and on behalf of the club, and such authority may be general or confined to specific instances.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 7.2. Checks, Drafts, or Orders for Payment. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>All checks, drafts, or orders for the payment of money, notes, or other evidences of indebtedness issued in the name of the club shall be signed by such officer or officers, agent, or agents of the club and in such manner as shall from time to time be determined by resolution of the board of directors. In the absence of such determination by the board of directors, such instruments shall be signed by the treasurer or an assistant treasurer and countersigned by the President or a Vice President of the club.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 7.3. Deposits. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>All funds of the club shall be deposited from time to time to the credit of the club in such banks, trust companies, or other depositaries as the board of directors may select.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 7.4. Gifts. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors may accept on behalf of the club any contribution, gift, bequest, or devise for the general purposes or for any special purpose of the club.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VIII  CERTIFICATES OF MEMBERSHIP
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 8.1. Certificate of Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors may provide for the issuance of certificates evidencing membership in the club, which shall be in such form as may be determined by the board. The certificates shall be signed by the President or a Vice President and by the secretary or an assistant secretary and shall be sealed with the seal of the club. All certificates evidencing membership of any class shall be consecutively numbered. The name and address of each member and the date of issuance of the certificate shall be entered on the records of the club. If any certificate shall become lost, mutilated, or destroyed, a new certificate may be issued on such terms and conditions as the board of directors may determine.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 8.2. Issuance of Certificates. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>If the board of directors shall have provided for the issuance of certificates of membership under the provisions of Section 8.1 when a member has been elected to membership and has paid any initiation fee and dues that may then be required, the secretary shall issue a certificate of membership in the new member's name and deliver it to the new member.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 8.3. Nontransferability of Certificates. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>In no event shall membership certificates issued by the club be transferable. Upon transfer of membership as provided in ARTICLE II of these bylaws, the transferring member shall surrender his or her membership certificate, and a new certificate shall be issued to the transferee.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IX  DUES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 9.1. Initiation Fee and Annual Dues. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors may determine from time to time the amount of initiation fee, if any, and annual dues payable to the club by members [OPTIONAL: of each class].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 9.2. Payment of Dues. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Dues shall be payable in advance of the first day of [name of month] in each fiscal year. Dues of a new member shall be prorated from the first day of the month in which such new member is elected to membership for the remainder of the fiscal year of the club.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 9.3. Default and Termination of Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>When any member [OPTIONAL: of any class] shall be in default in the payment of dues for a period of [number of months] months from the beginning of the fiscal year or period in which such dues become payable, his or her membership may be terminated by the board of directors in the manner provided in Article II of these bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE X  USE OF FACILITIES
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless specifically authorized by resolution of the board of directors limited as to date, time, and event or function, no person except a member of the club, the family of such member, and guests of the member, when in the company of the member, shall use the facilities owned or leased by the club. As used in these bylaws, the term &ldquo;“family&rdquo;” shall include only persons within the third degree of relationship either to the member or to the member's spouse.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XI  MISCELLANEOUS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 11.1. Books and Records. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The club shall keep correct and complete books and records of account and shall also keep minutes of the proceedings of its members, board of directors, and committees having any of the authority of the board of directors and shall keep at the registered or principal office a record giving the names and addresses of the members entitled to vote. All books and records of the club may be inspected by any member or his or her agent or attorney for any proper purpose at any reasonable time.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 11.2. Fiscal Year. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The fiscal year of the club shall begin on the first day of [name of month] and end on the last day of [name of month] in each year.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 11.3. Corporate Seal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors shall provide a corporate seal, which shall be in the form of [specification of form].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 11.4. Waiver of Notice. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Whenever any notice is required to be given under the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or under the provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws of the club, a waiver of such notice in writing signed by the person or persons entitled to such notice or transmitted electronically by electronic mail and setting forth information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the person or persons, whether before or after the time stated in the notice, shall be deemed equivalent to the giving of such notice.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XII  AMENDMENTS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 12.1. Power of Members to Amend Bylaws. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The bylaws of this club may be amended, repealed, or added to or new bylaws may be adopted [by the vote or written assent of [a majority/[percentage of members entitled to vote]&percnt;%] of the members entitled to vote/by the vote of [a majority/[percentage of quorum]&percnt;%] of a quorum at a meeting called for the purpose according to the certificate of incorporation or bylaws].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 12.2. Power of Directors to Amend Bylaws. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Subject to any limitations set forth in the certificate of incorporation, these bylaws, and the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law concerning corporate action that must be authorized or approved by the members of the club, the bylaws of this club may also be amended, repealed, or added to, or new bylaws may be adopted, by a resolution of the board of directors.
Notes to Form

Tax Notes 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The tax law defines social clubs as those in which the members are associated together in fellowship toward some common objective (►<field>st.ref.id="I05VNJW"</field>Rev. Rul. 67-428, 1967-2 C.B. 204) and, to be tax exempt, must be operated primarily for pleasure or recreational purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05RFUK"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(c)(7). Substantially all its activities must be for the purposes for which it was organized. Clubs engaging in an unrelated business run the risk of losing exempt status. No more than 35&percnt;% of a club's gross income can come from investment sources or from nonmembership sources. Furthermore, no more than 15&percnt;% of a club's gross income can come from use of a club's facilities by the public. None of the earnings of a club can inure to the benefit of a private shareholder.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>An exempt club is subject to one special requirement: Neither the charter nor bylaws nor any written policy of the club can provide for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color or religion. Two exceptions exist: (1) a club can discriminate on religious grounds if it limits its membership to a particular religion in order to further the principles of that religion. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05N858"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(i); or (2) an auxiliary of a fraternal benefit society that limits its membership to those of a particular religion may also discriminate on religious grounds.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A qualified social club is exempt from tax only on income from its exempt activities, that is, from amounts paid by its members. Investment income is taxed, as is all other unrelated business income. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056ML"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &ss;§§501(b), 512.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASWD"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§262) or business purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM19"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(a)(3). This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GF65"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§162(a). The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;“business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo;” It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8B1"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(e)(4).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;“clubs&rdquo;” that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club--dining and recreational facilities--the costs should be deductible as business expenses.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M1FX"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§170(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The situation under the estate tax is less categorical. Only contributions for public, religious, charitable, scientific, literary, educational, and certain other purposes are deductible. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056MN"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§2055(a). While this would seem to exclude contributions to most clubs, a bequest to trustees of a club to give financial assistance to the sick and unfortunate residents of a town was held deductible, as was a contribution to an art club devoted principally to educational activities. In the latter case, the club also provided incidental social activities, but this did not prevent the contribution from being deductible. ►<field>rc.ref.id="I007ZRJ"</field>Am. Jur. 2d, Federal Taxation &p;144,308.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>As to contents of bylaws, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00ASWF"</field>&s;§30:44. As to adoption of bylaws, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00DM1B"</field>&s;§30:45. For pertinent checklist concerning matters that may be covered in bylaws, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00GF67"</field>&s;§30:56.
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A club seeking exemption and which does not come under the exemption should include in both its bylaws and its charter (or articles of incorporation) a provision specifically prohibiting discrimination. Although the Tax Code does not require this, the inclusion of the provision will serve to show the intent of the members in this regard and will make obtaining and maintaining the exemption easier.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00J8B3"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384
ARTICLE II. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members or, in the case of a charitable corporation, may have no members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M1FZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(a). If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056MQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(b)<trace>.</trace> <trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASWI"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM1E"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§823</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 2.3. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, either absolutely or contingently, that the members of any class shall not be entitled to vote or may limit or define the matters on and the circumstances in which a member or a class of members shall be entitled to vote, and, except as otherwise provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, such provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws shall prevail, according to their tenor, in all elections and in all proceedings over the provisions of Chapter 6 of the Law which authorize any action by the members, but no such denial, limitation or definition of voting rights shall be effective unless, at the time, one or more classes of members, singly or in the aggregate, are entitled to full voting rights. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GF6A"</field>N-PCL &s;§612. See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00J8B6"</field>Gluck v. Chevre Liady Nusach Hoary, 97 A.D.3d 787, 949 N.Y.S.2d 149 (2d Dep't 2012) stating that given that not-for-profit corporation had only one member, Orthodox Jewish congregation, that member could not be deprived of the right to vote except via its removal or resignation as a member of corporation.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0056MS"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§916</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 2.4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. ►<field>cc.ref.id="I007ZRO"</field>Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00ASWK"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>831 to 834</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 2.7. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Membership certificates or cards shall not be transferable. If the certificate of incorporation or bylaws permits transfer of membership, upon each such transfer the certificate or card issued to a former member shall be surrendered, and a new certificate or card shall be issued to the new member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM1G"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(d).
ARTICLE II, 
Section 2.8. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, membership in a not-for-profit corporation shall by terminated by death, resignation, expulsion, expiration of a term of membership, or dissolution and liquidation under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GF6C"</field>Articles 10 and 11 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VN82"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(e).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Transfer of membership may be permitted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05RFIQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(d). If memberships are transferable, any restrictions on the transfer of memberships must be reasonable if they are to be enforced against the members. The restrictions will probably be valid if imposed by the certificate of incorporation or bylaws or by a written agreement among any number of members. Any restrictions on transfer of membership should, in any event, be noted conspicuously on the certificate or other written evidence representing the membership or in corporate materials (such as brochures, informational packets, etc.) available to outsiders on request so that a prospective transferee may have sufficient notice and actual knowledge thereof.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A restriction on the transfer of memberships will probably be enforced if it: (1) obligates the member to offer to the corporation or to any other members a prior opportunity to acquire the membership; (2) obligates the corporation to purchase the membership; (3) requires the corporation to consent to any proposed transfer of the membership or to approve the proposed transferee; or (4) prohibits the transfer of the membership to designated persons or classes of persons and the designation is not manifestly unreasonable.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05N7TE"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§83<trace>5</trace>
ARTICLE III. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Meetings of members may be held at such place, either within or outside the state, as may be fixed by or under the bylaws or, if not so fixed, at the office of the corporation in the state. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05J042"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GF6E"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§908</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.1. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8BA"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M1G6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§908</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.2. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056O0"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I007ZSW"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§897</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he o r she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASXS"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM2O"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GF7K"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>901 to 907</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.5. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken at any meeting of the members by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may be taken without a meeting if all the members entitled to vote thereon consent thereto in writing or electronically. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VN5M"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05RFGA"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§89<trace>4</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.6. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Members entitled to cast a majority of the total number of votes at a meeting will constitute a quorum at the meeting, provided that, when a specified item of business is required to be voted on by a class of members, voting as a class, members entitled to cast a majority of the total votes entitled to be cast by such class will constitute a quorum for the transaction of such specified items of business. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASXU"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(a). The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide for any lesser quorum not less than the members entitled to cast 100 votes or one-tenth of the total number of votes entitled to be cast, whichever is lesser, and may, under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM2Q"</field>N-PCL &s;§615, provide for a greater quorum. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GF7M"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(b). The members present may adjourn the meeting despite the absence of a quorum. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8CI"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(d).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M1HE"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§912</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.7. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A member entitled to vote may vote in person or, unless the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws otherwise provide, by proxy executed in writing by the member or by that member's agent. A proxy will not be valid after 11 months from the date of its execution, unless otherwise provided in the proxy. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056TQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§609(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I007ZYM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>943 to 946</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.8. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that directors shall be elected or appointed in the manner provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00AT3I"</field>N-PCL &s;§703(b). There is no prohibition in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law against holding an election for directors by mail.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM8E"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§544</trace>
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3.9. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide that in all elections for directors every member entitled to vote will have the right to cumulate his or her vote and to give one candidate a number of votes equal to his or her vote multiplied by the number of directors to be elected or to distribute such votes on the same principle among as many candidates as he or she thinks fit. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFDA"</field>N-PCL &s;§617. The implication is that if cumulative voting is not provided for in either the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, it will not be permitted in directors' elections.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05VMU6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§917</trace>
ARTICLE IV. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Except as otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, each not-for-profit corporation must have a board of directors and the affairs of the corporation must be managed by or under the direction of the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05RF4U"</field>N-PCL &s;§701(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that, in addition to any other liabilities imposed by law on directors of a corporation, directors who vote for, or concur in, any of certain enumerated actions will be jointly and severally liable to the corporation for the benefit of the corporation and its creditors, members, or other interested persons to the extent of any injury suffered by those persons as a result of the action. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05N7FI"</field>N-PCL &s;§719.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05IZQ6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§7<trace>1</trace>, 68<trace>3</trace> et seq.
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.2. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The certificate of incorporation or bylaws may prescribe qualifications for directors. A director must, however, be at least 18 years of age, except in the case of certain specified youth groups. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05ES0U"</field>N-PCL &s;§701(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The minimum number of directors of a not-for-profit corporation is set by statute at three. Subject to such limitation, the number may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number shall be three. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8I8"</field>N-PCL &s;§702(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that directors elected or appointed at large shall be divided into either two, three, four, or five classes for the purpose of staggering their terms of office and that all or some of the directors elected or appointed otherwise than at large shall be divided into the same or a different number of classes, not exceeding five, for the same purpose. All classes shall be as nearly equal in number as possible and, if provision has been made for cumulative voting, no class shall include less than three directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056TV"</field>N-PCL &s;§704(a). The terms of office of the directors initially classified shall be as follows: that of the first class shall expire at the next annual meeting of members if there be members or of the board if there be no members; the second class at the second succeeding annual meeting; the third class, if any, at the third annual meeting, and so on. ►<field>st.ref.id="I007ZYR"</field>N-PCL &s;§704.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00AT3N"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>535</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>537</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>541</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.3. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Meetings of the board of directors may be held either within or outside the state, unless otherwise provided by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM8J"</field>N-PCL &s;§710(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GFDF"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>595 to 607</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056TX"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(a). Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice, whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. ►<field>st.ref.id="I007ZYT"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00AT3P"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM8L"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>595 to 607</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.5. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any one or more members of the board or of any committee thereof who is not physically present at a meeting of the board or a committee may participate by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFDH"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J8ID"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§60<trace.deleted/><trace>2</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.7. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056V3"</field>N-PCL &s;§707. See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I007ZZZ"</field>Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep't 2014), stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00AT4V"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§605</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.8. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Provision is made in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for informal action by directors. Unless <trace>otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee. </trace>►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM9R"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The act of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present will be the act of the board of directors, unless the act of a greater number is required by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFEN"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(d).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J8JJ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§60<trace>2</trace>, 6<trace>05</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.10. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, newly created directorships resulting from an increase in the number of directors elected or appointed at large, and vacancies among such directors for any reason may be filled by vote of a majority of the directors then in office, regardless of their number. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0056V5"</field>N-PCL &s;§705(a).<trace.deleted/><trace>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, a director elected or appointed to fill a vacancy in an unexpired term will hold office until the end of the term which the director was elected or appointed to fill, or for a term to be determined by the board which ends at an annual meeting, subject to the limitations on terms of office in N-PCL &s;§703 <field>HYPERLINK "https://1.next.westlaw.com/Link/Document/FullText?findType=L&pubNum=1000112&cite=NYNPS703&originatingDoc=NE0600E106B5F11ED9475C93D0CFDF9FB&refType=SP&originationContext=document&transitionType=DocumentItem&ppcid=6d5d87098f7849cda319ae2c184c7d0b&contextData=(sc.DocLink)" \l "co_pp_a83b000018c76"</field>(b) and until his or her successor is elected or appointed and qualified.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I008001"</field>N-PCL &s;§705(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00AT4X"</field>Construction and effect of corporate bylaws or articles relating to change in number of directors, 3 A.L.R.3d 623
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM9T"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§55<trace>0</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 4.11. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A corporation may pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFEP"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>As to indemnification of officers, directors, employees, and agents, as well as insurance, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VMRC"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§721 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05RF20"</field>Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer's life insurance policy as affecting right to policy, 56 A.L.R.3d 1086 (secs. 3(a), 3(b) superseded in part by Construction and Application of "Key Man" Life Insurance, 12 A.L.R.7th Art. 6).
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00AT4Z"</field>Test in stockholders' actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM9V"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace>789, </trace>79<trace.deleted/><trace>1</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>801 to 810</trace>
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GFER"</field>Reasonableness of Corporate Officer's Compensation, 4 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 425
ARTICLE V. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, and a treasurer and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8JN"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M1OJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field><trace>No employee of the corporation shall serve as chair of the board or hold any other title with similar responsibilities, unless the board approves such employee serving as chair of the board by a two-thirds vote of the entire board and contemporaneously documents in writing the basis for the board approval; provided, however, that no such employee will be considered an independent director for the purposes of the Not-F or-Profit Corporation Law</trace>. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00570V"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(f).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00805R"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
ARTICLE V, 
Section 5.1. 
Drafter's Note
