 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATAN"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DMFJ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
ARTICLE V, 
Section 5.2. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Officers and assistant officers as may be deemed necessary may be elected or appointed by the board of directors or chosen in such other manner as may be prescribed in the bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFKF"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J8PB"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
ARTICLE V, 
Section 5.3. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any officer elected or appointed by the board may be removed by the board with or without cause. An officer elected by the members may be removed, with or without cause, only by vote of the members, but the authority to act as an officer may be suspended by the board for cause. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M1U7"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(a). The removal will be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the person so removed. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VMFW"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(b). Election or appointment of an officer will not of itself create any contract rights. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05REQK"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05N718"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>566 to 568</trace>
ARTICLE V, 
Sections 5.5 to 5.9. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers<trace>, and key persons</trace> must discharge the duties of their respective positions in good faith and with the care an ordinarily prudent person in a like position would exercise under similar circumstances. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DMFL"</field>N-PCL &s;§717. The factors set forth in ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFKH"</field>N-PCL &s;§552(e)(1) (Standard of conduct in managing and investing an institutional fund), if relevant, must be considered by a governing board delegating investment management of institutional funds pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8PD"</field>N-PCL &s;§514 (Delegation of investment management). For these purposes, the term institutional fund is defined in ►<field>st.ref.id="I005710"</field>N-PCL &s;§551 (Definitions). ►<field>st.ref.id="I00805W"</field>N-PCL &s;§717(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>In <trace.deleted/><trace>discharg</trace>ing their duties, directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers<trace> and key persons</trace> acting in good faith may rely on information, opinions, reports, or statements, including financial statements and other financial data, in each case prepared or presented by: (1) one or more officers or employees of the corporation, whom the director believes to be reliable and competent in the matters presented; (2) counsel, public accountants, or other persons as to matters which the directors<trace>,</trace> officers<trace> or key persons</trace> believe to be within such person's professional or expert competence; or (3) a committee of the board upon which they do not serve, duly designated in accordance with a provision of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, as to matter within its designated authority, which committee the directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers<trace> or key persons</trace> believe to merit confidence, as long as in so relying they shall be acting in good faith and with the proper degree of care. Persons shall not be considered to be acting in good faith if they have knowledge concerning the matter in question that would cause such reliance to be unwarranted. Persons who so perform their duties shall have no liability by reason of being or having been directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers<trace> or key persons</trace> of the corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATAS"</field>N-PCL &s;§717(b).
<trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GFKK"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§68<trace>3</trace> et seq.
ARTICLE VI. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field><trace>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace>To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8PG"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05VMFM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace>592 to 594</trace>
ARTICLE VIII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>A not-for-profit corporation may issue a certificate or card evidencing membership in the corporation. The fact that the corporation is a not-for-profit corporation and that the membership certificate or card is nontransferable must be noted conspicuously on the face or back of each such certificate or card. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05REQA"</field>N-PCL &s;§501.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05N70Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§82<trace>6</trace>
ARTICLE IX. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05IZBM"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05ERMA"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>828, 829</trace>
ARTICLE XI. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Every not-for-profit corporation is required to keep, at the office of the corporation, correct and complete books and records of account and minutes of the proceedings of its members, board, and executive committee, if any, and must keep at such office or at the office of its transfer agent or registrar in this state a list or record containing the names and addresses of all members, the class or classes of membership or capital certificates and the number of capital certificates held by each, and the dates when they respectively became the holders of record thereof. A corporation may keep its books and records of account in an office of the corporation without the state, as specified in its certificate of incorporation. Any of the foregoing books, minutes, and records may be in written form or in any other form capable of being converted into written form within a reasonable time. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8PI"</field>N-PCL &s;§621(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>Any person who has been a member of record of a corporation for at least six months immediately preceding his or her demand or any person holding or thereunto authorized in writing by the holders of at least 5&percnt;% of any class of the outstanding capital certificates, upon at least five-days written demand, shall have the right to examine in person or by agent or attorney, during usual business hours, its minutes of the proceedings of its members and list or record of members and to make extracts therefrom. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005728"</field>N-PCL &s;§621(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I008074"</field>Admissibility of computerized private business records, 7 A.L.R.4th 8
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00ATC0"</field>What corporate documents are subject to shareholder's right to inspection, 88 A.L.R.3d 663
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DMGW"</field>Right of stockholder to inspect corporate books or records in pursuit of social or political interest, as distinguished from financial interest, 50 A.L.R.3d 1056
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GFLS"</field>Who has possession, custody, or control of corporate books or records for purposes of order to produce, 47 A.L.R.3d 676
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J8QO"</field>Persons liable under statutes imposing, upon directors, officers, or trustees of a corporation, personal liability for its debts on account of their failure to file or publish reports, required by law, as to corporate matters, 39 A.L.R.3d 428
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M1VK"</field>Stockholder's right to inspect books and records of foreign corporation, 19 A.L.R.3d 869
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00572A"</field>Right of member, officer, agent, or director of private corporation or unincorporated association to assert personal privilege against self-incrimination with respect to production of corporate books or records, 52 A.L.R.3d 636 (sec. 9 superseded by Availability of sole shareholder's Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination to resist production of corporation's books and records--modern status, 87 A.L.R. Fed. 177). <trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00ATC2"</field>Availability of sole shareholder's Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination to resist production of corporation's books and records--modern status, 87 A.L.R. Fed. 177
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DMGY"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>404 to 419</trace>
Section 11.4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>This provision is authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFLU"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§606, 711(c).

 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00577Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§60<trace>0</trace>, 90<trace>7</trace>
ARTICLE XII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"</field>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080CU"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00ATHQ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§127</trace>

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id551b4801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>BYLAWS of [NAME OF CORPORATION] 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE I  OFFICES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 1.01. Location. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The principal office of the Corporation within the State of New York is located at [office address of corporation], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state]. The Corporation may also maintain additional offices at other places within or outside the State of New York as the Board of Directors may, from time to time, determine.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE II  MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.01. Who Are Members. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The members of the Corporation consist of any person [list of qualifications for membership] as may be elected by a member of the Corporation from time to time by the vote of the [then acting members/Board of Directors].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.02. Transfer, Term, and Termination of Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Membership in the Corporation [shall/shall not be transferable]. The term of office of any member is [[number of years] years/for life, unless otherwise specified at the time of the member's election].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Notwithstanding the foregoing, any member, after having fulfilled all obligations to the Corporation, may resign by giving written notice to the Secretary of the Corporation (any such resignation to take effect as specified in the resignation, or if not so specified, upon receipt by the Secretary), and any member may be removed or suspended at any time, [with/without] cause by majority vote of the other members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.03. Annual Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A meeting of the members of the Corporation shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of any other business that properly comes before the meeting [on the [date of meeting]/if that day is a legal holiday where the meeting is to be held, then on the next succeeding business day/on a date to be determined annually by the members].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.04. Special Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the [Board of Directors/President/Secretary]. Special meetings may also be convened by the members entitled to cast at least 10&percnt;% of the total number of votes entitled to be cast at the special meeting, who may, in writing, demand the call of a special meeting specifying the date and month of the meeting, which shall not be less than two nor more than three months from the date of the written demand. The Secretary of the Corporation, upon receiving the written demand, shall promptly give notice of the special meeting, or, if he or she fails to do so within five business days after receiving the written demand, any member signing that demand may give notice.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Notice of a special meeting shall state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called and indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Special meetings shall be held at a place, date, and hour within or without the State of New York as may be specified in the notice of the meeting, provided that, if no place is specified in the notice, then the special meeting shall be held at the office of the Corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.05. Record Date for Meetings and Other Actions. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>For the purpose of determining which members are entitled to notice of or to vote at any meeting of members or any adjournment of such a meeting, to express consent to or dissent from any proposal without a meeting, or for the purpose of determining members entitled to receive any distribution or the allotment of any rights, or for the purpose of any other action by the members, the Board of Directors may fix, in advance, a date as the record date for any such determination of members. This record date shall not be more than 50 nor less than 10 days before the date of the meeting. If no record date is fixed by the Board of Directors: (1) the record date for the determination of members entitled to vote at a meeting of members shall be at the close of business on the day next preceding the day on which notice is given, or, if no notice is given, the day on which the meeting is held; and (2) the record date for determining members for any purpose other than that specified above shall be at the close of business on the day on which the resolution of the Board of Directors relating to the purpose is adopted.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A determination of members of record entitled to notice of or to vote at any meeting of members, which has been made in accordance with this Section 2.05, shall apply to any adjournment of such a meeting, unless the Board of Directors fixes a new record date under this Section for the adjourned meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.06. Notice of Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Whenever members are required or permitted to take any action at a meeting, written notice shall be given to the members by the Secretary that states the place, date, and hour of the meeting and, unless it is the annual meeting, that indicates that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. As provided in Section 2.03, notice of a special meeting shall also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting shall be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail to each member entitled to vote at the meeting. If the notice is given personally or by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it shall be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it shall be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before the date of the meeting. If mailed, the notice shall be given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage prep aid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members or, if he or she shall have filed, with the Secretary of the Corporation, a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him or her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>When a meeting is adjourned to another time or place, it is not necessary to give any notice of the adjourned meeting if the time and place to which the meeting is adjourned are announced at the meeting at which the adjournment is taken, and at the adjourned meeting any business may be transacted that might have been transacted on the original date of the meeting. However, if, after the adjournment, the Board of Directors fixes a new record date for the adjourned meeting, a notice of the adjourned meeting shall be given to each member of record on the new record date entitled to notice under this Section 2.06.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.07. Waivers of Notice. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Notice of any members' meeting need not be given to any member who submits a signed waiver of notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of that meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.08. List or Record of Members at Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A list or record of members entitled to vote as of the record date, certified by the Secretary, shall be produced at any meeting of members upon request made by any member who has given written notice to the Corporation at least 10 days prior to the meeting that the request will be made. If the right to vote at any meeting is challenged, the inspectors of election or the person presiding at the meeting shall require that the list or record of members be produced as evidence of the right of the persons challenged to vote at the meeting, and all persons who appear from that list or record to be members entitled to vote at the meeting may vote at the meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.09. Quorum at Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Except as otherwise provided by law, the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, members entitled to cast a majority of the total number of votes entitled to be cast at a meeting constitute a quorum at any meeting of members for the transaction of any business. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the members present at any meeting may adjourn any meeting to another time or place despite the absence of a quorum.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.10. Presiding Officer and Secretary. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>At any meeting of the members, if neither the Chair of the Board of Directors nor the President nor the Vice President nor a person designated by the Board to preside at the meeting is present, the members present shall appoint a presiding officer for the meeting. If neither the Secretary nor an Assistant Secretary is present, the appointee of the person presiding at the meeting shall act as secretary of the meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.11. Proxies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Every member entitled to vote at a meeting of members or to express consent or dissent without a meeting may authorize another person or persons to act for that member by proxy. Every proxy shall be signed by the member or by his or her attorney-in-fact. No proxy is valid after the expiration of 11 months from the date of the proxy unless otherwise provided in the proxy. Every proxy is revocable at the pleasure of the member executing it, except as otherwise provided by law. The authority of the holder of a proxy to act is not revoked by the incompetence or death of the member who executed the proxy unless, before the authority is exercised, written notice of an adjudication of the member's incompetence or death is received by the Secretary or an Assistant Secretary.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.12. Inspectors of Election. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors, in advance of any meeting of members, may appoint one or more inspectors to act at the meeting or any adjournment of the meeting. If inspectors are not so appointed, the person presiding at a meeting of members may and, on the request of any member entitled to vote at the meeting, shall appoint one or more inspectors, provided, however, that the requirement of inspectors at any meeting of members is waived unless compliance with the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I005782"</field>Section 610 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law is expressly requested by a member present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at that meeting. If any person appointed fails to appear or act, the vacancy may be filled by appointment made by the Board of Directors in advance of the meeting or at the meeting by the person presiding at the meeting. Each inspector, before entering upon the discharge of his or her duties, shall take and sign an oath to execute faithfully the duties of inspector with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The inspectors shall determine the number of members represented at the meeting; the existence of a quorum; and the validity and effect of proxies and shall receive votes, ballots, or consents; hear and determine all challenges and questions arising in connection with the right to vote; count and tabulate all votes, ballots, or consents; determine the result; and do any acts that are proper to conduct the election or vote with fairness to all members. On request of the person presiding at the meeting or any members entitled to vote at the meeting, the inspectors shall make a report in writing of any challenge, question or matter determined by them and execute a certificate of any fact found by them.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.13. Vote of Members. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Except as otherwise required by law, the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, whenever directors are to be elected by the members, they shall be elected by a plurality of the votes cast at a meeting of members by the members entitled to vote in the election. Whenever any corporate action, other than the election of directors is to be taken by vote of the members, it shall, except as otherwise required by law, the Certificate of Incorporation, or these Bylaws, be authorized by a majority of the votes cast at a meeting of members by the members entitled to vote on that matter.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Except as provided in the preceding paragraph, any reference in these Bylaws to corporate action at a meeting of members by &ldquo;“majority vote&rdquo;” or &ldquo;“two-thirds vote&rdquo;” requires the action to be taken by such proportion of the votes cast at the meeting, provided that the affirmative votes cast in favor of any such action are at least equal to the quorum. Blank votes or abstentions are not counted in the number of votes cast.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Except as otherwise provided by law, every member of record of the Corporation entitled to vote on any matter at any meeting of members is entitled to one vote. Upon the demand of any member, the vote at any election of directors or upon any question before a meeting shall be by ballot; absent such a demand, the method of voting shall be discretionary with the person presiding at the meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 2.14. Action by Members Without a Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Whenever under any provision of law, the Certificate of Incorporation, or these Bylaws, members are required or permitted to take any action by vote, such action may be taken without a meeting or written consent, setting forth the action so taken, signed by all of the members entitled to vote on the matter. Written consent thus given by all members entitled to vote has the same effect as a unanimous vote of members, and any certificate with respect to the authorization or taking of any such action which is delivered to the Department of State of the State of New York shall recite that the authorization was by unanimous written consent. The provisions of this Section 2.14 shall not be construed to alter or modify any provision in the Certificate of Incorporation under which the written consent of fewer than all of the members is sufficient for any corporate action if such provision does not conflict with any provision of law.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE III  BOARD OF DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.01. Power of Board and Qualification of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Corporation shall be managed by its Board of Directors. Each director must be at least 18 years of age.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.02. Number of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The number of directors constituting the entire Board shall be not less than three. Subject to this limitation, the entire Board shall consist of [a given number/not less than [number of directors] nor more than [number of directors] directors as shall be determined from time to time by a majority of the entire Board] unless otherwise increased or decreased as provided below. The number of directors may be increased or decreased at any time and from time to time by amendment of the Bylaws, by action of the members or by majority vote of the entire Board, except that in no case may any decrease in the number of directors shorten the term of any incumbent director.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.03. Election and Term of Directors. 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Directors shall be elected to a term of three years, except that:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(1). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>If the number of directors in any class is increased, the term of a director elected to such a newly created vacancy shall end at the same time as the term of other directors in that class;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(2). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A director elected to fill a vacancy shall be elected for the unexpired term of his or her predecessor in office and until his or her successor is elected and qualified;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(3). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>In [identification of year] and every third year after that year, the term of any [director/trustee] in Class A shall end at the annual meeting of the Board;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(4). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>In [identification of year] and every third year after that year, the term of any [director/trustee] in Class B shall end at the annual meeting of the Board; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(5). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>In [identification of year] and every third year after that year, the term of any director in Class C shall end at the annual meeting of the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The initial Board of Directors shall be comprised of those directors named in the Certificate of Incorporation. Thereafter, subject to the provisions of subsection A of this Section, directors shall be elected at an annual meeting of the Board of Directors by an affirmative vote of a majority of the directors, then in office, and each shall continue in office until his or her successor is elected or qualified (unless the Board of Directors, at the annual meeting, determines that there is to be no such immediate successor) or until his or her death, resignation, or removal. The tenure of incumbent members of the Board of Directors shall not be affected by an increase or decrease in the number of directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.04. Newly Created Directorships and Vacancies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Newly created directorships resulting from an increase in the number of directors elected and vacancies occurring in the Board, for any reason, may be filled [by vote of the members/by vote of a majority of the directors then in office, although less than a quorum exists]. A director elected to fill a vacancy shall hold office until the next annual meeting at which the election of directors is in the regular order of business and until his or her successor is elected and qualified. If newly created directorships are filled by the Board, there shall be no classification of the additional directors until the next annual meeting of members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.05. Resignation. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Any director may resign from office at any time by delivering a resignation in writing to the Corporation. The resignation takes effect at the time specified in the resignation, and unless otherwise specified, no acceptance of the resignation is necessary to make it effective.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.06. Removal of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Any or all of the directors may be removed [with cause/with or without cause], by vote of the members. Any director may be removed with cause by vote of the Board of Directors, provided there is a quorum of not less than a majority present at the meeting of directors at which the removal action is taken.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.07. Meetings of the Board. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Meetings of the Board of Directors, annual, regular, or special, may be held at any place within or without the State of New York as may be fixed by the Board from time to time or as is specified in the respective notice or waivers of notice of the meeting. An annual meeting of the Board for the appointment of officers shall be held on the day on which the annual meeting of the members is held, at the same place and as soon after the holding of such meeting of members as is practicable, and no notice of this meeting is necessary. The Board may fix times and places for regular meetings of the Board and no notice of these meetings need be given. Special meetings of the Board may be called at any time [by the President/as determined by the board].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to a director who submits a signed waiver of notice whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to the meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the Board.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A majority of the directors present, whether or not a quorum is present, may adjourn any meeting to another time and place. Notice of any adjournment of a meeting of the Board to another time or place shall be given to the directors who were not present at the time of the adjournment and, unless such time and place are announced at the meeting, to the other directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.08. Quorum and Voting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Unless a greater proportion is required by law, by the Certificate of Incorporation or by a Bylaw adopted by the members, a majority of the entire Board of Directors constitutes a quorum for the transaction of business or of any specified item of business, provided, however, that in the case that the number of the entire Board is 15 members or less, the quorum shall be at least one-third of the entire number of directors, and in the case of a board of more than 15 member, the quorum shall be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction of that figure) in excess of 15. Except as otherwise provided by law or by these Bylaws, the vote of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time, shall be the act of the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.09. Written Consent of Directors; Meetings by Conference Telephone. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Any action required or permitted to be taken by the Board of Directors or any committee of the Board of Directors may be taken without a meeting if all members of the Board or committee consent in writing to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. Each resolution so adopted and the required written consents by members of the Board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the Board or committee.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Any one or more members of the Board of Directors or of any committee of the Board of Directors may participate in a meeting of the Board or committee by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.10. Committees of the Board. 
►<field>sel.tp="alt"</field>[EITHER:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors, by resolution adopted by a majority of the entire Board, may designate from among its members an Executive Committee and other committees, each consisting of three or more directors and each of which, to the extent provided in the resolution, have all the authority of the Board, to the full extent permitted by law. The Board may designate one or more directors as alternate members of any committee, who may replace any absent member or members at any meeting of such committee.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board may also create committees that it may deem desirable. The members of these committees shall be appointed by the Chair of the Board, if any, or by the President of the Corporation with the consent of the Board; committees shall only have the powers specifically delegated to them by the Board and in no case shall have powers which are not authorized for committees under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Each committee shall serve at the pleasure of the Board. The designation of any committee and the delegation to this committee of authority does not alone relieve any director of his or her duty to the Corporation under ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VLZ6"</field>Section 717 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Committees, other than committees of the Board, are committees of the Corporation. These committees may be elected or appointed as officers of the Corporation, and provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law applicable to officers generally shall apply to members of such committees.[OR:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors, by resolution adopted by a majority of the entire Board, may designate from among its members an Executive Committee and other committees, each consisting of three or more directors, and each of which, to the extent provided in the resolution, have all the authority of the Board, except that no such committee shall have authority as to the following matters:
 
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(1). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Submission to members of any action requiring members' approval under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law;
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(2). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Filling vacancies in the Board of Directors or in any committee;
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(3). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Fixing compensation of the Directors for serving on the Board or on any committee;
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(4). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Amending or repealing the Bylaws or adopting new Bylaws; and
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(5). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Amending or repealing any resolution of the Board which by its terms may not be so amended or repealed.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board may designate one or more Directors as alternate members of any committee, who may replace any absent member or members at any meeting of such committee.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors may create any additional committees that it deems desirable, the members of any committee to be appointed by the Chair of the Board, if any, or the President of the Corporation with the consent of the Board if there is no Chair of the Board. Committees have only the powers specifically delegated to them by the Board and in no case have powers that are not authorized for committees.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Committees other than committees of the Board shall be committees of the Corporation. These committees may be elected or appointed in the same manner as officers of the Corporation. Provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law applicable to officers generally apply to members of such committees.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Each committee of the Board shall serve at the pleasure of the Board. The designation of any such committee and the delegation to the committee of authority does not alone relieve any Director of his or her duty under the law to the Corporation.<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.11. Compensation of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>[The Corporation may pay compensation to directors in reasonable amounts fixed from time to time by the Board of Directors for services rendered to the Corporation in their capacities/Directors may not receive compensation for services rendered to the Corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.12. Annual Report of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors shall present at the annual meeting of members a report, verified by the President and Treasurer or by a majority of the directors, or certified by an independent public or certified public accountant or a firm of certified public accountants selected by the Board, showing in appropriate detail the following:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(1). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The assets and liabilities, including the trust funds, of the Corporation as of the end of a 12-month fiscal period terminating not more than six months prior to the annual meeting (the &ldquo;“fiscal period&rdquo;”);
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(2). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The principal changes in assets and liabilities, including trust funds, during the fiscal period;
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(3). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The revenue or receipts of the Corporation, both unrestricted and restricted to particular purposes, during the fiscal period;
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(4). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The expenses or disbursements of the Corporation, for both general and restricted purposes during the fiscal period; and
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(5). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The number of members of the Corporation as of the date of the report, together with a statement of increase or decrease in the number of members of the corporation during the fiscal period, and a statement of the place where the names and places of residence of the current members may be found.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The annual report of the directors shall be filed with the records of the Corporation and either a copy or an abstract of the report entered in the minutes of the proceedings of the annual meeting of members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 3.13. Purchase, Sale, Mortgage, and Lease of Real Property. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>No purchase of real property may be made by the Corporation and the Corporation may not sell, mortgage or lease real property unless authorized by the vote of two-thirds of the entire Board of Directors, provided, however, that if there are 21 or more directors, the vote of a majority of the entire Board is sufficient.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE IV  OFFICERS, AGENTS, AND EMPLOYEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 4.01. General Provisions. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The officers of the Corporation shall be [a President, a Secretary, a Treasurer, a Chair of the Board, one or more Vice Presidents, one or more Assistant Secretaries, one or more Assistant Treasurers/[other list of officers]].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 4.02. Term of Office, Vacancies, and Removal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The officers shall be elected by the [Board of Directors at the first meeting of the Board after the annual meeting of the members in each year/members]. The Board may appoint other officers, who shall have the authority and perform the duties as are prescribed by the Board. Each officer shall hold office until the annual meeting of the members after his or her appointment and until his or her successor has been appointed and qualified. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and Secretary. If an office becomes vacant for any reason, the Board may fill the vacancy. Any officer so appointed or elected shall serve only until such time as the unexpired term of his or her successor expires unless he or she is reelected by the Board. Any officer may be removed by the Board with or without cause, except that an officer elected by the members or a class of members may be removed, with or without cause, only by the vote of the members or such class of members, but his or her authority to act as an officer may be suspended by the Board for cause. Removal without cause shall be without prejudice to the removed person's contract rights, if any, but the appointment of any person as an officer, agent, or employee of the Corporation shall not of itself create contract rights.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 4.03. Powers and Duties of Officers. 
►<field>sel.tp="alt"</field>[EITHER:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Subject to the control of the Board of Directors, all officers as between themselves and the Corporation shall have the authority and perform the duties in the management of the property and affairs of the Corporation as are provided in these Bylaws or by resolution of the Board and, to the extent not so provided, as generally pertain to their respective offices.[OR:]
 
 
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. Chair of the Board. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Chair of the Board (if any) shall preside at all meetings of the members and of the Board of Directors at which the Chairperson is present and shall perform any other duties that the Board may designate. In the absence or inability of the President to act, the Chair of the Board shall perform the duties and may exercise the powers of the President.
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. President. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The President shall serve as the chief executive officer of the Corporation. In the absence of the Chair of the Board, the President shall preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors and, subject to the supervision of the Board, shall perform all duties customary to that office and shall supervise and control all of the affairs of the Corporation in accordance with policies and directives approved by the Board.
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>C. Vice President. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>In the absence of the President or in the event of his or her inability or refusal to act, the Vice President shall perform the duties of the President and, when so acting, shall have all the powers of and be subject to all the restrictions upon the President. The Vice President shall perform other duties and have other powers as the Board of Directors may, from time to time, prescribe by standing or special resolution, or as the President may, from time to time, provide, subject to the powers and the supervision of the Board.
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>D. Secretary. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Secretary is responsible for the keeping of an accurate record of the proceedings of all meetings of the Board of Directors, shall give or cause to be given all notices in accordance with these Bylaws or as required by law, and, in general, shall perform all duties customary to the office of Secretary. The Secretary shall have custody of the corporate seal of the Corporation, if any, and he or she shall have authority to affix the same to any instrument requiring it, and, when so affixed, it may be attested by his or her signature. The Board may give general authority to any officer to affix the seal of the Corporation, if any, and to attest the affixing by his or her signature.
 ►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>E. Treasurer. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Treasurer shall have the custody of and be responsible for all funds and securities of the Corporation. He or she shall keep or cause to be kept complete and accurate accounts of receipts and disbursements of the Corporation and shall deposit all monies and other valuable property of the Corporation in the name and to the credit of the Corporation in such banks or depositories as the Board of Directors may designate. Whenever required by the Board, the Treasurer shall render a statement of accounts. He or she shall, at all reasonable times, exhibit the books and accounts to any officer or director of the Corporation and shall perform all duties incident to the office of Treasurer, subject to the supervision of the Board, and such other duties as shall from time to time be assigned by the Board. The Treasurer shall, if required by the Board, give such bond or security for the faithful performance of his or her duties as the Board may require.<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 4.04. Agents and Employees. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors may appoint agents and employees who shall have authority and perform duties as may be prescribed by the Board. The Board may remove any agent or employee at any time with or without cause. Removal without cause shall be without prejudice to the removed person's contract rights, if any, and the appointment of a person removed shall not itself create contract rights.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 4.05. Compensation of Officers, Agents, and Employees. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Officers may receive compensation in reasonable amounts fixed by a majority vote of the entire Board of Directors. The Corporation shall not pay any compensation to officers for services rendered to the Corporation, except that officers may be reimbursed for expenses incurred in the performance of their duties to the Corporation in reasonable amounts as approved by a majority of the entire Board.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The compensation of agents and employees appointed by the Board shall be fixed by the Board, but this power may be delegated to any officer, agent, or employee as to persons under that person's direction or control. The Board may require officers, agents, or employees to give security for the faithful performance of their duties.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE V  MISCELLANEOUS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.01. Fiscal Year. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The fiscal year of the Corporation is the calendar year or another period as may be fixed by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.02. Corporate Seal. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The seal of the Corporation shall be circular in form and contain the name of the Corporation, the words &ldquo;“Corporate Seal&rdquo;” and &ldquo;“New York,&rdquo;” and the year the Corporation was formed in the center. The Corporation may use the seal by causing it or a facsimile to be affixed or impressed or reproduced in any manner.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.03. Checks, Notes, Contracts. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Board of Directors shall determine who is authorized from time to time on the Corporation's behalf to sign checks, notes, drafts, acceptances, bills of exchange, and other orders or obligations for the payment of money; to enter into contracts; or to execute and deliver other documents and instruments.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.04. Books and Records. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Corporation shall keep at its principal office in the State of New York: (1) correct and complete books and records of accounts; (2) minutes of the proceedings of its members, Board, and any committee of the Corporation; and (3) a current list or record containing the names and addresses of all members, directors, and officers of the Corporation. Any of the books, records, and minutes of the Corporation may be in written form or in any other form capable of being converted into written form within a reasonable time.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.05. Amendments to Certificate and Bylaws. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Certificate of Incorporation may be amended by the members of the Board of Directors pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057F3"</field>Section 802 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>These Bylaws may be amended or repealed, and new Bylaws may be adopted by the members at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors or by the Board of Directors. Any Bylaw adopted by the Board may be amended or repealed by the members entitled to vote on the matter as provided in these Bylaws, and any Bylaw adopted by the members may be amended or repealed by the Board, except that the Board shall not amend or repeal a Bylaw adopted by the members which provides that such Bylaw shall not be subject to amendment or repeal by the Board. If any Bylaw regulating an impending election of directors is adopted, amended, or repealed by the Board there shall be set forth in the notice of the next meeting of members for the election of directors the Bylaw so adopted, amended, or repealed, together with a concise statement of the changes made.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.06. Indemnification and Insurance. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The Corporation [may/shall] indemnify any person made, or threatened to be made, a party to an action or proceeding other than one by or in the right of the Corporation to procure a judgment in its favor, whether civil or criminal, by reason of the fact that the person or person's testator or intestate is or was a director or officer of the Corporation or serves or served any other corporation, partnership, joint venture, trust, employee benefit plan, or other enterprise in any capacity at the request of the Corporation, and the Corporation may advance such person's related expenses to the full extent permitted by law. The Corporation may purchase and maintain insurance to indemnify the Corporation and its directors and officers to the full extent indemnification is permitted by law.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>In no case, however, may the Corporation indemnify, reimburse, or insure any person for any taxes imposed on that individual under ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080JZ"</field>&ss;§§4940 et seq. of the Internal Revenue Code, as now in effect or as may be amended (&ldquo;“the Code&rdquo;”). Furthermore, if at any time the Corporation is deemed to be a private foundation within the meaning of &s;§509 of the Code, then, during that time, no payment may be made under this ARTICLE if the payment would constitute an act of self-dealing or a taxable expenditure, as defined in ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057F5"</field>&s;§4941(d) or ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080K1"</field>&s;§4945(d), respectively, of the Internal Revenue Code.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>If any part of this Article is found in any action, suit, or proceeding to be invalid or ineffective, the validity and the effectiveness of the remaining parts shall not be affected.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>Section 5.07. Loans to Directors or Officers. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>No loans, other than through the purchase of bonds, debentures, or similar obligations of the type customarily sold in public offerings or through ordinary deposit of funds in a bank, shall be made by the Corporation to its directors or officers or to any other corporation, firm, association, or other entity in which one or more of its directors or officers are directors or officers of the Corporation or hold a substantial financial interest except that the Corporation may make a loan to any corporation which is a Type B corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law.
Notes to Form

Tax Notes 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The tax law defines social clubs as those in which the members are associated together in fellowship toward some common objective (►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATOX"</field>Rev. Rul. 67-428, 1967-2 C.B. 204) and, to be tax-exempt, must be operated primarily for pleasure or recreational purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DMTT"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(c)(7). Substantially all its activities must be for the purposes for which it was organized. Clubs engaging in an unrelated business run the risk of losing exempt status. No more than 35&percnt;% of a club's gross income can come from investment sources or from nonmembership sources. Furthermore, no more than 15&percnt;% of a club's gross income can come from use of a club's facilities by the public. None of the earnings of a club can inure to the benefit of a private shareholder.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>An exempt club is subject to one special requirement: Neither the charter nor bylaws, nor any written policy of the club, can provide for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color or religion. Two exceptions exist: (1) a club can discriminate on religious grounds if it limits its membership to a particular religion in order to further the principles of that religion. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFYP"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(i); or (2) an auxiliary of a fraternal benefit society that limits its membership to those of a particular religion may also discriminate on religious grounds.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A qualified social club is exempt from tax only on income from its exempt activities, that is, from amounts paid by its members. Investment income is taxed, as is all other unrelated business income. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057F8"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &ss;§§501(b), 512.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATP0"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§262) or business purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DMTW"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(a)(3). This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFYS"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§162(a). The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;“business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo;” It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J93O"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(e)(4).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;“clubs&rdquo;” that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club--dining and recreational facilities--the costs should be deductible as business expenses.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M28K"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§170(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The situation under the estate tax is less categorical. Only contributions for public, religious, charitable, scientific, literary, educational and certain other purposes are deductible. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00OVDG"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§2055(a). While this would seem to exclude contributions to most clubs, a bequest to trustees of a club to give financial assistance to the sick and unfortunate residents of a town was held deductible, as was a contribution to an art club devoted principally to educational activities. In the latter case the club also provided incidental social activities, but this did not prevent the contribution from being deductible.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Bylaws, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057FA"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>As to contents of bylaws, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I0080K6"</field>&s;§30:44.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>As to adoption of bylaws, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00ATP2"</field>&s;§30:45.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>For pertinent checklist concerning matters that may be covered in bylaws, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00DMTY"</field>&s;§30:56.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00GFYU"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384
Section 1.01. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00J93Q"</field>Not-for-Profit Corporation Law &s;§402(a)(3) requires that the Certificate of Incorporation set forth the county within the State of New York in which the office of the corporation is to be located. The certificate may also set forth the post office address of an office without the state at which, pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VLKW"</field>N-PCL &s;§621, the books and records of the corporation shall be kept. Accordingly, this bylaw provision is optional but may be useful in that the board of directors is authorized to determine from time to time whether other offices within or outside the State of New York are necessary or desirable.
Section 2.01. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members or, in the case of a charitable corporation, may have no members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080LB"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(a). If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATQ7"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(b)<trace>.</trace>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including, but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFZZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J94V"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§823</trace>
Section 2.02. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Membership is not generally transferable unless otherwise specified in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M29R"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(d).
Section 2.03. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The annual meeting of members may be held at any time during the year. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057GI"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0080LE"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§908</trace>
Section 2.04. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATQA"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(c) provides that special meetings may be called by the board of directors and by such person or persons as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, special meetings may be convened by members entitled to cast 10&percnt;% of the total number of votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DMV6"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a) sets forth specific provisions to be included in the notice of special meetings.
 <trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05RDK4"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§897</trace>
Section 2.05. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05N5US"</field>N-PCL &s;§611.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05IY5G"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§90<trace>2</trace>
Section 2.06. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GG5P"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>In the event that the corporation has more than 500 members, the notice may be served by publication in a newspaper published in the county in the state in which the principal office of the corporation is located, once a week for three successive weeks next preceding the date of the meeting, provided that the corporation shall also prominently post notice of such meeting on the homepage of any website maintained by the corporation continuously from the date of publication through the date of the meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9AL"</field>N-PCL &s;§605.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>W<trace>ritten notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M2FH"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting, shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057M8"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0080R4"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>901 to 907</trace>
Section 2.07. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting, shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATW0"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GG5S"</field>N-PCL &s;§607.

Section 2.09. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Members entitled to cast a majority of the total number of votes at a meeting will constitute a quorum at the meeting, provided that when a specified item of business is required to be voted on by a class of members, voting as a class, members entitled to cast a majority of the total votes entitled to be cast by such class will constitute a quorum for the transaction of such specified items of business. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057MA"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(a). The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide for any lesser quorum not less than the members entitled to cast 100 votes or one-tenth of the total number of votes entitled to be cast, whichever is lesser, and may, under ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080R6"</field>N-PCL &s;§615, provide for a greater quorum. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATW2"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(b). The members present may adjourn the meeting despite the absence of a quorum. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DN0Y"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(d).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GG5U"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§912</trace>
Section 2.10. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>There is no applicable section in the statute. This provision reflects standard corporate practice.
Section 2.11. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9AQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§609 provides that members may vote by proxy unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>This set of bylaws provides that inspectors are not required unless expressly requested by a member present in person or by proxy at a meeting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057MD"</field>N-PCL &s;§610.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I00M2FP"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§611, 613.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>If the written consent of fewer than all of the members is authorized, such provision must be included in the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATXA"</field>N-PCL &s;§614.
