ARTICLE III. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Not-for-profit corporations frequently refer to directors as &ldquo;“trustees,&rdquo;” and this term may be substituted for &ldquo;“directors&rdquo;” throughout this form.
Section 3.01. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, a corporation shall be managed by its board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GG72"</field>N-PCL &s;§701. Each director must be at least 18 years old. Note specific provisions concerning certain not-for-profit corporations in ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9BY"</field>N-PCL &s;§701.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M2GU"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>535</trace>
Section 3.02. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Although not expressly provided by statute, apparently a variable range of the number of directors is permitted. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00OVLQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§702.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The minimum number of directors of a not-for-profit corporation is set by statute at three. Subject to such limitation, the number may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number shall be three. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ROQM"</field>N-PCL &s;§702(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00UHVI"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>537</trace>
Section 3.03. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Directors may be elected for staggered terms. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VL6M"</field>N-PCL &s;§704.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that directors, elected or appointed at large, shall be divided into either two, three, four, or five classes for the purpose of staggering their terms of office and that all or some of the directors elected or appointed otherwise than at large shall be divided into the same or a different number of classes, not exceeding five, for the same purpose. All classes shall be as nearly equal in number as possible and, if provision has been made for cumulative voting, no class shall include less than three directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05RDHA"</field>N-PCL &s;§704(a). The terms of office of the directors initially classified shall be as follows: that of the first class shall expire at the next annual meeting of members if there be members or of the board if there be no members; the second class at the second succeeding annual meeting; the third class, if any, at the third annual meeting, and so on. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATXC"</field>N-PCL &s;§704(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DN28"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>541</trace>
Section 3.04. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057NN"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§705, 704.
Section 3.05. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>There is no provision. But see ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATXF"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(f), which provides that the bylaws may contain any provision relating to the new powers or rights of the corporation's directors not inconsistent with New York law or the certificate of incorporation.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DN2B"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§55<trace>2</trace> to 55<trace>4</trace>
Section 3.06. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law provides that any or all of the directors may be removed for cause by vote of the directors, provided there is a quorum of not less than a majority present at the meeting of directors at which such action is taken. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GG77"</field>N-PCL &s;§706(a).
Research References
<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M2GZ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§56<trace>3</trace> to 5<trace>65</trace>
Section 3.07. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00OVLV"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§708, 710, and 711.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VKV6"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(a). Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice, whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080Y6"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board unless required by the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00AU32"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DN7Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>595 to 607</trace>
Section 3.08. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GGCU"</field>N-PCL &s;§707. See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I0057TD"</field>Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep't 2014), stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The act of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present will be the act of the board of directors unless the act of a greater number is required by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080Y9"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(d).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00AU35"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§605</trace>
Section 3.09. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Provision is made in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for informal action by directors. Unless<trace.deleted/><trace> otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee.</trace>. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DN81"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any one or more members of the board or of any committee thereof who is not physically present at a meeting of the board or a committee may participate by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means will constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GGCX"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J9HT"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§60<trace>2</trace>
Section 3.10. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Both a short and long form for this section is provided, in the event that practitioners may wish to include the specific statutory limitations on the authority committees may exercise.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field><trace> The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace>To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M2MP"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05VKUW"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>592 to 594</trace>
Section 3.11.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>A corporation may pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05RD5K"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).

Section 3.12. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The board of directors of a not-for-profit corporation is required by the statute to present at the annual meeting of the members of the corporation a report, verified by the President and treasurer or by a majority of the directors or certified by an independent public or certified public accountant or a firm of such accountants selected by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080YE"</field>N-PCL &s;§519.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The board of directors of not-for-profit corporations that have no members must direct the President and treasurer to present an annual report pursuant to provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I00AU3A"</field>N-PCL &s;§519(c).
Research References

 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GGD2"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§3<trace>7</trace>8<trace.deleted/>
Section 3.13. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that the sale, mortgage, or lease of real property of the corporation must be authorized by a vote of two-thirds of the entire board of directors, provided that if there are 21 or more directors, the vote of a majority of the entire board is sufficient. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9HY"</field>N-PCL &s;§509.

 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M2MU"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1267 </trace>to <trace.deleted/><trace>1271</trace>
Section 4.01. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>►<field>st.ref.id="I0057UN"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b) provides that the certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all or specific officers shall be elected by the members rather than the board. Alternatively, such provision may authorize the President to appoint other officers (or some of them), subject to approval by the board. Under ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080ZJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(d), the certificate or bylaws may provide that any one or more officers shall be ex-officio members of the board, with voting rights unless otherwise specified. Consider whether inclusion of such provisions in the certificate or in a bylaw adopted by the members is relevant. See also ►<field>st.ref.id="I00AU4F"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DN9B"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
Section 4.02. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Officers may be elected by the members if the certificate of incorporation or bylaw adopted by the members so provides. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GGE7"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Note that under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9J3"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(a), the removal power of the board should not extend to officers elected or appointed by the members or by a class of members. The board may, however, suspend these officers for cause.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Any officer elected or appointed by the board may be removed by the board with or without cause. An officer elected by the members may be removed, with or without cause, only by vote of the members, but the authority to act as an officer may be suspended by the board for cause. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M2NZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(a). The removal will be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the person so removed. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00OVSV"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(b). Election or appointment of an officer will not of itself create any contract rights. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0057UQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080ZM"</field>N-PCL &s;§714.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00AU4I"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>566 to 568</trace>

Section 5.02. 
Drafter's Note

Section 5.04. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Every not-for-profit corporation is required to keep, at the office of the corporation, correct and complete books and records of account and minutes of the proceedings of its members, board, and executive committee, if any, and must keep at such office or at the office of its transfer agent or registrar in this state a list or record containing the names and addresses of all members, the class or classes of membership or capital certificates and the number of capital certificates held by each, and the dates when they respectively became the holders of record thereof. A corporation may keep its books and records of account in an office of the corporation without the state, as specified in its certificate of incorporation. Any of the foregoing books, minutes, and records may be in written form or in any other form capable of being converted into written form within a reasonable time. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05N528"</field>N-PCL &s;§621(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Any person who has been a member of record of a corporation for at least six months immediately preceding his or her demand, or any person holding, or thereunto authorized in writing by the holders of, at least 5&percnt;% of any class of the outstanding capital certificates, upon at least five-days written demand shall have the right to examine in person or by agent or attorney, during usual business hours, its minutes of the proceedings of its members and list or record of members and to make extracts therefrom. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DNF3"</field>N-PCL &s;§621(b).
Research References

Section 5.05. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05VKGM"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§602, 801, 802.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DNF8"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.

Section 5.06. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>If a disqualified person engages in self-dealing with a trust, that person is subject to a 10&percnt;% tax that goes up to 200&percnt;% if the self-dealing is not rectified. A disqualified person is one or more of the following: (See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9P0"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4946(a).)
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>1) a substantial contributor;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>2) a foundation manager;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>3) a person who owns more than 20&percnt;% of a corporation, partnership, trust, or unincorporated enterprise which is itself a substantial contributor; and/or
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>4) a member of the family of any individual of the first three categories.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Self-dealing does not include a transaction between a private foundation and a disqualified person where the disqualified person status arises only as a result of the transaction. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00581Q"</field>26 C.F.R. &s;§53.4941(d)-1(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>Self-dealing includes any of the following acts, engaged in directly or indirectly by a &ldquo;“disqualified person&rdquo;” (►<field>st.ref.id="I00816M"</field>26 C.F.R. &s;§53.4941(d)-2.)
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>a. sale or exchange, or leasing, of property between a private foundation and a disqualified person; (►<field>st.ref.id="I00AUBI"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4941(d)(1)(A).)
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>b. loan of money or other extension of credit between a private foundation and a disqualified person; (►<field>st.ref.id="I00DNGE"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4941(d)(1)(B).)
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>c. furnishing of goods, services, or facilities between a private foundation and a disqualified person; (►<field>st.ref.id="I00GGLA"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4941(d)(1)(C).)
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>d. payment of compensation, or payment or reimbursement of expenses, by a private foundation to a disqualified person; (►<field>st.ref.id="I00J9Q6"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4941(d)(1)(D).)
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>e. transfer to, or use by or for the benefit of, a disqualified person of the income or assets of a private foundation; (►<field>st.ref.id="I00M2V2"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4941(d)(1)(E).) and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>f. agreement by a private foundation to make any payment of money or other property to a government official, other than an agreement to employ such individual for any period after the termination of his or her government service if such individual is terminating that service within a 90-day period. (►<field>st.ref.id="I05VKE6"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§4941(d)(1)(F).)
<trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>st.ref.id="I05N4ZI"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§722 et seq. and 726
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GGLC"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>801 to 810</trace>
Section 5.07. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that no loans, other than through the purchase of bonds, debentures, or similar obligations of the type customarily sold in public offerings or through ordinary deposit of funds in a bank, may be made by a not-for-profit corporation to its directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers<trace> or key persons</trace> or to any other corporation, firm, association, or other entity in which one or more of its directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers <trace>or key persons </trace>are directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers <trace>or key persons </trace>or hold a substantial financial interest, except a loan by one charitable corporation to another charitable corporation. The statute further provides that a loan made in violation of this provision constitutes a violation of the duty to the corporation of the directors or officers authorizing it or participating in it, but the obligation of the borrower with respect to the loan is not affected thereby. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00581V"</field>N-PCL &s;§716.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00816R"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§7<trace>19</trace>

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55229b01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE 1  PURPOSE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>[Name of corporation] has been formed as a not-for-profit corporation under the New York Not-For-Profit Corporation Law. Its purpose is to [statement of purpose], as set forth in the Certificate of Incorporation filed with the New York State Department of State on [date of filing].
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE 2  GOVERNANCE AND MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Management of Corporate Affairs. The governance and management of the affairs of the corporation shall be vested in a Board of Directors. All the powers of the corporation shall be exercised by the Board of Directors in such manner and upon such terms and conditions as it may determine.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Members. The corporation shall have no members with a right to vote as that term is defined in ►<field>sst.ref.id="I00AUBN"</field>ARTICLE 6 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Annual Meetings. The annual meeting of the corporation, for the election of Directors and for the transaction of such other business as may be set forth in the notice of meeting, shall be held at the principal office of the corporation or at such place as the Board of Directors shall determine each year by resolution.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Notices and Voting. Any notice required or permitted by law or under these bylaws may be given or sent via postal mail or through electronic means.
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Any Director who provides the corporation with a valid e-mail address consents to receiving official notices via e-mail unless such member requests in writing to receive notices via postal mail.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>An electronic communication shall constitute a writing for all purposes of conducting the business of the corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Written and/or electronic consent thus given by all Directors entitled to vote shall have the same effect as a unanimous vote.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE 3  DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Number. The number of Directors shall be determined from time to time by the Board of Directors, but in no event shall there be less than three.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Election of Directors. The Directors shall be elected by the Board of Directors at the annual meeting of the Corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Term. Each Director shall serve a [number of year]-year term, or until their successors are duly elected and qualified. At the initial meeting of the Corporation, the Directors shall be divided into [number of classes] classes for terms of [specification of lengths of terms]; thereafter all elections shall be for [number of years]-year terms except for the filling of vacancies as provided in Section 3.4.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Vacancies. Vacancies on the Board of Directors occurring during the year for any reason, including an increase in the number of Directors, shall be filled for the unexpired term by a majority vote of the remaining Directors at any meeting called for that purpose.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Resignation. Any Director of the corporation may resign at any time by giving written notice of resignation to the Secretary. Unless otherwise specified in such notice, the resignation shall take effect upon receipt thereof, and the acceptance of the resignation shall not be necessary to make it effective.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Removal of Directors. Any Director may only be removed with cause, at any meeting of the Board of Directors, notice of which shall have referred to the proposed action, by the vote in person or by proxy of a majority of the Directors entitled to vote.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Meeting of Directors. There shall be regular meetings of the Board of Directors to make management decisions relating to the operations of the Corporation. Regular and special meetings of the Board of Directors shall be called and held at such times and at such places in New York or elsewhere as the Board of Directors or the President, or, in his or her absence, any Vice-President, may determine. A special meeting of the Board of Directors may also be called at the written request of any [number of directors] Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Responsibility to Attend Meetings. Every Director is expected to attend [amount of meetings] of the regularly scheduled Board meetings and no member shall miss [number of meetings] consecutive meetings without approval of the Board of Directors, failure of which shall be cause for removal.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.9. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Notice of Meetings of Board of Directors. Once duly called, notice of each meeting of the Board of Directors, stating the time and place and purposes thereof, may be given by any member of the board to each member of the board. Meetings of the Board of Directors may be held at any place and time without notice by unanimous consent of all the Directors. The notice of any meeting of the Board of Directors may be waived by a Director either before or after such meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.10. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Quorum. A quorum, equal to a majority of the entire Board of Directors, shall be required for the transaction of business. Unless otherwise provided, the vote of a majority of the Directors present shall decide any question that may come before the meeting. A majority of the Directors present at any meeting, although less than a quorum, may adjourn the same from time to time, without notice other than announcement at the meeting, until a quorum is present.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.11. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Procedure. The order of business and all other matters of procedure at every meeting of Directors may be determined by the presiding officer.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.12. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Attendance by Telephonic Means. Any Director may attend and participate in any meeting of the Board, the corporation, or a committee thereof by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.13. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Annual Report. The Directors shall prepare and present at the annual meeting of the corporation a balance sheet showing the financial and other affairs of such corporation during the preceding year.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.14. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Compensation of Directors. No Director of the corporation shall receive, directly or indirectly, salary, compensation, fee or profit from the corporation, either as a Director or in any other capacity, except reasonable compensation for services actually rendered in effecting one or more of its corporate purposes. No paid employee of the Corporation may act as Chair or presiding officer of the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3.15. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Conflict of Interest. The Board of Directors shall adopt and maintain a conflict of interest policy.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE 4  COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>4.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>The Board of Directors, by resolution, may designate one or more committees, which to the extent provided in said resolution or resolutions, shall have and may exercise such powers as may be lawfully delegated by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE 5  OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Officers. The Board of Directors shall appoint or elect officers at the annual meeting of the corporation. The officers of the Board shall be a President, a Secretary, a Treasurer, and such other officers as it shall deem necessary; such additional officers to hold their offices for such terms and to exercise such powers and perform such duties as shall be determined from time to time by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Term of Office. The officers of the corporation specified above shall, unless otherwise determined by the Directors, hold office for [term of office] and until their successors are elected and have qualified. Any officer may be removed at any time with or without cause by the affirmative vote of a majority of the Board of Directors. If the office of any officer becomes vacant, such vacancy shall be filled by the Board of Directors. Removal of an officer, in their capacity as an officer, does not in itself constitute a removal of such person as a Director of the Corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>President. The President shall preside at all meetings of the Board and the Corporation, shall have the general powers and duties of supervision and management of the corporation which usually pertain to such office, and shall perform all such other duties as are properly required by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Vice President. The Vice President shall assist the President in the discharge of his or her duties and preside at meetings of the Board and the Association in the absence of the President. In any case, where the President is unable to act, the Vice President shall perform the duties of the office of President.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Secretary. The Secretary, or the Secretary's designee, shall issue notices of all meetings required by law or these Bylaws. The Secretary shall attend meetings of the Board of Directors, keep the minutes thereof, and shall ensure that the minutes of the Board are prepared, distributed, amended as needed, and approved by the Board. The Secretary shall perform such duties as usually pertain to such office or as are properly required of the Secretary by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Treasurer. The Treasurer shall have the care and custody of all funds and securities of the corporation. The Treasurer shall cause to be entered in books of the corporation to be kept for that purpose full and accurate accounts of all moneys received and paid on account of the corporation. The Treasurer shall make and sign such reports, statements, and instruments as may be required of the Treasurer by law or the Board of Directors, and shall perform such other duties as usually pertain to the Treasurer's office or as are properly required of the Treasurer by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Officers Holding Two or More Offices. Any two of the above-mentioned offices, except that of President and Secretary, may be held by the same person.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>5.8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Compensation of Officers. No officer of the corporation shall receive, directly or indirectly, any part of the income or earnings of the corporation nor any pecuniary profit from the operation of the corporation but each officer may receive reasonable compensation for services actually rendered in effecting one or more of the corporate purposes.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE 6  INDEMNIFICATION OF DIRECTORS ANDOFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>6.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Indemnification. If a Director or officer of the corporation is made a party to any civil or criminal action or proceeding in any matter arising from the performance by such Director or officer of his or her duties for or on behalf of the corporation, then, to the full extent permitted by law, the corporation, upon an affirmative vote of the Board of Directors, a quorum of Directors being present at the time of the vote who are not parties to the action or proceeding, shall:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Advance to such Director or officer all sums found by the board, so voting, to be necessary and appropriate to enable the Director or officer to conduct his or her defense, or appeal, in the action or proceeding; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Indemnify such Director or officer for all sums paid by him or her in the way of judgments, fines, amounts paid in settlement and reasonable expenses, including attorneys' fees actually and necessarily incurred, in connection with the action or proceeding, or appeal therein, subject to the proper application of credit for any sums advanced to the Director or officer pursuant to the previous subsection.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>6.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Such right of indemnification shall be a contract right that may be enforced in any manner desired by such Director or officer. Such right of indemnification shall not be exclusive of any other right that such Director or officer may have or hereafter acquire. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, such Director or officer shall be entitled to his or her rights of indemnification under any agreement, resolution of members, resolution of Directors, provisions of law or otherwise, as well as his or her rights under this Bylaw.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE 7  FINANCES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>7.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Finances. The funds of the corporation shall be deposited in its name with such bank or banks, trust company or trust companies as the Board of Directors may from time to time designate. All checks, notes, drafts and other negotiable instruments of the corporation shall be signed by such officers, agents, or employees as the Board of Directors from time to time by resolution may designate.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>7.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>Fiscal Year. The fiscal year of the corporation shall be the calendar year unless otherwise provided by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE 8  AMENDMENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"</field>These Bylaws maybe added to, amended, altered, or repealed at any meeting of Directors by the affirmative vote of two-thirds of the Board of Directors. Notice of any amendment and the substance thereof shall be given to the Directors at least [number of days] days in advance of the meeting at which the proposed changes are to be considered.

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55277d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>I OFFICES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Principal Office. The principal office of the Corporation shall be located in [name of city], [name of county], [name of state].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Other Offices. The Corporation may also have offices at such other places, both within and without the State of New York, as the Board of Directors may from time to time determine or
 the business of the Corporation may require.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>II MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>The Corporation shall have no members.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>III DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Number, Qualification, Election and Term of Directors. The business of the Corporation shall be managed by its Board of Directors, which shall consist of at least three directors who shall each be at least 18 years of age. The number of directors may be changed by a majority vote of the entire Board, provided that no decrease shall shorten the tenure of any incumbent director. Except as hereinafter otherwise provided, directors shall be assigned to one of two classes and shall be elected for terms of [number of years] years by a plurality of the votes cast by the directors and shall hold office until their resignation or until the election and qualification of their respective successors. Directors may be reelected to serve consecutive terms but no director may serve more than [number of terms] consecutive [number of years]-year terms.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Resignation and Removal of Directors. Any director may resign from office at any time by delivering a written notice of resignation to the Board of Directors and the acceptance of the resignation, unless required by its terms, shall not be necessary to make such resignation effective. Any or all of the directors may be removed for cause by vote of the Board of Directors at any meeting, provided there is a quorum of not less than a majority present at such meeting of directors at which such action is taken.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Newly Created Directorships and Vacancies. Newly created directorships resulting from an increase in the number of directors and vacancies in the Board of Directors for any reason may be filled by a majority vote of the directors then in office regardless of their number. Newly-elected Directors shall be assigned to class and shall serve until the term of the selected class expires.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Quorum and Manner of Acting. A majority of the entire Board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business or of any specified item of business. Action of the Board of Directors shall be authorized by the vote of a majority of the directors present at a meeting duly assembled at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at such time, unless otherwise provided by law or these bylaws. In the absence of a quorum, a majority of the directors present may adjourn any meeting to another time and place.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Action By Board of Directors or Committee Without a Meeting. Any action required or permitted to be taken by the Board of Directors or by any committee of the Board of Directors may be taken without a meeting if all of the members of the Board of Directors or of such committee consent in writing to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Written consents may be in the form of fax, e-mail or original documents. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the Board of Directors or such committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceeding of the Board of Directors or of such committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Participation in Board or Committee Meetings by Conference Telephone. Any one or more directors or members of any committee of the Board of Directors may participate in a meeting of the Board of Directors or of such committee by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Place of Meetings. Regular meetings of the Board of Directors may be held at any place within or without the State of New York. Special meetings may be held at other locations as determined by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Annual and Regular Meetings. The Board of Directors shall hold at least [number of meetings] regular meetings in each year: Annual meetings of the Board of Directors, for the election of officers and consideration of other matters, shall be held in [name of month] in each year, or as soon thereafter as is practicable, or as determined by the Board of Directors and specified in the notice of a meeting as provided in Section 3.10 of these bylaws. Regular meetings of the Board of Directors may be held without notice at such times and places as the Board of Directors determines. If the day fixed for a regular meeting is a legal holiday, the meeting shall be held the next business day.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.9. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Special Meetings. Special meetings of the Board of Directors may be called at any time by any director upon written demand of not less than one-fifth of the entire Board or by the President.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.10. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Notice of Meetings; Waiver of Notice. Notice of the time and place of each special meeting of the Board of Directors, and of each annual meeting, shall be given to each director by mailing it to him or her at his or her residence or usual place of business at least [number of days] days before the meeting or by fax, e-mail, telephone, or telegraph at least [number of days] days before the meeting. Notice need not be given to any director who submits a waiver of notice before or after the meeting or who attends the meeting without protesting the lack of notice to him or her, either before the meeting or when it begins. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. Notice of any adjourned meeting need not be given, other than by announcement at the meeting at which the adjournment is taken.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.11. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Compensation. Directors shall not receive compensation for their services, but the Board of Directors may authorize reimbursement of their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses in connection with the performance of their duties.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3.12. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Presiding Officer. The President shall preside at all Board meetings. Otherwise, the Vice President, if also a director and present and acting, or any other director chosen by the Board, shall preside.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>IV COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Executive Committee and Other Committees. The Board of Directors, by resolution adopted by a majority of the entire Board, may designate an Executive Committee or other committees, each consisting of three or more directors, and each of which shall have all the authority of the Board of Directors, except as otherwise provided in such resolution or by law, and each of which shall serve at the pleasure of the Board of Directors. All action of the Executive Committee and such other committees shall be reported to the Board of Directors at the Board of Directors' next meeting. The Executive Committee and such other committees shall adopt rules of procedure and shall meet as provided by those rules or by resolutions of the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors shall have the power at any time to fill vacancies in, to change the membership of, or to discharge such Committees.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>V OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Number; Security. The executive officers of the Corporation shall be the President, one or more Vice Presidents, a Secretary, and a Treasurer. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and Secretary.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Election; Term of Office. The executive officers of the Corporation shall be elected annually by the Board of Directors and each such officer shall hold office until the election and qualification of his or her successor.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Subordinate Officers. The Board of Directors may appoint subordinate officers (including assistant secretaries and assistant treasurers), as it may deem proper, each of whom shall hold office for such period and have such powers and duties as the Board of Directors determines. The Board of Directors may delegate to any executive officer or to any committee the power to appoint and define the powers and duties of any subordinate officers.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Resignation and Removal of Officers. Any officer may resign at any time by delivering a written notice of resignation to the Board of Directors. Any officer elected or appointed by the Board of Directors may be removed by the Board of Directors with or without cause.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Vacancies. A vacancy in any office may be filled for the unexpired term by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>President/Chief Executive Officer. The President shall be the chief executive officer of the Corporation with, subject to limitations expressly set forth in these Bylaws, such powers and duties as Presidents of corporations usually have as well as those which from time to time may be assigned to him or her by the Board of Directors. Subject to the direction of the Board of Directors, the President shall supervise and direct the daily management of the business, affairs and property of the Corporation. The President shall be charged with overseeing that all orders and resolutions of the Board of Directors are carried into effect. The President, together with any Vice President, may sign and execute documents in the name of the Corporation including, but not limited to, checks and bank authorizations.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Vice President. Subject to limitations expressly set forth in these Bylaws, each Vice President shall have such powers and perform such duties as the board of Directors or the President may from time to time assign to him or her.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>The Treasurer. The treasurer shall be the chief financial officer of the Corporation and shall be in charge of the Corporation's books and accounts. Subject to the control of the Board of Directors, he or she shall have such other powers and perform such other duties as the Board of Directors or the President may from time to time assign to him or her.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.9. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>The Secretary. The Secretary shall be the Secretary of, and keep the minutes of, all meetings of the Board of Directors, shall be responsible for giving notice of all meetings of the Board of Directors, and shall keep the seal and, when authorized by the Board of Directors, apply it to any instrument requiring it. Subject to the control of the Board of Directors, he or she shall have such other powers and perform such other duties as the Board of Directors or the President may from time to time assign to him or her. In the absence of the Secretary from any meeting, the minutes shall be kept by the person appointed for that purpose by the presiding officer.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.10. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>The Executive Director and Employees. An executive director may have the responsibility for conducting the day-to-day operations of the Corporation and such other duties as the Board may assign him or her. He or she may have such other powers as the chief operating officer of a not-for-profit corporation usually has. Compensation for the Executive Director and other employees of the Corporation shall be determined by the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5.11. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Duties. All officers, as between themselves and the Corporation, shall have such authority and perform such duties in the management of the Corporation as may be provided in these Bylaws, or, to the extent not so provided, as may be provided by resolution of the Board of Directors or, as to all other officers, by the President. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in these Bylaws, in order to be effective and binding upon the Corporation contractual documents must be executed by two (2) executive officers of the Corporation, and checks and bank authorizations must be executed by two (2) executive officers of the Corporation.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>VI NOT-FOR-PROFIT COMPLIANCE
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>6.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Purpose. The Corporation is organized to [statement of purpose] and to engage in other related activities permissible for organizations qualifying under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00588X"</field>section 50l(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>6.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Restriction of Activities. No part of the net earnings of the Corporation shall inure to the benefit of, or be distributable to, its members, directors, officers, or other private persons, except that the Corporation shall be authorized and empowered to pay reasonable compensation for services rendered and to make payments and distributions in furtherance of the purposes set forth in Section 6.1. No substantial part of the activities of the Corporation shall be the carrying on of propaganda, or otherwise attempting to influence legislation, and the Corporation shall not participate in, or intervene in (including the publishing or distribution of statements) any political campaign on behalf of or in opposition to any candidate for public office. Notwithstanding any other provision of these bylaws, the Corporation shall not carry on any other activities not permitted to be carried on (a) by an organization exempt from federal income tax under ►<field>st.ref.id="I0081DT"</field>section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code, or (b) by an organization, contributions to which are deductible under ►<field>st.ref.id="I005G3X"</field>section 170(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>6.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Conflicts of Interest. No member of the Board of Directors, officer, member, or, except as provided in section 5.10 of these Bylaws, employee, shall derive any personal profit or gain, directly or indirectly, by reason of his or her association with the Corporation. Each individual shall disclose to the Board of Directors any personal interest which he or she, a family member or close business associate may have in any matter pending before the Corporation. Each Individual shall refrain from participation in any decision on such matter. Exceptions to this Bylaw may be made by decision of the Board provided the individual having the direct or indirect personal interest discloses it fully to the Board and refrains from participation in the discussion and voting with respect to such matter.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>6.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Dissolution. In the case of the dissolution of the Corporation or the winding up of its affairs, the Corporation shall discharge all its liabilities. Any assets remaining after all liabilities have been discharged shall be distributed for one or more exempt purposes within the meaning of ►<field>st.ref.id="I00898T"</field>section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code, or shall be distributed to the federal government, or to a state or local government for a public purposes. Any assets not so disposed of shall be disposed of by a court of competent jurisdiction exclusively for such purposes or to such organizations as said court shall determine, which are organized and operated exclusively for such purposes.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>VII INDEMNIFICATION OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>7.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Right to Indemnification. The Corporation shall indemnify any person who was or is a party, or is threatened to be made a party, to any action or proceeding by reason of the fact that such person is or was an Officer, Director, employee, or agent of this Corporation, or is or was serving at the request of this Corporation as a director, officer, employee, or agent of another foreign or domestic corporation, partnership, joint venture, or other enterprise, against expenses, judgment, fines, settlements, and other amounts actually and reasonably incurred in connection with such proceeding, to the fullest extent permitted under the New York State Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. The indemnification provided herein shall not be deemed exclusive of any other rights to which those indemnified may be entitled, and shall continue as to a person who has ceased to be an agent and shall insure to the benefit of the heirs, executors, and administrators of such a person.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>7.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Insurance. This Corporation may, and to the fullest extent practicable shall, purchase and maintain insurance on behalf of any Director, Officer, employee, or agent of the Corporation, against any liability asserted against or incurred by the Director, Officer, employee or agent in any such capacity or arising out of the Director's, Officer's, employee's, or agent's status as such, whether or not the Corporation would have the power to indemnify the agent against such liability under Section 7.1 of these Bylaws; provided, however, that the Corporation shall have no power to purchase and maintain such insurance to indemnify any Director, Officer, or agent of the Corporation for any self-dealing transaction.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>VIII MISCELLANEOUS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>8.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Fiscal Year. The fiscal year of the Corporation shall be the calendar year, unless otherwise determined by the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>8.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Contracts, Checks, Bank Accounts. The funds of the Corporation shall be deposited in the Corporation's name with such banks, trust companies or other depositories as the Board may designate. The Board of Directors shall determine who shall be authorized from time to time to sign checks, drafts or other orders for the payment of money, acceptances, notes or other evidences of indebtedness, to enter into contracts or to execute and deliver other documents and instruments.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>8.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Annual Reports. The Board of Directors shall direct the President and Treasurer of the Corporation to present at each annual meeting of the Board of Directors a financial report in accordance with the requirements of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>8.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Amendment. These bylaws may be amended, added to, rescinded or repealed at a meeting by a majority of the entire Board, except that any amendment which changes or strikes any provision specifying the quorum requirement or the proportion of votes necessary for the transaction of business or of any specified item of business must be authorized by a vote of two-thirds of the entire Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>8.5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"</field>Definition of &ldquo;“entire Board.&rdquo;” As used in these bylaws, the term &ldquo;“entire Board&rdquo;” means the total number of directors entitled to vote which the Corporation would have if there were no vacancies.

►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE I  MEETINGS OF MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. Annual Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The annual meeting of the members of the Corporation shall be held as provided in section [number of section] of the Certificate of Incorporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. Special Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>Special meetings of members may be called and held as provided by section [number of section] of the Certificate of Incorporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. Order of Business. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>At the annual meeting of the members the following is the order of business: [Specification of order of business].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE II  DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The directors of this corporation are elected as provided by Section [number of section] of the Certificate of Incorporation, and vacancies in the board are filled as provided in that section.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The Board of Directors may adopt any rules and regulations for the conduct of their meetings and management of the affairs of the corporation that they may deem proper, not inconsistent with the laws of the State of New York, the Certificate of Incorporation, or these Bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>Meetings of the directors are called and held as provided by Section [number of section] of the Certificate of Incorporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>All committees are appointed by the President and, if not so appointed, are appointed by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The Board of Directors shall also act as a committee on admissions for election to membership. All nominations of candidates for election to the association must be submitted to the directors for approval. No candidate may be presented for election at a meeting of the members until ratified and approved by at least [number of directors] of the directors as provided in the charter.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE III  OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The board of directors, immediately after the annual meeting, shall choose one of their number by a majority vote to be President, and likewise one to be Vice President, and another to be Treasurer. They shall also appoint some suitable person to be Secretary. Each of these officers shall serve for a term of one year or until the next annual election.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The President shall preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors and shall act as temporary chairperson at, and call to order, all meetings of the members. The President shall appoint and discharge agents and employees, subject to the approval of the board of directors. The President shall have the general management of the affairs of the corporation and perform all the duties incidental to his or her office.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The Treasurer has the care and custody of all the funds and securities of the corporation and shall deposit these funds in the name of the corporation in a bank or trust company chosen by the directors; the Treasurer shall, when duly authorized by the board of directors, sign and execute all contracts in the name of the corporation when countersigned by the President; the Treasurer shall also sign all checks, drafts, notes, and orders for the payment of money, which must be duly authorized by the board of directors and countersigned by the President; the Treasurer shall at all reasonable times exhibit his or her books and accounts to any director or member of the corporation upon application at the office of the corporation during ordinary business hours. At the end of each corporate year, the Treasurer shall have an audit of the accounts of the corporation made by a committee appointed by the President and shall present this audit in writing at the annual meeting of the members, at which time the Treasurer shall also present an annual report setting forth in full the financial condition of the corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The Secretary shall keep the minutes of the board of directors and also the minutes of the members. The Secretary has the custody of the seal of the corporation and shall affix and attest the same to documents when duly authorized by the board of directors. The Secretary shall attend to the giving and serving of all notices of the corporation and shall have charge of any books and papers that the board of directors directs; the Secretary shall attend to such correspondence as may be assigned to him or her and perform all the duties incidental to his or her office. The Secretary shall keep a book containing the names, alphabetically arranged, of all persons who are members of the corporation, showing their places of residence and the time when they became members.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE IV  INSPECTORS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>Two inspectors of election shall be elected at each annual meeting of members to serve for one year. If any inspector refuses to serve or is not present, the meeting may appoint an inspector in his or her place.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE V  SEALS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The seal of the corporation is as follows:
►<field>fac.lo="n"</field>[Seal]
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE VI  MISCELLANEOUS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>At the beginning of each corporate year, all surplus income remaining unexpended and in any excess of any obligation then incurred shall be added to the principal of the corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>All accumulated capital not already invested in the stock of [name of corporation] shall be so invested that it may readily be transformed into cash for the purpose of purchasing stock or bonds of [name of corporation] as from time to time may be possible.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>It being one of the objects of corporation to receive and hold, collect and preserve family portraits and heirlooms of the [specification of family] and matter connected with the history of that family, and documents and books relating to the family (the &ldquo;“articles&rdquo;”), with power to add to and publish the same and to designate and maintain a place of deposit for receiving, holding, collecting, preserving, and exhibiting these articles, as an undivided collection, these articles, as they may, from time to time, be received, shall be preserved and exhibited as an undivided collection. If it ever is necessary, pursuant to law and the provisions of the Certificate of Incorporation, to sell or transfer these articles, they shall be sold as an undivided collection and in such a manner as will preserve, as far as may be under the conditions which may then exist, the spirit and intent of the Certificate of Incorporation. These articles shall not be distributed among various persons and places either by sale, loan, or otherwise.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The place of deposit, designated by the members of the corporation at the annual meeting for receiving, holding, collecting, preserving, and exhibiting the articles mentioned in ARTICLE II, Section 3, and ARTICLE VIII of the Charter, and in ARTICLE VI, Section 3 of the bylaws shall be a proper place for the management, maintenance, and inspection of the same by the board of directors. The directors shall keep an inventory of the articles and subject to due preservation of these articles shall in their discretion permit inspection of the same. The directors shall report in writing at the annual meeting the condition of the articles and shall in such report recommend for designation the place of deposit of the articles.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>Pursuant to the provisions of Section 5 of the &ldquo;“Second&rdquo;” division of the Certificate of Incorporation of the corporation, the directors of the corporation, by the concurring vote of all and at least seven directors, are expressly authorized to take any and all action which in their judgment may be necessary or desirable to effectuate the following purposes and enumerated objects for which the corporation is formed:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>To support, maintain, and educate a person or persons other than a member or members of the [specification of family] and to contribute towards the maintenance of educational institutions otherwise than for the education of members of the [specification of family] and to contribute to charitable and benevolent uses and to religious purposes, as from time to time the Board of Directors deems proper and desirable.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE VII  AMENDMENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>These bylaws may be amended at any meeting of the members by a vote of a majority of all the members of the corporation, provided that the proposed amendment is inserted in the notice of such meeting. A copy of the amended bylaw shall be sent to each member within [number of days] days after its adoption.
Notes to Form

ARTICLE I, 
Section 1. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005G44"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(b).
