ARTICLE I, 
Section 2. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVIS"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GONO"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§897</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 1. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that directors shall be elected or appointed in the manner provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I005G5A"</field>N-PCL &s;§703(b). There is no prohibition in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law against holding an election for directors by mail.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089A6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§544</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 3. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B2F2"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(a). Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice, whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVJY"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GOOU"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I005G5C"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>595 to 607</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field><trace> The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace>To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0089A8"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00B2F4"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace>592 to 594</trace>
ARTICLE III. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, and a treasurer and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVK0"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GOOW"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00JHTS"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
ARTICLE IV. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that if the bylaws require inspectors at any shareholders' or members' meeting, such requirement is waived unless compliance therewith is requested by a shareholder or member present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at such meeting. Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board, in advance of the meeting, may appoint one or more inspectors to act at the meeting or any adjournment thereof, and if inspectors are not so appointed, the person presiding at the meeting may, and on the request of any shareholder or member entitled to vote thereat must, appoint one or more inspectors. In case any person appointed fails to appear or act, the vacancy may be filled by appointment made by the board in advance of the meeting or at the meeting by the person presiding thereat. Each inspector, before entering upon the discharge of his or her duties, must take and sign an oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector at the meeting with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05V46Y"</field>N-PCL &s;§610(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05QWHM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>926, 927</trace>
ARTICLE VII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"</field>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05MOSA"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05IH2Y"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§127</trace>
30:102. Bylaws-- Youth center

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5533b201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>BYLAWS OF [NAME OF CORPORATION]
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>1. Membership. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The members of the Corporation consist of those persons who are members of the Board of Directors. A person elected to the Board of Directors thereby becomes a member, and such membership continues during the period that the member is a duly qualified and acting Director. Any Director who dies, resigns, fails reelection to the Board of Directors, or is for any reason removed from the Board of Directors shall thereby cease to be a member of the Corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>2. Rights of Members. 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(a). Property Rights. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>No member of the Corporation is entitled to any right or interest in or to the property or assets of the Corporation. All property and assets of the Corporation are subject to the direction, control of, and expenditure by the Board of Directors. If the Corporation is liquidated or dissolved or otherwise ceases business, the property and assets of the Corporation shall be distributed in accordance with the direction of a majority of the then qualified and acting Directors present at any meeting duly called for that purpose and without other affirmative action by the members.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>(b). Voting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Each member of the Corporation is entitled to one vote in person or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the members of the Corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  MEETINGS OF MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>1. Annual and Special Meetings of Members. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The annual meeting of the members of the Corporation shall be held at a time and place designated by the Board of Directors and specified in the notice of that meeting. Special meetings of the members shall be held at a time and place designated by the Board of Directors and specified in the notice of that meeting. A notice of any annual or special meeting is sufficient if deposited in the mails not less than [number of days] nor more than [number of days] days prior to the meeting, addressed to the members at the respective addresses appearing on the records of the Corporation, and notice of any and all meetings may be waived by members, in writing, orally, or by attendance at the meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>2. Quorum. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>At any annual or special meeting of the members, [number of members] of the members, but if [names of members] be [number of members] members or more, [names of members] members constitute a quorum to transact any and all business.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>1. Number, Qualification, and Powers of Board of Directors. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The Board of Directors of the Corporation is identical and coextensive with and consists of the members and shall be not less than [minimum number of members of board] nor more than [maximum number of members of board] members as, from time to time, may be elected by the members of the Corporation at any annual or special meeting called for the purpose of electing Directors. All power and authority of the Corporation is vested in the Board of Directors and its committees, and all or any part of that power and authority, in addition to the power and authority delegated by these Bylaws to the Executive Committee, may be delegated to those committees of the Board of Directors that the Board from time to time determines.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>2. Vacancies. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Any member of the Board of Directors may resign by delivering his or her written resignation to the Secretary of the Corporation, and any member of the Board may be removed at any time by action of the Board. In case of any vacancy in the Board of Directors through death, disability, resignation, removal, or other cause, the remaining directors may elect his or her successor, who shall take office immediately and hold office for the unexpired portion of the term of the Director to whose place he or she is elected. The Board of Directors serving at any time is entitled to elect other persons to the Board of Directors and thereby to membership in the Corporation, subject to the foregoing limitation as to maximum and minimum numbers. The power to fill vacancies in the Board may be delegated to the Executive Committee, and the action by the Executive Committee in filling a vacancy is as effective as though taken by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3. Terms of Office. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The term of office of all Directors is unlimited.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>1. Regular and Special Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The Board of Directors shall hold meetings at times and places and in accordance with notice, if any, as from time to time is determined by the Board of Directors. In addition, any officer of the Corporation may call a meeting of the Board of Directors upon 24 hours' notice, delivered either by mail, personally, or by telephone. Any Director may waive any notice required to be given to him or her by law or under these Bylaws and by attendance at any meeting the director is deemed to have waived notice of that meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>2. Conduct of Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Three-fifths of the Board of Directors constitutes a quorum for the transaction of any business of the Corporation, provided, however, that if three-fifths be [number of directors] directors or more, [number of directors] Directors constitutes a quorum for the transaction of any and all business.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>If less than a quorum of the Board of Directors is present at any meeting, the meeting may be adjourned to a time and place as those present determine.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>1. Executive Committee. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The Board of Directors may elect from its members an Executive Committee that shall consist of [number of members] or more members, as the Board may determine, to serve during the pleasure of the Board. The Executive Committee shall exercise the powers of the Board of Directors in the interim between meetings of the Directors, with general power to discharge the duties of the Board of Directors, except as that power which, from time to time, may be limited by the Board. Three members of the Executive Committee or such number as the Board may determine constitute a quorum for the transaction of business, and at any meeting at which a quorum is present, a majority of those present and acting may bind the committee.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The Executive Committee shall keep books of separate minutes and report their action at every meeting of the Board of Directors or as often as they may be required by the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>2. Other Committees. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The Board of Directors, from time to time, may elect from its members other committees, which shall consist of a number that the Board deems advisable. Each such committee has the powers and shall perform the duties that are delegated to it by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>3. Technical Advisory Committee. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The Board of Directors, if it so desires, may select a Technical Advisory Committee of persons who need not be members of the Corporation which may counsel with and make recommendations to the Board of Directors with respect to the activities of this Corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VI  OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>1. Officers Designated. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The officers of the Corporation shall be elected by the Board of Directors to serve at the will of the Board of Directors. The officers of the Corporation, in addition to such other officers as may, from time to time, be elected by the Board of Directors (all of which officers shall be members of the Board, except Assistant Secretaries, if any, and Assistant Treasurers, if any) consist of the following:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Honorary Chair of the Board of Directors
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Chair of the Board of Directors
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>President
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Executive Vice President
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Four or more Vice Presidents
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Secretary
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Such number of Assistant Secretaries as may be selected
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Treasurer
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Such number of Assistant Treasurers as may be selected
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>All such officers have the authority and duties as are, from time to time, prescribed by the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors, in its discretion, may leave unfilled any office except that of President. One person may hold more than one office.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>2. Election of Officers. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The officers shall be elected at any meeting of the Board of Directors. The officers so elected at any such meeting shall take office immediately and shall hold office at the will of the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  AMENDMENTS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>These Bylaws may be amended, altered, repealed, or superseded, either in whole or in part, by the affirmative action of a majority of the members or Directors present at any meeting of the members or Directors, at which meeting a quorum of members or Directors is present and acting, provided that notice of the matter is included in the notice of the meeting.
Notes to Form

ARTICLE I, 
Section 1. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members or, in the case of a charitable corporation, may have no members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005GB7"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(a). If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0089G3"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including, but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B2KZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(c).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00DVPV"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GOUR"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§823</trace>
ARTICLE I, 
Section 2(b). 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, either absolutely or contingently, that the members of any class shall not be entitled to vote or may limit or define the matters on, and the circumstances in, which a member or a class of members shall be entitled to vote, and, except as otherwise provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, such provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws shall prevail, according to their tenor, in all elections and in all proceedings over the provisions of Chapter 6 of the Law which authorize any action by the members, but no such denial, limitation, or definition of voting rights shall be effective unless, at the time, one or more classes of members, singly or in the aggregate, are entitled to full voting rights. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005GB9"</field>N-PCL &s;§612.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089G5"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§916</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 1. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Meetings of members may be held at such place, either within or outside the state, as may be fixed by or under the bylaws or, if not so fixed, at the office of the corporation in the state. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B2L1"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVPX"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(c).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GOUT"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§<trace.deleted/><trace>§897</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>908</trace>
ARTICLE II, 
Section 2. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Members entitled to cast a majority of the total number of votes at a meeting will constitute a quorum at the meeting, provided that when a specified item of business is required to be voted on by a class of members, voting as a class, members entitled to cast a majority of the total votes entitled to be cast by such class will constitute a quorum for the transaction of such specified items of business. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00JHZP"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(a). The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide for any lesser quorum not less than the members entitled to cast 100 votes or one-tenth of the total number of votes entitled to be cast, whichever is lesser, and may, under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00MB4L"</field>N-PCL &s;§615, provide for a greater quorum. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00P49H"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(b). The members present may adjourn the meeting despite the absence of a quorum. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005GCF"</field>N-PCL &s;§608(d).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I0089HB"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§912</trace>
ARTICLE III. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Except as otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, each not-for-profit corporation must have a board of directors and the affairs of the corporation must be managed by or under the direction of the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B2M7"</field>N-PCL &s;§701(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that, in addition to any other liabilities imposed by law on directors of a corporation, directors who vote for, or concur in, any of certain enumerated actions will be jointly and severally liable to the corporation for the benefit of the corporation and its creditors, members, or other interested persons to the extent of any injury suffered by those persons as a result of the action. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVR3"</field>N-PCL &s;§719.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GOVZ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§7<trace>1</trace>
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I005GCH"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§68<trace>3</trace> et seq.
ARTICLE III, 
Section 3. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The bylaws provide that the term of office of all directors is unlimited. This provision grows out of the requirement that to be a member, one must be a member of the board of directors. However, this provision must be used cautiously because the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that the term of office of directors, other than those elected or appointed by virtue of their office or former office in the corporation or other entity, public or private, is not to exceed five years. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I0089HD"</field>N-PCL &s;§703(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00B2M9"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§55<trace>0</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 1. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVR5"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(a). Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice whether before or after the meeting or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GOW1"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00JI0X"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00MB5T"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>595 to 607</trace>
ARTICLE IV, 
Section 2. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05V3SO"</field>N-PCL &s;§707. See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I05QW3C"</field>Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep't 2014), stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05MOE0"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§605</trace>
ARTICLE V. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field><trace> The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace>To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVR7"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GOW3"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>592 to 594</trace>
ARTICLE VI. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005GI7"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers or some of them subject to approval by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0089N3"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00B2RZ"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
ARTICLE VII. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"</field>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DVWV"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00GP1R"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§127</trace>
30:103. Bylaws-- Nonprofit trade association

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id553d7601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>BYLAWS OF [NAME OF ORGANIZATION], ANEW YORK NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  NAME AND OFFICES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1 Name
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The name of this organization shall be [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2 Office
►<field>sel.tp="alt"</field>[EITHER:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Name of organization] may have its office in a location to be determined by the Board of Directors.[OR:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Name of organization] shall maintain an office located at [office address of organization], [name of city], New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The corporation may have such other offices as may be designated from time to time by [[names of members]/board of directors].<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  PURPOSE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The purpose of [name of organization] shall be to function as a trade association and:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>to promote the common business interests of its membership;
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>to promote public understanding of the business of [name of organization];
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>to foster congenial and collegial relationships among those involved in the business of [name of organization];
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>to serve as a clearinghouse of information to assist its membership in remaining abreast of new technology in the field of [name of organization];
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>to provide continuing training and education for those engaged in the business of [type of business]; and
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>to establish and enforce uniform standards for those engaged in the business of [type of business].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  MEMBERSHIP
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1 Eligibility for Membership
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>A person who is or have been engaged in the business of [type of business] for a minimum of [number of consecutive years] consecutive years may, upon approval of his or her application, become a member of [name of organization]. A rejected applicant shall not be eligible for membership until the passage of [specification of time period] after the date of any previous application.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Forms for application to become a member of [name of organization] shall be designed by the Board of Directors or by individuals appointed by the Board to design such forms. Application forms may be amended, from time to time, subject to the approval of the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Forms for application to become a member of [name of organization] shall be furnished in a timely manner to individuals requesting such forms.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In order to be considered for membership, an applicant must submit at least [number of letters] letters of recommendation written by present or past members of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>A nonrefundable application fee of not less than $[dollar amount of nonrefundable application fee] shall be required of membership applications at the time an application for membership is submitted. The amount of this nonrefundable application fee may be amended from time to time by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>No applicant for membership shall be discriminated against because of race, sex, color, religion, ethnic or cultural background, sexual orientation, or previous membership in a lawful [club/association].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>G. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Decisions to approve or to reject membership applications shall be made in a timely manner by individuals appointed by the Board of Directors to make such determinations.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>H. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>All deliberations and determinations made in regard to membership applications shall be confidential and may not be disclosed without written consent of the applicant in question.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2 Categories of Membership
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>There shall be seven categories of membership in [name of organization]: introductory membership, full membership, sustaining membership, organizational membership, honorary membership, life membership, and emeritus membership.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Introductory membership is open to individuals who have not been a member of [name of organization] during the preceding [number of years] years. An individual may be an introductory member for [number of years] years after which time that an individual is eligible to become a full member, sustaining member, honorary member, or life member.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The annual fee for individual membership shall be $[dollar amount of annual fee].[EITHER:][OR:]
The [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to set fee]] has the power to set the annual fee for individual membership.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>An introductory member shall have the same rights and privileges as a full member except that [specification of reduced rights and privileges].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Full membership is available to all members of [name of organization].
 ►<trace>[EITHER:] </trace><field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The annual fee for individual membership shall be $[dollar amount of annual fee].<trace> </trace>[OR:]
The [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to set fee]] has the power to set the annual fee for individual membership.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>A full member has the right to vote in annual and special meetings and to vote on special questions presented for determination to the full membership of [name of organization]. In addition, a full member is eligible for election or appointment to the Board of Directors and to any office or other position in [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Sustaining membership is available to all members of [name of organization].
 ►<trace>[EITHER:] </trace><field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The annual fee for sustaining membership shall be $[dollar amount of annual fee].<trace> </trace>[OR:]
The [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to set fee]] has the power to set the annual fee for sustaining membership.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In addition to the rights and privileges granted full members, [a sustaining member has the following additional rights and privileges: [list of additional rights and privileges]/the [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to specify rights and privileges]] has the power to specify additional rights and privileges for sustaining members]
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Organizational membership is available to any organization which qualifies for membership and which is interested in promoting the objectives of [name of organization].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The annual fee for <trace.deleted/><trace>organizational</trace> membership shall be $[dollar amount of annual fee].[EITHER:][OR:]
The [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to set fee]] has the power to set the annual fee for individual membership.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The rights and privileges granted organizational members [shall be [list of rights and privileges]/will be as the [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to specify rights and privileges]] specify].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Honorary membership may be conferred by [name of organization] on any individual who has distinguished himself or herself by endeavors relevant to the goals and objectives of [name of organization]. An honorary member shall be selected by [specification of method of nominating and selecting honorary members]. There shall be no annual or other fee for honorary membership. The rights and privileges granted honorary members [shall be [list of rights and privileges]/will be as the [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to specify rights and privileges]] specify].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>G. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Life membership is available to all members of [name of organization].
 ►<trace>[EITHER:]</trace><field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The one-time fee for life membership shall be $[dollar amount of life membership fee].<trace> </trace>[OR:]
The [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to set fee]] has the power to set the fee for life membership.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The rights and privileges granted life members shall be the same as those granted to full members.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>H. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Emeritus membership is available to all individuals who have been a member of [name of organization] for at least [number of consecutive years] consecutive years and who have either reached the age of [number of years old] or experienced an illness or disability that renders them incapable of engaging in full-time work as in the business of [type of business].
 ►<trace>[EITHER:]</trace><field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The annual fee for emeritus membership shall be $[dollar amount of annual fee].<trace> </trace>[OR:]
The [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to set fee]] has the power to set the fee for life membership.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The rights and privileges granted emeritus members [shall be [list of rights and privileges]/will be as the [board of directors/membership at large/[specification of corporate entity empowered to specify rights and privileges]] specify].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>I. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Categories of membership may be discontinued or new categories of membership may be created by [the Board of Directors/the membership at large].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3 Default in Payment of Membership Fees
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Any person or organization whose membership fees remain unpaid [specification of time period] after those fees become payable shall cease to be a member of [name of organization] and shall have none of the rights and privileges accorded a member, provided that the member in default has been give written notice of the default on at least [number of occasions] occasions. If default in payment of membership fees is due to illness or disability, the Board of Directors may, in its sole discretion, waive payment of those fees for a period not to exceed [specification of time period].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4 Termination of Membership
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Membership in [name of organization] shall terminate upon: (i) cancellation of membership by the member himself or herself; (ii) death of the member; (iii) default in the payment of membership fees as provided in Section 3, above, of this Article; or (iv) expulsion of the member by the Board of Directors for a reason other than default in the payment of membership fees.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Board of Directors may, by majority vote, expel a member for good cause which shall include, but not be limited to, ethical or criminal violations or conduct bringing [name of organization] into disrepute.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>No refund of membership fees paid shall be made in the event of the termination of an individual's membership.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1 Authorized Officers
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Name of organization] shall have the following officers: [titles of officers].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2 Terms of Office
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The President and the Vice President shall each serve a [number of years]-year term of office, beginning on [begin date of term] and expiring on [end date of term].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Treasurer and the Secretary shall each serve a [number of years] year term of office, beginning on [begin date of term] and expiring on [end date of term].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3 Vacancies
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>If the President is unable to complete his or her term for any reason, the Vice President shall serve the remainder of the term as President.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>If the incumbent Vice President, Treasurer, or Secretary is unable to complete his or her term for any reason, a replacement shall be appointed by [name of entity] to serve the remainder of that term of office.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4 Term Limits
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>A past President may not at the end of his or her term as President again be nominated for or serve as President or Vice President until [specification of time period] has passed.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>A Treasurer or Secretary may not be nominated for or serve more than [number of consecutive terms] consecutive terms in that office. Time in office as a Treasurer or Secretary pursuant to an appointment to serve a partial term to replace a former incumbent who resigned, was removed, became incapacitated, failed to remain a member in good standing, or died shall not be considered as a term of office unless that appointee served in that office for at least [specification of time period].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5 Qualifications for Office
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>To be eligible for nomination and election as President or Vice President, an individual must have been a member in good standing of [name of organization] for at least [number of consecutive years] consecutive years and must have served in some other elective or appointive office in [name of organization] or one of its state chapters.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>To be eligible for nomination and election as Treasurer, an individual must have been a member in good standing of [name of organization] for at least [number of years] years and must have demonstrated experience in financial planning.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>To be eligible for nomination and election as Secretary, an individual must have been a member in good standing of [name of organization] for at least [number of years] years.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6 Procedures for the Nomination and<trace> </trace>Election of Officers
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Written suggestions of proposed nominees may be made by any member in good standing of [name of organization] for consideration by a nominating committee appointed by the President.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The nominating committee shall submit to the Secretary a slate of eligible nominees for each office for which election must be held in that year. In submitting this slate, the nominating committee shall consider written suggestions of proposed nominees made by any member in good standing of [name of organization] but need not place any suggested name on the slate of nominees submitted.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Individuals desiring to serve as an officer of [name of organization] may, if not approved by the nominating committee, run for office as a &ldquo;“write-in&rdquo;” candidate by presenting to the Secretary [number of days] days before the scheduled election a petition signed by [number of members] members in good standing of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Upon receipt of a slate of candidates from the nominating committee and receipt of any petition for &ldquo;“write-in&rdquo;” candidacy, the Secretary shall verify that each candidate consents to serve as an officer and shall verify that each candidate has, in fact, been a member in good standing of [name of organization] for at least [number of consecutive years] consecutive years.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The election of officers shall take place on [date of election] each year. Special elections may be held at such times as necessary as determined by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Election may be by written paper ballot or, if approved by the Board of Directors, by utilization of telephonic, internet, or e-mail technology. If paper ballots are employed, the Secretary shall supervise their preparation and mailing and shall take such steps as are necessary that ballots and explanations as to how they are to be marked are delivered to eligible voters at least [number of days] days before the scheduled date of the election. If the election is conducted by means of telephonic, internet, or e-mail technology, the Secretary shall supervise the implementation of that technology and that its availability and the means of its utilization is explained to eligible voters at least [number of days] days before the scheduled date of the election.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>G. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Ballots shall be completed and returned to the Secretary by [date of completion] in order to be valid and counted. Eligible voters may mark the ballots to indicate one choice for each office, and any ballot marked so as to indicate more than one choice for a particular office shall be invalid and the vote for that office shall not be counted. A ballot shall be valid and shall be counted even if the voter did not vote for a nominee for all offices. A dispute as to the validity of any particular ballot shall be determined by [specification of manner of determining validity of ballot].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>H. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The counting of ballots, whether the voting be conducted by paper ballot or by telephonic, internet, or e-mail technology, shall be performed by three Election Judges appointed by the Secretary. No candidate for office may serve as an Election Judge. The counting of ballots shall commence within [number of days] days after the date of the election and a written record of the vote tally shall be prepared. This tally and the ballots themselves shall remain available for inspection by any member in good standing of [name of organization] for a period of not less than [number of days] days.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>I. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The nominee receiving a plurality of the votes for each office shall be declared elected to that office. In the case of tie votes for any office, the winner shall be decided by lot.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>J. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The election results shall be promptly published on [name of organization]'s website and shall also be published in the next issue of [name of organization]'s newsletter. Each candidate shall be informed in writing of the election results as soon as practicable and in no event later than [number of days] days after the date of the election.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 7 Powers and Duties of Officers
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The President shall serve as the chief executive of [name of organization] and shall have the powers and perform the duties assigned to that role, exercising a general supervision over all the affairs of [name of organization]. The President shall also:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="5"</field>(i). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>preside over all meetings of the Board of Directors and of the membership;
►<field>fi.lvl="5"</field>(ii). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>appoint committees as needed to carry out the business of [name of organization];
►<field>fi.lvl="5"</field>(iii). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>oversee and coordinate the activities of other officers;
►<field>fi.lvl="5"</field>(iv). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>negotiate contracts in behalf of [name of organization];
►<field>fi.lvl="5"</field>(v). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>communicate to the membership all dealings and concerns of [name of organization]; and
►<field>fi.lvl="5"</field>(vi). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>work in conjunction with the officers, directors, committee members, and the membership at large to advance and attain the goals of [name of organization] so as to better serve the community at large and the membership of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Vice President shall serve as acting President, with all the powers and duties of that office, in the event the President is unable to serve. The Vice President shall, in the absence of the President, preside over all meeting of the Board of Directors and of the membership and shall also exercise all powers and perform all duties necessary to assist the other officers in the successful performance of their duties.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Treasurer shall take charge of all funds and assets of [name of organization] and keep its books and accounts. The Treasurer shall develop a budget for [name of organization], subject to approval of the Board of Directors. The Treasurer shall each month present to the Board of Directors a financial statement showing the financial activities and status of [name of organization]. In addition, the treasurer shall assure that all required tax filings are made in a timely manner and shall annually obtain an audit of [name of organization]'s financial statements by a certified public accountant or auditor.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Secretary shall keep accurate minutes of the proceedings of [name of organization] and its Board of Directors. In addition, the Secretary shall keep custody of the records of [name of organization] and its Board of Directors, including records of membership, and perform specified duties in regard to elections of officers and directors for [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>All officers shall be responsible for transmitting to their successors all pertinent records, files, and correspondence within [number of days] days after the successor takes office.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 8 Compensation and Reimbursement of Officers
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Officers shall be entitled to compensation and/or reimbursement of expenses if and to the extent the Board of Directors so authorizes. No compensation or reimbursement shall be allowed retroactively.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 9 Insurance
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Name of organization] shall obtain and maintain in force appropriate insurance against errors and omissions by any officer.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  DIRECTORS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1 Authority of Board
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Board of Directors shall be the governing body of [name of organization] and be responsible for managing its affairs. Pursuant to ARTICLE III, Section 4 of these Bylaws, the Board of Directors is empowered to expel a member for good cause.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2 Composition of Board
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Board of Directors shall be comprised of the officers named in ARTICLE IV, Section 1 and [number of directors] Directors elected by the members of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3 Terms of Office
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The term of office of a Director shall be [number of years] years beginning on [begin date of term] and expiring on [end date of term]. The Directors serve staggered terms so that each year the terms of [number of directors] Directors expire and [number of new directors] new Directors are elected in their place.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4 Vacancies
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In the event a Director resigns, is removed, becomes incapacitated, fails to remain a member in good standing, or dies with more than [specification of time period] remaining in his or her term, a special election shall be held to select a replacement. If less than [specification of time period] is remaining in a Director's term when [he/she] resigns, is removed, becomes incapacitated, fails to remain a member in good standing, or dies with more than [specification of time period], no replacement shall be selected until the next regularly scheduled election.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5 Term Limits
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>A Director shall not serve more than [number of consecutive terms] consecutive terms.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Time served as a Director pursuant to election to serve a partial term to replace a former incumbent who resigned, was removed, became incapacitated, failed to remain a member in good standing, or died shall not be considered as a term of office unless that appointee served in that office for at least [specification of time period].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6 Qualifications for Office
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>To be eligible for nomination and election as a Director, an individual must have been a member in good standing of [name of organization] for at least [number of consecutive years] consecutive years.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 7 Procedures for the Nomination <trace.deleted/><trace>and Election</trace> of Directors
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Written suggestions of proposed nominees may be made by any member in good standing of [name of organization] for consideration by a nominating committee appointed by the President.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The nominating committee shall submit to the Secretary a slate of eligible nominees to seek the office of Director at the election to be held in that year. In submitting this slate, the nominating committee shall consider written suggestions of proposed nominees made by any member in good standing of [name of organization] but need not place any suggested name on the slate of nominees submitted.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Individuals desiring to serve as a Director of [name of organization] may, if not approved by the nominating committee, seek the office of Director as a &ldquo;“write-in&rdquo;” candidate by presenting to the Secretary [number of days] days before the scheduled election a petition signed by [number of members] members in good standing of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Upon receipt of a slate of candidates from the nominating committee and receipt of any petition for &ldquo;“write-in&rdquo;” candidacy, the Secretary shall verify that each candidate consents to serve as a Director and shall verify that each candidate has, in fact, been a member in good standing of [name of organization] for at least [number of consecutive years] consecutive years.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The election of Director shall take place on [date of election] each year. Special elections may be held at such times as necessary as determined by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Election may be by written paper ballot or, if approved by the Board of Directors, by utilization of telephonic, internet, or e-mail technology. If paper ballots are employed, the Secretary shall supervise their preparation and mailing and shall take such steps as are necessary that ballots and explanations as to how they are to be marked are delivered to eligible voters at least [number of days] days before the scheduled date of the election. If the election is conducted by means of telephonic, internet, or e-mail technology, the Secretary shall supervise the implementation of that technology and that its availability and the means of its utilization is explained to eligible voters at least [number of days] days before the scheduled date of the election.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>G. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Ballots shall be completed and returned to the Secretary by [due date of return] in order to be valid and counted. Eligible voters may mark the ballots so as to vote for a number of nominees which is equal to or less than the total number of Directors to be selected at that election. Any ballot marked so as to vote for a number of nominees larger than the total number of Directors to be elected at that election shall be invalid in its entirety. A dispute as to the validity of any particular ballot shall be determined by [specification of manner of determining validity of ballot].
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>H. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The counting of ballots, whether the voting be conducted by paper ballot or by telephonic, internet, or e-mail technology, shall be performed by three Election Judges appointed by the Secretary. No candidate for the office of Director may serve as an Election Judge. The counting of ballots shall commence within [number of days] days after the date of the election and a written record of the vote tally shall be prepared. This tally and the ballots themselves shall remain available for inspection by any member in good standing of [name of organization] for a period of not less than [number of days] days.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>I. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The [number of nominees] nominees receiving the highest number of votes shall be declared elected to serve as Directors. In the case of a tie vote, the winner shall be decided by lot.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>J. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The election results shall be promptly published on [name of organization]'s website and shall also be published in the next issue of [name of organization]'s newsletter. Each candidate shall be informed in writing of the election results as soon as practicable and in no event later than [number of days] days after the date of the election.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 8 Compensation and <trace.deleted/><trace>Reimbursement of</trace> Officers
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Directors shall be entitled to compensation and/or reimbursement of expenses if and to the extent the Board of Directors so authorizes. No compensation or reimbursement shall be allowed retroactively.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 9 Meetings
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The Board of Directors shall meet at least [number of times] times a year. These meetings shall take place on [dates of meetings]. Special meetings may be convened at the order of the President.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Written notice of the date and location of all meetings, including special meetings, shall be delivered in person, by mail, or by e-mail not less than [number of days] days and not more than [number of days] days before the meeting date. If all Directors meet by mutual consent at any time or place, within or outside the State of New York, such meeting shall be valid even though proper notice was not given thereof, and any action taken at such a meeting shall not be invalidated for lack of notice.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Meetings of the Board of Directors may be conducted either in person or by teleconference provided that at least one meeting must be conducted in person each year. The location of meetings conducted in person shall be specified by the President except that no meeting shall take place outside New York State without consent of the majority of the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>All meetings of the Board of Directors shall be conducted in accordance with, and all issues of parliamentary procedure shall be decided by, [[name of rules]/[name of code]] in all instances in which those rules are applicable and in which they are not inconsistent with these Bylaws or with any special rules of order adopted by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In addition to addressing the general business of [name of organization], the Board of Directors shall consider both unfinished and new business, as appropriate, and review and discuss minutes of prior proceedings and reports of officers and committees.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Text number of directors] Directors shall constitute a quorum at meetings.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>G. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In the event of a tie vote at a regular or special meeting, the vote of the President shall prevail.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>H. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>No Director shall be entitled to vote by proxy.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>I. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Any Director who shall be absent from [number of consecutive meetings] consecutive meetings shall be deemed to have resigned from office and shall cease to be a Director unless a majority vote of the other Directors elects that such a resignation not be deemed to have taken place.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 10 Insurance
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Name of organization] shall obtain and maintain in force appropriate insurance against errors and omissions by any Director.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VI  COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>There shall be the following committees: the Nominations Committee, the Finance Committee, and the Membership Committee. Chairs of these committees shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the President. The committee chair shall be empowered to appoint committee members, subject to the overruling of such action by the President.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>The President may establish or dissolve additional committees to address particular issues and may appoint an individual Director to serve as Board liaison with each such committee, subject to overruling of such actions by majority vote of a quorum of the Board of Directors. The President shall be empowered to appoint or replace the chair of a committee. The committee chair shall be empowered to appoint committee members, subject to the overruling of such action by the President.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  STATE CHAPTERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>State chapters of [name of organization] may be established under procedures to be established by the Board of Directors. These procedures shall be subject to modification or repeal by the Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>State chapters shall be subject to these Bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>State chapters shall adopt Chapter Bylaws subject to approval thereof by the Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In the event of dissolution of a state chapter, all its assets shall become the property of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VIII  AMENDMENT OF BYLAWS
►<field>sel.tp="alt"</field>[EITHER:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>These Bylaws may be amended by vote of the majority of the Board of Directors at a duly convened meeting.[OR:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>These Bylaws may be amended by two-thirds vote of the corporation membership at a special election called for that purpose.<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IX  DISSOLUTION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>[Name of organization] may be dissolved in accordance with the laws of the State of New York. Upon dissolution, all corporate assets shall be distributed as follows: [description of method of distribution].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>Bylaws for charitable corporations may place the greater portion of operational control in the board of directors, the officers, or the membership itself. Likewise, the bylaws may be specific and detailed or may be broad so as to leave refinement of details to be determined by the entity in which operational control is vested. Which path to follow in regard to operational control and the extent of detail is a philosophical and business decision. Bylaws that vest greater operational control in the board or officers and which do not impose detailed requirements may permit a speedier and more flexible response to changes; arguably, such bylaws may also permit a small group to violate the desires of the membership at large. It would appear that there is always a trade-off.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|111|30:103"</field>In general, the form shown above places the bulk of operation control in the Board of Directors but also sets forth how the corporation shall be run in considerable detail.
