 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5544c901b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>LOCAL CHAPTER BYLAWS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE I  NAME
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The name of this Chapter shall be [name of chapter].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE II  CHAPTER BYLAWS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>These bylaws shall be submitted to the national Board of Directors of the [name of national nonprofit corporation] for approval before being submitted to the chapter membership for ratification. These bylaws shall become effective upon acceptance by a simple majority of Chapter membership.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE III  OBJECTIVES
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The objectives of this Chapter shall support the objectives of the [name of national nonprofit corporation] and shall include:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Promoting the common business interests of the local and national membership;
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Promoting public understanding of the business of [type of business];
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Fostering congenial and collegial relationships among those involved in the business of [type of business];
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Serving as a clearinghouse of information to assist its membership in remaining abreast of new technology in the field of [specification of field];
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Providing continuing training and education for those engaged in the business of [type of business]; and
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Establishing and enforcing uniform standards for those engaged in the business of [type of business].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IV  POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The policies and procedures of [name of national nonprofit corporation], as applicable, shall in every case also be the policies and procedures of this Chapter.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE V  MEMBERSHIP
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Membership in the Chapter shall be held automatically by those members of [name of national nonprofit corporation] who reside within the geographic area covered by this local Chapter, as determined by the Board of Directors of [name of national nonprofit corporation] and defined by zip code of home addresses.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VI  CHAPTER REQUIREMENTS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>To remain in good standing as an affiliate of [name of national nonprofit corporation], this Chapter:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Shall maintain a membership of at least [number of active members] active members;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Shall not be an integral part of any other organization; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Shall ensure that Chapter Bylaws are current and not in conflict with the Bylaws and policies of [name of national nonprofit corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Should membership fall below [number of active members] active members, this Chapter shall be dropped from [name of national nonprofit corporation] at the end of its fiscal year.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VII  FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Chapter's fiscal year shall correspond to the fiscal year.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>An independent auditor or an auditing committee of [number of members] members shall be appointed by the Chair to make an audit of the Chapter Treasurer's records within two weeks after the end of the Treasurer's term of office. An audit report shall be presented to the Chapter the next meeting of its members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE VIII  OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The officers of the Chapter shall be a Chair, Vice-Chair, Secretary, and Treasurer. These officers form the Chapter's Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The term of office for each office shall be one year.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Officers shall assume their duties immediately following the Chapter meeting held on or about [name of month].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE IX  NOMINATIONS AND ELECTIONS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Officers shall be elected at the Chapter's spring meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Only members in good standing shall be eligible for office.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Nominations may be made within 30 days before the Chapter meeting held on or about [date of meeting] and at the time of that meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Vacancies in office shall be treated as follows:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>In the event of death, resignation, or incapacity of the Chair, the Vice Chair shall become the Chair for the unexpired term.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Vacancies in offices other than Chair shall be filled by appointment for the unexpired term by the Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>No member shall hold the same office for more than two consecutive terms.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Six months or more shall be considered a term of office for purposes of determining eligibility for reelection.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE X  DUTIES OF OFFICERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Chair shall be the principal officer of the Chapter and perform the following duties:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Presiding at all meetings of the Chapter and the Executive Committee;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Appointing committee chairs with the approval of the Executive Committee;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Serving as ex-officio member of all committees except the nominating committee;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Bringing to the attention of the Chapter all pertinent information from [name of national nonprofit corporation];
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Approving all disbursements of Chapter funds; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Being responsible for sending to the [name of national nonprofit corporation] Membership Chair the names and addresses of all Chapter officers immediately following the election or appointment of those officers and immediately reporting to [name of national nonprofit corporation] any changes affecting Chapter officers.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Vice Chair shall perform the following duties:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Presiding, in the absence of the Chair, at all meetings of the Chapter and the Executive Committee;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Becoming Chair for the unexpired term in the case of death, resignation, or incapacity of the Chair; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Serving in such other capacities as assigned by the Chair.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Secretary shall perform the following duties:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Recording accurate minutes of the proceedings of all meetings of the Chapter and the Executive Committee;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Preserving in a permanent file all records and letters of value to the Chapter and its officers; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Maintaining an updated list of Chapter members' mailing and e-mail addresses.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Treasurer shall perform the following duties:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Having charge of all Chapter funds and reporting on the status thereof at all Chapter meetings;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Receiving disbursements from the [name of national nonprofit corporation] Treasurer for activities at the chapter level;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Paying all financial obligations of the Chapter upon authorization of the Chair; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Maintaining, in a permanent file, records of all Chapter receipts and expenditures.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Each Chapter officer shall deliver, within [specification of time period] of the election of a successor, all accounts and records and other property belonging to the Chapter to the successor officer.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XI  MEETINGS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Regular meetings shall be held at least [number of times a year] times a year unless otherwise ordered by the Chapter membership or the Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>At the meeting held on or about [date of meeting] each year, reports summarizing the year's activities shall be presented and new officers shall be elected. Officers shall be elected by a majority of the total number of Chapter members in good standing who are present at this meeting or who are not present at the meeting but have submitted a vote by United States Postal Service mail or by e-mail in the month prior to that meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Special meetings may be called by the Chair or by any [number of members] members, provided all members are notified, by a writing deposited with the United States Postal Service or sent by e-mail, of the time, place, and purpose of such meeting at least [number of days] days before the meeting is convened.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XII  EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The elected officers and one member-at-large plus any committee chairs shall constitute the Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Executive Committee shall perform the following duties:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Supervising the affairs of the Chapter;
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Making recommendations for the Chapter's growth and professionalism; and
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Reporting on any meetings of the Committee to the Chapter.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Meeting and Quorum:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The Executive Committee shall meet if called by the Chair or by any [number of members] members of the Chapter Board of Directors.
►<field>fi.lvl="4"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>A majority of the Executive Committee members shall constitute a quorum.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XIII  COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Committees of the Chapter, in addition to the Executive Committee, shall be formed as needed by the Chair acting with approval of the Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Only members in good standing shall be eligible to serve as committee chairs.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Committee chairs and members shall be appointed for a term of [specification of time period] and may be reappointed. No committee chair shall serve more than [specification of time period].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Committee appointments made by the Chair shall be subject to the approval of the Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>A majority of the elected officers shall constitute a quorum for a meeting of the Executive Board.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XIV  SPECIFIC COMMITTEES
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>In addition to the Executive Committee, the committees of the Chapter shall be the Membership Committee, the Planning and Program Committee, and the Outreach and Publicity Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Only a member in good standing shall be eligible to serve as a chair of a committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Committee chairs and members shall be appointed for a term of [specification of time period] and may be reappointed. No committee chair shall serve more than [specification of time period].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XV  PARLIAMENTARY PROCEDURE
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>[Robert's Rules of Order/The Standard Code of Parliamentary Procedure/[specification of other rules or code]] shall govern all proceedings of the Chapter and the Executive Committee, subject to such special rules as have been or may be adopted.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XVI  AMENDMENTS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Amendments to these Bylaws may be proposed by any member or officer or by the Executive Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 2.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>All proposed amendments shall be sent by a writing deposited with the United States Postal Service or sent by e-mail to every Chapter member.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 3.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>All proposed amendments shall be presented to the Executive Committee prior to presentation to the Chapter members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 4.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>These Bylaws may be amended by two-thirds vote of the total number of Chapter members in good standing who are present at the meeting held on or about [date of meeting] or who are not present at the meeting but have submitted a vote by United States Postal Service mail or by e-mail in the month prior to that meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 5.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>The final adoption by the Chapter of amendments to or revisions of these Bylaws shall be contingent upon the approval of [name of organization].
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 6.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Any amendments to the Bylaws of [name of organization] that affect Chapter Bylaws shall be automatically incorporated into the Chapter Bylaws.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>ARTICLE XVII  DISSOLUTION
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|112|30:104"</field>Upon dissolution of this Chapter, all its assets remaining after payment of all costs and expenses of such dissolution shall be distributed to [name of organization], and none of the assets will be distributed to any member or officer of this Chapter.

Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I005GWM"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384

<trace>30:104. 50. Bylaws —College alumni association</trace>

<trace>BYLAWS OF</trace>
<trace><finstr>[NAME OF CLUB]</finstr></trace>

<trace>Effective <finstr>[effective date of bylaws]</finstr></trace>

<trace>ARTICLE I: Name and Office</trace>

<trace>Name. The name of the corporation is <finstr>[name of club]</finstr> (hereafter the “Club”). </trace>

<trace>Office. T he principal office of the Club shall be in the County of <finstr>[name of county]</finstr>, State of New York. The Club may also have offices at such other places as the Board of Directors may from time to time direct, or the purposes of the Club may require.</trace>

<trace>Purpose. The purpose of this organization shall be to further the interests and promote, in all respects, the welfare and expand the influence of <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> (“<finstr>[name of college]</finstr>” or “the College”), and, in furtherance of its charitable and educational purpose to conduct or participate in annual or capital fund drives for the College; sponsor or participate directly or indirectly in educational activities relating to the College including programs to inform Members of recent developments at the College, seminars and similar programs; assist the Admissions Office of the College and recruit students; establish and maintain scholarships; promote alumni relations with the College; and foster friendships and sociability of persons who are currently or have been connected with the College.</trace>

<trace>The mission of the Club is to connect <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> alumni to the College and each other, and as part of the <finstr>[location of community]</finstr> community, while enhancing the lives of <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> alumni through lifelong partnership in commitment to <finstr>[name of college]</finstr>’s founding principle of “<finstr>[statement of founding principle]</finstr> ”. The Club will seek to prosper the College’s alumni engagement strategies, imperatives and focus.</trace>

<trace>Geographic Scope. The Club shall include individuals who live in <finstr>[location of community]</finstr>, State of New York, and who meet the membership eligibility requirements below. The Club’s geographic scope may be changed, as agreed to by <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> and the Club’s Board.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE II: Membership</trace>

<trace>Eligibility. The following individuals shall be eligible to be Members of the Club:</trace>

<trace>Any individual who has ever been a registered student in any department or course of the College and any individual who has ever been connected in any official capacity with the instructional or administrative staff, or governing board of the College.</trace>

<trace>The spouse or significant other, widow, widower, or immediate adult family member of any person who is a Member under Subsection (a) above.</trace>

<trace>Any person interested in the College who is sponsored by a Member who is qualified under Subsection (a) above.</trace>

<trace>Honorary Members as appointed by the Board of Directors (“Board”).</trace>

<trace>During periods when the Club is operating without Annual or other dues, all <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> alumni (based on information provided by <finstr>[name of college]</finstr>) eligible under Article II, Section 1(a) above shall automatically be Members of the Club, unless that individual opts out of membership. If there are periods when the Board has determined that Annual or other dues are necessary, persons eligible under Article II, Section 1(a), (b), (c) and (d) above shall become a regular voting Member in good standing upon their signing a membership application provided by the Membership Committee Chair and upon paying the first year’s dues. A Member shall remain in good standing for as long as their dues, if any (as determined by the Board), are paid in full.</trace>

<trace>Honorary Members. Honorary Members shall be exempt from the payment of dues or other fees. They shall be entitled to all the privileges of regular Members, except the right to vote, hold office or to any interest in the property of the Club.</trace>

<trace>Dues. The Club operates without Annual or other dues, enabled by <finstr>[name of college]</finstr>’s support of its activities. By resolution, the Board may determine to begin Annual or other dues if necessary to continue the Club’s activities. Annual dues or other fees may be set by the Board for regular Members. If a Member’s dues are not paid within <finstr>[text number of days]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of days]</finstr>) calendar days after the date they are due, then that Member shall automatically cease to be a regular Member. The amount of the annual dues may be changed by a two-thirds vote of the Board.</trace>

<trace>Resignation. Any Member may withdraw from the Club by giving written notice of such intention to the Membership Committee Chair or Secretary.</trace>

<trace>5. Eligibility for Offices. Only <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> alumni shall be eligible for election to or appointment as Officers, the Board, and the Nominating Committee. </trace>


<trace>ARTICLE III: Board of Directors</trace>

<trace>General Powers. The Board shall control and manage the affairs of the Club so as to carry out its objectives. </trace>

<trace>Membership and Qualification. The Board shall consist of elected Officers of the Club, the immediate past President, the Chair of the Standing Committees authorized by the Board, and generally not less than <finstr>[minimum number of members]</finstr> nor more than <finstr>[maximum number of members]</finstr> At-Large Directors.</trace>

<trace>Each Director shall be at least <finstr>[minimum number of years]</finstr> years of age and must be a Member in good standing and a <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> alumnus. Changes in the number of Directors shall require approval of a majority of the Board.  </trace>

<trace>Classes and Terms. The elected Officers and immediate past President shall serve as Directors only for so long as they hold their respective offices. The At-Large Directors shall be divided into two classes of equal or as close as possible to equal number, and shall each serve for a term of <finstr>[text number of years]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of years]</finstr>) years or until their successor is elected. Any Director shall be eligible for re-election for up to a total of <finstr>[text number of years]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of years]</finstr>) consecutive terms in the same position.  </trace>

<trace>Vacancies. Any vacancies occurring in the Board and any position to be filled by reason of an increase in the number of directors shall be filled by a vote of the majority of the Board then in office. A Director elected to fill a vacancy caused by a resignation, death or removal shall be elected to hold office for the unexpired term of his or her predecessor.</trace>

<trace>Removal. A Director may be removed for cause by action of a 2/3 majority of the members of the Board. Any Director who is absent from <finstr>[number of meetings]</finstr> consecutive Board meetings, without a valid excuse to the Board, shall be automatically deemed to have resigned and shall be notified by the Secretary.</trace>

<trace>6. Resignation. Any Director may resign at any time by giving written notice to the President or Secretary of the Club. Such resignation shall take effect at the time specified therein, or, if no time is specified therein, then upon receipt thereof.</trace>

<trace>7.  Compensation. Officers and Directors shall not receive any payment for their services. However, reasonable expenses incurred in the performance of Club duties can be reimbursed up to the full cost of such. Reimbursements for the cost of travel for Alumni Affairs initiated meetings are subject to the prior approval of the Board.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE IV: Officers</trace>

<trace>Officers. The elected offices of the Club shall consist of a President, one Vice President, a Secretary, and a Treasurer. No person shall hold more than one elected office at the same time. </trace>

<trace>Eligibility. Any Member in good standing who is also an alumnus of <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> may serve as an Officer of the Club. </trace>

<trace>Term of Office. Officers shall assume their official duties immediately following their election, and shall serve for a term of <finstr>[number of years]</finstr> years or until re-election or election of their successors.</trace>

<trace>Removal. Any Officer may be removed by action of a two-thirds majority of the Board whenever in its judgment the best interest of the Club would be served thereby.</trace>

<trace>Vacancies. A vacancy in any office because of death, resignation, removal, disqualification or otherwise may be filled by the Board for the unexpired term.</trace>

<trace>Duties of Officers.</trace>

<trace>(a)  President. The President shall have the usual duties and powers pertaining to that office. The President is responsible for overall programs, developing a Club sense of purpose, fostering new initiatives, and representing the club to the community; shall preside at all meetings of the Club, shall chair all meetings of the Board and shall be an ex-officio member of every committee; shall encourage a good representation from the club at <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> programs; shall communicate regularly with the <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> Alumni Office contacts; shall delegate responsibility and hold Officers and Committee Chairs responsible; and shall groom a successor.  </trace>

<trace>Vice President.  The Vice President shall perform the duties and exercise the power of the President during his or her absence, or at his or her request. If the office of the President becomes vacant, he or she shall become President for the unexpired term. In addition, he or she shall be primarily responsible for program coordination for the Club and shall act as Chair of the Program Committee. The Vice President will exercise the power of the President during his or her absence, or at his or her request, and shall become President for the unexpired term if the office of the President becomes vacant.</trace>

<trace>Secretary. The Secretary shall keep Minutes of all meetings of the Members and the Board; shall assure that a current list of all active Members of the Club is available for the Club; will be responsible for giving the members notice of all member Annual or special meetings; shall preserve copies of publications, correspondence, notices, documents and other club records; and for any correspondence as directed by the President or specified herein.</trace>

<trace>Treasurer. The Treasurer shall keep the funds of the Club in a separate bank account; shall collect all monies due or paid to the Club; shall make all disbursements, submit a written report of the financial condition of the Club at Board meetings and at the Annual Meeting and render any special financial report whenever requested by the President or Board; shall keep all scholarship, loan and other funds separate and distinct from each other and from the operating funds of the Club, and report the values and status of each such fund at least quarterly to the Board and at the Annual meeting; must file any applicable reports to the U.S. Internal Revenue Service and other federal and New York State entities.</trace>

<trace>Immediate Past President. The Immediate Past President shall be permitted to hold that position for the duration of the incoming, successor President.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE V: Meetings</trace>

<trace>Annual Meeting of the Members. There shall be an Annual Meeting of Members of the Club to be held at such time and place as the Directors may determine. Notice of the time and place of each Annual Meeting of Members shall be given in writing and sent to each active Member in good standing at the Member’s last known email or postal address at least <finstr>[text number of minimum days]</finstr> (<finstr>[minimum number of days]</finstr>) calendar days and no more than <finstr>[text number of maximum days]</finstr> (<finstr>[maximum number of days]</finstr>) calendar days prior to the date of the meeting.</trace>

<trace>2.  Special Meeting of the Members. Special meetings of Members may be called by the President upon the written request of <finstr>[text number of members]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of members]</finstr>) active Members to such officer, or by a majority of the Board. Notice of the time and place of any special meeting shall be given in writing and sent to each active Member in good standing at the Member’s last known email or postal address at least <finstr>[text number of minimum days]</finstr> (<finstr>[minimum number of days]</finstr>) calendar days but not more than <finstr>[text number of maximum days]</finstr> (<finstr>[maximum number of days]</finstr>) calendar days prior to the date of the meeting.</trace>

<trace>3. Regular and Special Meetings of the Board. Regular meetings of the Board may be held without notice at such time and place as it shall from time to time determine. Special Meetings may be called by the President or upon written notice of at least <finstr>[text number of directors]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of directors]</finstr>) Directors. Notice of a special meeting shall be given in writing and sent by email or postal mail, or by telephone at least <finstr>[text number of days]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of days]</finstr>) calendar days prior to the meeting to all Directors by the President and Secretary. All meetings of the Board shall be open to Members, unless the Board otherwise elects. Board meetings may be held by conference telephone or similar communications equipment allowing all participants in the meeting to hear each other.</trace>

<trace>4.  Quorums. In years where the Club does not collect Annual or other dues, the quorum shall be set at <finstr>[text number of individuals]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of individuals]</finstr>) of the individuals identified by <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> as Members under Article II, Section 1(a). In any other years, the lesser of <finstr>[number of individuals]</finstr> Members or <finstr>[specification of fraction]</finstr> of all active Members in good standing shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business by the Members at any meeting thereof. A majority of the entire membership of the Board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business of the Board at any meeting thereof.</trace>

<trace>If authorized by the Board and arranged by the Club, any one or more Member or Director may participate in a meeting of the Members, or the Board, or any committee, by means of a conference telephone, video-conferencing or similar electronic means that allows all persons participating in the meeting to hear each other at the same time. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at such a meeting.</trace>

<trace>5.  Action without Meeting. Any action which may be taken at a meeting of the Members, the Board, or any Committee, may be taken without a meeting if all of the Members entitled to vote, or all Directors, or all Committee members consent in writing or by electronic means to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. The resolution and written or electronic consent thereto by the Members entitled to vote, or the Board, or the Committee shall be filed with the Minutes of the proceedings of the Members, Board or Committee.</trace>

<trace>6.  Proxies. Every Member entitled to vote at a meeting of Members or to express consent or dissent without a meeting may authorize another Member to act for him or her by written or electronic proxy. Every completed proxy must be returned to the Secretary. No proxy shall be valid for more than <finstr>[number of months]</finstr> months unless otherwise provided by the proxy, and may be revoked by the Member executing it.</trace>

<trace>Waiver of Notice. Notice of a meeting need not be given to any Member, or Director, or Committee member who submits a signed written or electronic waiver thereof whether before, during or after the meeting nor to any such member who attends the meetings without protesting, prior thereto or at its commencement, the lack of notice to him or her.</trace>

<trace>Annual Calendar. The President and Vice President(s) shall, prior to <finstr>[specification of date]</finstr> of each year, prepare a calendar of meetings and activities scheduled for the Club year. The calendar shall be circulated to the Members promptly. The calendar may be changed by the Board during the year.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE VI: Elections</trace>

<trace>Officers. The Officers shall be elected by the Members at the Annual Meeting or, at the discretion of the Board, by email, electronic, or postal mail ballot, and shall hold office until their successors shall be duly elected and qualified. </trace>

<trace>At-Large Directors. At each Annual Meeting, or at the discretion of the Board, by email, electronic, or postal mail ballot, At-Large Directors shall be elected by the Members for a term of <finstr>[number of years]</finstr> years to succeed the class whose term then expires.</trace>

<trace>Nominating Committee. The Nominating Committee shall consist of the <finstr>[titles of officers]</finstr> and at least one (1) other Member in good standing (who shall not be an Officer or Board member) who shall be appointed by the Chair, all of whom shall be <finstr>[name of college]</finstr> Alumni. The committee shall consist of an odd number of members. The duty of the Nominating Committee shall be to nominate a slate of Officers and Directors, to be voted upon at the Annual Meeting. The President shall appoint a Chair who has had at least <finstr>[text number of years]</finstr> ( <finstr>[number of years]</finstr> ) years of active involvement with the Club, and who is not otherwise a current Board member.</trace>

<trace>Other Nominations. Other nominations, in addition to those submitted by the Nominating Committee, must be filed with the President or the Secretary no later than <finstr>[date of filing]</finstr>  on written petition of <finstr>[text number of members]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of members]</finstr>) Members in good standing. No nominations will be received from the floor.</trace>

<trace>Voting and Election. Officers and Directors shall be elected by a majority</trace>
<trace>of the votes cast. The President may serve no more than <finstr>[number of</trace>
<trace>terms]</finstr> consecutive terms.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE VII: Committees</trace>

<trace>Committees of the Board. The Board may, in its discretion, by resolution adopted by a majority of the entire Board, designate from among its members an Executive Committee, and other standing or special committees, each of which shall consist of three or more Members in good standing. All committees exist at the discretion of the Board and shall be responsible to the Board. Each committee shall make a report of their activities to the Board, and shall observe such other procedures as are prescribed by the Board.</trace>

<trace>The Board may designate one or more Directors as alternative members of any such Committee, who may replace any absent member or members at any meeting of such Committee.</trace>

<trace>Any action required or permitted to be taken by a Committee of the Board may be taken without a meeting if all members of the Committee consent in writing to the adoption of a resolution authorizing such action. The resolution and the written consents shall be filed with the proceedings of the Committee.</trace>

<trace>All other Committees of the Board shall have those powers conferred upon them by the Board, except that no Committee shall have power: </trace>

<trace>to fill vacancies in the Board or in any Committee thereof; </trace>

<trace>to fix compensation of Directors for service on the Board or any Committee thereof; </trace>

<trace>to repeal, amend or adopt these By l aws;</trace>

<trace>to amend or repeal any Board resolution which does not, by its terms, make it amendable or repealable by such Committee; or </trace>

<trace>(e)to remove or fix the compensation of Officers who are elected or appointed by the Board.</trace>

<trace>2. Standing Committees. The following standing Committees shall be maintained:<finstr>[list of committees]</finstr>. Specific duties of each of the standing Committees shall be determined by the Board.</trace>

<trace>The President shall appoint the Chair of each Committee, who will, with the approval of the elected members of the Board, become voting members of the Board. Each committee Chair will, in coordination with the President, appoint and remove members of that Committee and any subcommittees or task forces.</trace>

<trace><finstr>[List of committee names and description of functions]</finstr></trace>


<trace>3. Executive Committee. The Board may, in its discretion, by an affirmative vote of a majority of the entire Board, appoint an Executive Committee or any other Committee of the Board, to consist of any <finstr>[text number of members]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of members]</finstr>) or more Officers and/or Directors as the Board may from time to time determine. The Executive Committee shall have and may exercise between meetings of the Board all the powers of the Board in the management of the business and affairs of the Club.</trace>

<trace>ARTICLE VIII: Indemnification and Insurance </trace>

<trace>Indemnification. The Club shall, to the fullest extent now or hereafter permitted by law, indemnify any person against any claim made or threatened to be made in connection with any action, suit, investigation or proceeding (or any claim or other matter therein), whether civil, criminal, administrative or otherwise in nature, including any settlements thereof or any appeals therein, with respect to which such person is named or otherwise becomes or is threatened to be made a party by reason of being, or at any time having been a Director or Officer of the Club, or by reason of being, or at any time having been, while such a Director or Officer of the Club or, at the direction or request of the Club, a Director or Officer against any and all costs and expenses (including attorney fees, judgments, fines, penalties, amounts paid in settlement, and other disbursements) actually and reasonably incurred by or imposed upon such person.  </trace>

<trace>Insurance. The Club may purchase and maintain such insurance on behalf of any person who is or at any time has been a Director, Officer, or agent of, or in a similar capacity with, the Club, or who is or at any time has been, at the direction or request of the Club, a Director, Officer, Chair, manager, adviser of or other agent of or fiduciary for any other corporation, partnership, trust, venture or other entity or enterprise, including any employee benefit plan, insuring them to the extent permitted by law, against any liability asserted against or incurred by such person in connection with any such service to or on behalf of the Club.</trace>

<trace>Advance of Expense. Expenses of each person indemnified hereunder incurred in defending a civil, criminal, administrative or investigative action, suit or proceeding (including all appeals), or threat thereof, may be paid by the Club in advance of the final disposition of such action, suit or proceeding as authorized by the Board, whether a disinterested quorum exists or not, upon receipt of an undertaking by or on behalf of the Director or Officer to repay such amount unless it shall ultimately be determined that he or she is entitled to be indemnified by the Club.</trace>

<trace>Non-Exclusiveness: Heir. The indemnification provided by this Article shall not be deemed exclusive of any other rights to which those seeking indemnification may be entitled as a matter of law or under the Certificate of Incorporation, these Bylaws, any agreement, resolution of the Board, any insurance purchased by the Club, or otherwise, both as to action in his or her official capacity and as to action in another capacity while holding such office, and shall continue as to a person who has ceased to be a Director or Officer and shall inure to the benefit of the heirs, executors and administrators of such a person.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE IX: Amendments</trace>

<trace>Amendments. These Bylaws may be amended by a majority vote of those active Members in good standing present at the Annual Meeting or a Special Meeting of the Club. The Secretary shall send a copy of each proposed Amendment to each Member in good standing at his or her email or postal address as shown in the records of the Club at least <finstr>[text number of minimum days]</finstr> (<finstr>[minimum number of days]</finstr>) calendar days and not more than <finstr>[text number of maximum days]</finstr> (<finstr>[maximum number of days]</finstr>) calendar days prior to the date of the meeting at which the proposed amendment is to be voted on. Amendments may be proposed by majority vote of the Board or petition signed by <finstr>[text number of members]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of members]</finstr>) Members in good standing of the Club submitted to the Secretary.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE X: Miscellaneous</trace>

<trace>Fiscal Year. Unless otherwise ordered by the Board, the fiscal year of the Club shall be <finstr>[start date of fiscal year]</finstr> through <finstr>[end date of fiscal year]</finstr>.</trace>

<trace>Construction. If there is a conflict between the provisions of the Certificate of Incorporation and these Bylaws, the provisions of the Certificate of Incorporation shall govern. All questions of government and procedure for which no provision is made in the Certificate of Incorporation or in the Bylaws and not addressed in the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law shall be decided upon the authority contained in Robert’s Rules Of Order.</trace>

<trace>Reconciliation. The masculine gender, wherever used herein, shall include the feminine, the neuter shall include the masculine and feminine and the singular shall include the plural wherever necessary or appropriate.</trace>

<trace>Tax Exempt Status. The Club currently operates as a separate entity which is exempt from federal income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code. The Board will ensure continuation of such tax exempt status under federal and any applicable State of New York laws and regulations.</trace>

<trace>5.  Ownership of Work. Any work produced by or for the Club, on a Club website or otherwise, as part of the Club’s activities, is the Club’s property.</trace>


<trace>ARTICLE XI: Dissolution</trace>

<trace>In the event of the dissolution of the Club, all remaining property or assets of the Club shall, after necessary expenses thereof, be distributed to such organizations which shall qualify under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and regulations there under, or to another organization to be used in such manner as in the judgment of a Justice of the Supreme Court of the State of New York will best accomplish the general purposes for which the Club was formed.</trace>


<trace>Notes to Form</trace>

<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace> ►<field>tk.ref.id="I005GWM"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</trace>

30:105. Provision against discrimination; eligibility and classification of members

Tax Notes 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|113|30:105"</field>A club organized for pleasure, recreation, and other nonprofitable purposes will not be exempt from taxation for any taxable year if, at any time during such taxable year, the charter, bylaws, or other governing instrument of the organization or any written policy statement of the organization contains a provision that provides for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color, or religion. ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A1I"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§501(i).

<trace>30:105.50. Nondiscrimination</trace>

<trace> M embership in <finstr>[name of club or association]</finstr> will not be denied to any person on account of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity.</trace>

30:106. Athletic club membership
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id554c1c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|114|30:106"</field>Any person who has attained the age of [number of years old] years, who, in the judgment of the board of directors, is possessed of exceptional athletic skill, who has the recommendation of the appropriate committee, and who is capable of promoting the activities of the club shall be eligible for an athletic membership, with the initiation fee being waived. Athletic memberships will expire at the close of each calendar year, subject to renewal at the pleasure of succeeding boards of directors for succeeding periods of not more than one year. Upon request of the board of directors or an authorized club committee, an athletic member shall, as a representative of the club, contribute his or her skill in such manner and in such activities as may be considered by the board of directors to be for the advantage of the club.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|114|30:106"</field>[OPTIONAL: Persons not eligible for continuation in the athletic membership category shall transfer to [type of membership] membership by compliance with the provisions of Article [designation of article] of these bylaws and the payment of the prescribed transfer fee, reduced by [percentage of annual reduction]&percnt;% for each year of contributed services, if such services were of a minimum duration of [number of years] years.]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|114|30:106"</field>Athletic members shall enjoy the privileges and facilities of the club on such terms and conditions as the board of directors may, from time to time, impose.

30:107. Social club membership
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id554e8d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>MEMBERSHIP ARTICLE
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"</field>Adult citizens of the United States or adult foreigners who have been resident in the United States [number of years] years may become members upon election by the Governing Committee and the payment of fees and dues as required by Article [designation of article], but, in default of the required payments, an election is void.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"</field>The number of regular members may not exceed [number of members]. Subject to this limitation, the Governing Committee shall fix the number of regular members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"</field>Candidates for membership must be proposed by one member and seconded by another in their own handwriting or, in their absence, by the Secretary or Assistant Secretary, upon written authorization, in a book kept for that purpose, at least [number of days] days previous to a meeting of the Governing Committee, and their names posted on the bulletin board in the office of the club for the same length of time. No member of the Governing Committee may propose or second a candidate for membership.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"</field>Candidates shall be balloted for in the order of their proposal, but former members being again proposed shall be balloted for before any other candidate. In order to exclude a candidate from membership, there must be three adverse ballots if more than [number of governors] Governors are present and two adverse ballots if not more than [number of governors] Governors are present. A candidate's name may be laid over until the following meeting, but if his or her name is laid over at two successive meetings, the candidate's name is stricken from the list of candidates. If a candidate is rejected, a second ballot shall be taken at any time before the adjournment of the meeting upon the motion of a single Governor. A rejected candidate, or one whose name may be proposed and seconded again for membership, may not be balloted for until his or her name is reached in regular order as of the date of the latest proposal, but this rule does not apply to minor sons of members or deceased members.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"</field>Upon qualifying, a member shall file with the Secretary his or her permanent address to which all notices intended for the member shall be sent. Thereafter, the member shall notify the Secretary of any change in his or her address.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"</field>A resignation from membership must be made to the Secretary in writing and becomes effective when accepted by the Governing Committee. A resignation cannot be accepted until all indebtedness to the Club of the member resigning is paid, including the full yearly dues for the current year.

30:108. Corporate membership program
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55536f01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>There is hereby established a corporate membership on the following terms and conditions:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>A corporation or other legal business entity may apply through its authorized officer or agent to the board of directors for membership of the entity itself, with the privilege of designating certain of its officers and/or employees as entitled to make use of the corporate membership.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>A corporation or other legal business entity shall make application for corporate membership on a form to be provided by [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] for this purpose. [OPTIONAL: Neither a proposer nor a seconder shall be required.] The application form shall inquire as to how many officers and/or employees of the applicant entity the applicant proposes to designate as users of the membership. A minimum number of designated users as set forth in Subsection (i) of this [Article/Section] shall be required.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>The applicant entity shall submit with the application for corporate membership the following items:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(1). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>A completed [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] membership application form for each corporate officer or employee it proposes to designate as a user of the membership. The sponsor portion of the form shall be executed by the corporation. [OPTIONAL: A seconder shall not be required.] That portion of the form regarding membership classification requested shall be answered with the word &ldquo;“Corporate.&rdquo;”
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(2). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>The corporation's check in payment of the initiation fee.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(d). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>The board of directors shall fix the corporate membership initiation fee and/or the component factors of it and may raise or lower the same at any time, with or without advance notice or posting. The Board may also at its discretion offer any discount in connection with such corporate membership initiation fees.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(e). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>An application for corporate membership shall not be acted upon by the board of directors until notice of the application, including the names and positions of the proposed users of the corporate membership shall have been posted on the [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] bulletin board for not less than two (2) weeks. During such time, any member may file in writing with the secretary a signed protest against the application in any particular, and the secretary shall present such protest to the board of directors before the application is acted upon.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(f). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>Board approval of an application for corporate membership shall be subject to the same provision respecting other applications for membership contained in these bylaws [citation of bylaw]; that is, three (3) negative votes shall reject an applicant, and no rejected applicant shall again apply for membership within one (1) year after the date of such rejection.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(g). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>Upon approval of the application, the secretary shall promptly notify the corporation of the same and shall request payment of the first full month's dues for the proposed number of users of the corporate membership. On receipt of such dues, the secretary shall promptly issue individual membership cards in the name of the corporate member on which the name of the designated user of the membership shall be stated.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(h). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>Corporate membership dues, exclusive of any tax, will be fixed by the board of directors. Changes shall not become effective until the proposed new schedule of dues has been posted for 30 days on the [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] bulletin board and published at least once in the [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] bulletin.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(i). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>A corporate member shall not be liable for dues for the entity itself, but only for its designated users. At all times, however, the corporate member must have designated at least three (3) users of the membership, whose dues are paid by the corporate member or by the user individually; if less than the minimum number of users is designated, the corporate member shall be liable for the difference in dues. The minimum number of designated users required under this agreement may be raised or lowered prospectively by the board of directors without notice.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(j). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>A corporate member may change a designated user of the membership at any time by written notice and request to the Secretary, which request must include a completed [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] membership application form as provided in Subsection (c)(1) of this Section. No request for change of a designated user of the corporate membership will be acted upon by the board of directors until the name and position of the proposed user shall have been posted on the [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] bulletin board for not less than two (2) weeks. During such time, any member may file in writing with the Secretary a signed protest against the proposed designated user, and the Secretary shall present such protest to the Board before the request is acted upon. If no written protest is received during the two-week posting period, no Board action on the request shall be necessary. In either event, when the change in designated user is authorized or permitted, the Secretary shall inform the corporate member of the change and request that the membership card of the person whose designated membership is to be terminated be delivered to the [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] business office. Upon receipt of such card, a corporate membership card bearing the name of the newly designated user will be issued. A charge may be imposed for this procedure.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(k). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>At the option of the corporate member, dues assessed and charges incurred by its designated users may be billed to the corporate member or to the designated users of the membership individually, but, in the latter event, the corporate member shall be responsible for payment of the account of any of its designated users that becomes delinquent.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(l). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>Designated users of corporate membership shall have all the rights and privileges of, and shall be subject to all responsibilities of, individual [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] membership. For purposes of [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] elections and general and special membership meetings, each designated user of a corporate membership shall have one vote, provided such person is otherwise qualified to vote. The corporate member as an entity shall have no voting rights. If a designated user is ordered expelled pursuant to the disciplinary procedures set forth in these bylaws, the corporate member must promptly designate another user or forego designating a user in such person's place for the time being and must take steps to insure as best it can that the expelled party does not subsequently make use of the corporate membership.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(m). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>A person who has been a corporate member's designated user for at least one (1) year and whose designated use of such membership is thereafter terminated by the corporate member may, at any time within six (6) months of the date of such termination, apply for individual [[name of incorporated club]/[name of incorporated association]] membership in the classification for which such person is then qualified by submitting a completed membership application to the board of directors. [OPTIONAL: Neither a proposer nor a seconder shall be required, but the fact that the applicant was previously a designated user of a corporate membership (which shall be identified) must be noted on the face of the application.] The applicant may either attach the appropriate initiation fee to the application or request waiver of such fee, which request may be granted in whole or in part in the discretion of the board of directors at the time the application is acted upon. The application shall not be subject to posting requirements. Upon acceptance, the individual's dues rate shall be adjusted according to the person's new membership classification, and a new membership card shall be issued upon receipt of the appropriate initiation fee, if any.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(n). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>The provisions set forth in this [Article/Section] shall prevail with respect to corporate membership over any conflicting provisions of these bylaws respecting membership generally.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"</field>If the corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005H3K"</field>N-PCL &s;§601(b).

30:109. Entrance fees, dues, and assessments
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5555e001b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>ENTRANCE FEES AND DUES ARTICLE 
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>The Governing Committee may fix the entrance fees of regular members and the time of payment of these fees from time to time in such amounts as it may determine or to waive these fees.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>The yearly dues of regular members are:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>For those who are [number of years old] years of age or more, $[dollar amount of annual dues];
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>For those who are [number of years old] years of age or more and less than [number of years old] years of age, $[dollar amount of annual dues];
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>For those who are [number of years old] years of age or more and less than [number of years old] years of age, $[dollar amount of annual dues]; and
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(d). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>For those who are less than [number of years old] years of age, $[dollar amount of annual dues].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>The age of a member on the [ordinal number of day] of [name of month] of each year determines the amount of dues payable by the member for that year. Dues for the year are due on the first day of [name of month] and, at the option of a member, may be paid either in full in that month or in four equal quarterly installments on the first days of [names of months].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>Officers of the Army and Navy on active service are exempted from the payment of entrance fees and, when stationed or residing in [name of place], shall pay quarterly dues of $[dollar amount of quarterly dues], and when stationed or residing more than [number of miles] miles from [name of place] shall pay quarterly dues of $[dollar amount of quarterly dues]. These quarterly dues are payable in advance on the first days of [names of months] of each year. The station or residence of an Army or Navy member on the first day of each of these months determines that member's status as to the amount of dues he or she must pay for the succeeding three months. Upon retirement from active service, officers shall pay dues as provided in Section 2 of this Article, provided that the Governing Committee may in its discretion remit in whole or in part the dues of an officer. Officers of the Regular Army and Navy of the United States elected prior to [identification of year] are exempt from the payment of dues.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>Members called for training or service in the Armed Forces of the United States may, upon application to the Secretary, be granted during their term of service the same reduction in dues enjoyed by officers of the Army and Navy when on active service.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>The Governing Committee may, upon request, grant to members engaged in a civilian capacity by the government for defense work the same reduction in dues enjoyed by members in the Armed Forces of the United States when on active service.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>Candidates elected between the dates for the payment of dues shall pay, in addition to the entrance fee, dues pro rata from the first of the month in which he or she shall be elected until the next following date fixed for the payment of dues.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>The Governing Committee may remit, in whole or in part, the dues of regular members who are members of the diplomatic corps of the United States while on foreign service.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>The entrance fees shall be reserved and accumulated as a separate fund and shall be applied only as the Governing Committee, by a three-quarter vote of those present at a meeting, shall determine.
ASSESSMENTS ARTICLE 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>It is the duty of the Governing Committee, from time to time, to determine the necessity for and the amount of assessments, if any, and present the same to the members for approval, in accordance with Article [designation of article] of the Certificate of Incorporation.
Notes to Form

Tax Notes 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (►<field>st.ref.id="I005H3P"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§262) or business purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A8L"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(a)(3). This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3DH"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§162(a). The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;“business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo;” It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DWID"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(e)(4).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;“clubs&rdquo;” that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club--dining and recreational facilities--the costs should be deductible as business expenses.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005H4U"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(a)(3). An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A9Q"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§170(b).
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3EM"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00DWJI"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3400
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00GPOE"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00JITA"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>828, 829</trace>
30:110. Entrance fees, dues, and assessments-- Penalties on failure to pay
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55585101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>PENALTIES ARTICLE 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"</field>Any member who fails to pay the second installment of his or her entrance fee when due, or the dues for the current quarter year, or an assessment, within [number of days] days after the amount due becomes payable, shall cease to be a member, subject to the provisions of Article [designation of article], Section [number of section].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"</field>Any member who fails to pay any other amount due the Club exceeding $[dollar amount of sum due], for [number of days] days after notice of the indebtedness and a request to pay the amount due has been given to that member shall cease to be a member, subject to the provisions of Article [designation of article], Section [number of section].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"</field>In default of a member inscribing in a book, to be kept in the office, a mail address for forwarding notices prescribed or directed by the Constitution or the Rules, notices may be addressed to the member at the Club. The member is deemed to have received any notice [number of days] days after it was mailed or deposited.
Notes to Form

Tax Notes 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"</field>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (►<field>st.ref.id="I005H4X"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§262) or business purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A9T"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(a)(3). This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00B3EP"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§162(a). The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;“business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo;” It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DWJL"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(e)(4).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"</field>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;“clubs&rdquo;” that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club--dining and recreational facilities--the costs should be deductible as business expenses.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"</field>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. ►<field>st.ref.id="I005H4Z"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§274(a)(3). An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under ►<field>st.ref.id="I008A9V"</field>26 U.S.C.A. &s;§170(b).

<trace>30:110.90. Dues</trace>

<trace>The annual dues for the next calendar year for each membership classification shall be established by a vote of the members at the preceding <finstr>[ identification of meeting ]</finstr>  meeting of members. Statements for dues will be issued on or before <finstr>[date of issuance]</finstr> of each year, due on or before <finstr>[due date of payment]</finstr> of the statement year. Dues for new members shall be due upon acceptance into membership, in such amount as shall be set by the Executive Board, but not to exceed the amount set by the membership for the applicable class of member.</trace>
