30:111. Disciplinary proceedings against members
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id555d3301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"</field>Any member may at any time be expelled without cause assigned by the vote of two-thirds of the remaining members of the association at any regularly called meeting of the members.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SUHU"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05OMSI"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I05KF36"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I05G7DU"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"</field>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00HTJI"</field>Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"</field>A possible alternative to a noticed hearing conducted by the corporation is a bylaw that requires binding arbitration. For discussion and forms concerning arbitration, see <trace.deleted/>►<field>x.ref.id="I00KMOE"</field>&ss;§§12A:1 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006L01"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009E4X"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>830</trace> et seq.
30:112. Disciplinary proceedings against members-- Suspension and expulsion
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id555fa401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>ARTICLE [NUMBER OF ARTICLE]
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>DISCIPLINE OF MEMBERS
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Any member who shall violate any provision of these Bylaws, the House Rules, or any other rule or regulation duly adopted by the Board of Directors, or who shall do anything calculated to disturb the order, peace, or harmony of the Club or to impair the good name of the Club shall be deemed guilty of conduct unbecoming a member and may be reprimanded, suspended, fined, and/or expelled. Such action shall affect all persons deriving Club privileges through such member.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Filing Charges.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.2(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>A Club member in whose presence another member engages in conduct unbecoming a member may file with the House Committee a charge in writing designating the time, place, and circumstances of such unbecoming conduct.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.2(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>The General Manager may file with the House Committee a written charge of unbecoming conduct against a member when he or she is informed of facts constituting a breach of Section 2.1 of this ARTICLE.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.2(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>The Board of Directors may direct the House Committee to determine whether there exists reasonable cause to believe that a member has engaged in unbecoming conduct. If the House Committee so finds, it shall proceed as provided in Section 2.3 of this ARTICLE.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Hearing and Procedure.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.3(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Whenever a complaint is filed charging conduct unbecoming a member and is determined to be sufficient by the House Committee or whenever the House Committee determines that a written complaint shall issue, the House Committee shall give written notice to the accused, stating the substance of the charge in concise terms and requesting the accused member to appear at a hearing before the Committee to be held not sooner than three (3) days and not later than thirty (30) days from the date of the notice. At such hearing, the accused shall have the right to appear, to have counsel, to have the complaint read in his or her presence, to confront witnesses against him or her, to produce witnesses on his or her own behalf, and to testify. In making its evidentiary determination, the Committee shall find the charge of conduct unbecoming a member either proven or not proven, and, if proven, it shall recommend to the Board of Directors, in accordance with Section 2.4 of this Article, such punishment of the member as, in its judgment, may be proper.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.3(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>The hearing need not be conducted in accordance with legal rules of evidence, and any relevant evidence, whether or not admissible in a court of law, shall be admissible at a House Committee hearing.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.3(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>A verbatim record of the proceedings before the House Committee may be caused to be made by the accused member at his or her own expense.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Within fifteen (15) days after the meeting at which the House Committee has found the charge of conduct unbecoming a member proven, the Committee shall make a report and recommendation to the Board of Directors, a copy of which will be given to the accused member in person or by certified mail.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Within five (5) days of the receipt by the accused member of the report and recommendation of the House Committee, the accused member may appeal in writing to the Club Secretary and request that the Board of Directors review the report and recommendation. Failure to request such a review within the five-day period shall constitute a waiver of any right to a review before the Board of Directors, which shall then implement the recommendation of the House Committee. In the event a Board review is requested by the accused member, the Board of Directors shall set a date and time certain for the same and shall notify the accused member thereof in writing. The accused member shall have the right to be represented by counsel. The Board of Directors shall render its final determination within fifteen (15) days following its review, and the report of such determination shall be made in writing to the House Committee, with a copy given to the accused member in person or by certified mail. The action of the Board of Directors shall be final and not reviewable, provided that no member shall be expelled, nor shall he or she be suspended for a period in excess of sixty (60) days, except on the affirmative vote of nine (9) or more members of the Board. Any member who fails to comply with the decision of the Board shall ipso facto cease to be a member of the Club.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Failure of the accused member to appear at the designated hearing of the House Committee, as provided in Section 2.3(a) of this Article, shall be deemed a voluntary confession and a plea of guilty to the charges set forth in the complaint.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Each member of the Club waives any right to personal redress against the House Committee or against the Board of Directors for disciplinary action taken under this ARTICLE.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>In grave and unusual cases, where immediate action must be taken to protect the welfare of any member of the Club, the President, the Chairperson of the House Committee, or any person specifically designated by either one of them may summarily suspend a member's Club privileges. In such cases, the suspended member may request a hearing before the House Committee to be held within seventy-two (72) hours to determine whether such suspension should be continued.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.9. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>A member suspended under this Article remains liable for all dues and other charges for which he or she would be liable were the suspension not imposed.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.10. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Any nonmember who shall, in the opinion of the House Committee, commit a breach of Section 2.1 of this Article may be dealt with summarily by the House Committee in such manner as it may deem appropriate. The action of the House Committee under this section shall be final and not reviewable.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>Section 1.11. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Discipline of any member shall be only as described in this ARTICLE. No member shall be immune from the disciplinary procedures and sanctions set forth in this ARTICLE because of office or position in the Club or because of the type of membership held.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SUHK"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006L06"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I009E52"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C79Y"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00F0EU"</field>Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"</field>A possible alternative to a noticed hearing conducted by the corporation is a bylaw that requires binding arbitration. For discussion and forms concerning arbitration, see <trace.deleted/>►<field>x.ref.id="I00HTJQ"</field>&ss;§§12A:1 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00KMOM"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006L1B"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>830</trace> et seq.
30:113. Disciplinary proceedings against members-- Member's indebtedness
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55648601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>INDEBTEDNESS ARTICLE 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>[On the first day of each month/As soon after that day as may be practicable], a notice with request for payment of the member's indebtedness to the Club on the last day of the preceding month shall be sent to each member with a request to pay the same at the member's earliest convenience.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>Any member whose indebtedness by the foregoing Section exceeds $[dollar amount of debt] and who fails to pay the indebtedness in full for [number of days] days after notice and a request to pay has been given to the member shall incur the penalty imposed by Article [designation of article], Section [number of section] of the Constitution.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>Any member whose indebtedness exceeds $[dollar amount of debt] on the expiration of [number of days] days after the first day of any month between [name of month 1] and [name of month 2] shall have his or her credit and supplies suspended by the House Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>If a member becomes indebted to the Club in the sum of $[dollar amount of debt] or over, his or her further credit and supplies shall be suspended until the entire amount due is paid in full.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>No vouchers shall be delivered to members for inspection or otherwise until members have paid their bills.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>A member of the Club in good standing may obtain from the Club a sum not exceeding $[dollar amount of check] in one day on a check drawn or endorsed by that member and presented in person by him or her after or on the date of the check. The [Treasurer/Assistant Treasurer], whenever he or she deems it advisable, may suspend this privilege as to any one or more members.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009E67"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7B3"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00F0FZ"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011) holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I006L1E"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. ►<field>cc.ref.id="I009E6A"</field>Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"</field>A possible alternative to a noticed hearing conducted by the corporation is a bylaw that requires binding arbitration. For discussion and forms concerning arbitration, see <trace.deleted/>►<field>x.ref.id="I00C7B6"</field>&ss;§§12A:1 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00F0G2"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00HTKY"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>830</trace> et seq.


<trace>30:113.50. Suspension or terminat ion of membership</trace>

<trace>In the event the Board elects to initiate proceedings to suspend a member's privileges or terminate a membership, it must notify the member, in writing, of its intention to suspend or terminate and the alleged cause therefore. If the member, within <finstr>[text number of days]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of days]</finstr>) days of the date of the notice, makes a written request for a hearing to contest the proposed suspension or termination, the Board President must set a time for hearing, which must be within <finstr>[text number of days]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of days]</finstr>) days of the date of receiving the request for hearing. The hearing must be open to all members. The Board President or a member appointed by the Board President must preside over the meeting and establish the meeting procedures. The affirmative vote of a <finstr>[text fraction of Board]</finstr> ( <finstr>[fraction of Board]</finstr> ) majority of the full Board will be required in order to effect a suspension or termination of a membership and its privileges.</trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace> ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00F0G2"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402</trace>

30:114. Meetings
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5566f701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>MEETINGS OF MEMBERS 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section One.. Annual Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field>An annual meeting of the members shall be held at [location of annual meeting], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state] on the [ordinal number of day] in the month of [name of month] in each year, beginning with the year at [time of annual meeting], for the purpose of electing directors and for the transaction of other business that may come before the meeting. If the day fixed for the annual meeting is a legal holiday in the State of New York, the meeting shall be held on the next succeeding business day. If the election of directors is not held on the day designated for the annual meeting or at any adjournment of the annual meeting, the board of directors shall cause the election to be held at a special meeting of the members as soon after the annual meeting as conveniently maybe.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Two.. Special Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the President, the board of directors, or not less than one-tenth of the members having voting rights.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Three.. Place of Meeting. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field>The board of directors may designate any place, either within or without the State of New York, as the place of meeting for any annual meeting or for any special meeting called by the board of directors. If no designation is made or if a special meeting is otherwise called, the place of meeting shall be the principal office of the corporation in the State of New York, but, if all of the members meet at any time and place, either within or without the State of New York, and consent to the holding of a meeting, that meeting shall be valid without call or notice, and at that meeting any corporate action may be taken.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Four.. Notice of Meetings. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field>Written or printed notice stating the place, day, and hour of any meeting of members shall be delivered, either personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at the meeting, not less than [number of days] nor more than [number of days] days before the date of the meeting, by or at the direction of the President, the secretary, the officers, or persons calling the meeting. In case of a special meeting or when required by statute or by these bylaws, the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called shall be stated in the notice. If mailed, the notice of a meeting shall deemed to be delivered when deposited in the United States mail addressed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the records of the corporation, with postage on the notice prepaid. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation.
Notes to Form

Section One. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006L71"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(b).

In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EC0"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(c).

Section Four. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he o r she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I00KMVK"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting, shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006L76"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.
<trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00F0LU"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>901 to 907</trace>

<trace>30:114. 50. Annual and special meetings</trace>
<trace><p> Annual Meetings. An annual meeting of the members shall be held once each year for the election of Directors and the transaction of other business, if any, on a date to be determined by the Members. No notice is required.</trace>
<trace><p> Special Meetings. The members may, at any time, call a special meeting on a date to be determined by the members to fill a vacancy or vacancies on the Board of Directors, to remove one or more Directors with or without cause, to elect new directors, or to transact other business, if necessary, on a date to be determined by the members. No notice is required.</trace>

<trace>30:116.50. Proxies</trace>
<trace>Every proxy must be executed in writing by the member or by his or her attorney-in-fact. No proxy shall be valid after the expiration of <finstr>[number of months]</finstr> months from the date thereof, unless otherwise provided in the proxy. Every proxy shall be revocable at the pleasure of the member executing it.</trace>

30:117. Appointment of inspectors of elections
FCV
FTR
COL
NFP
CLS
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55732c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>At any members' meeting or any adjournment of such meeting, not more than [maximum number of inspectors] nor less than [minimum number of inspectors] inspectors of election shall be duly appointed to act at such meeting by the [President/acting chairperson of the meeting]. Such inspectors shall be appointed from among [the members present at the meeting/[number of members] members].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>Each inspector so appointed, before entering upon the discharge of his or her duties, shall take and sign an oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector at such meeting with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability. The oath shall be administered by the [President/acting chairperson of the meeting].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>The inspectors shall determine the number of votes represented at the meeting; the existence of a quorum; and the authenticity, validity, and effect of proxies for such votes. They shall receive votes, ballots, or consents and shall hear and determine all challenges and questions in any way arising in connection with the right to vote at such meeting. They shall count and tabulate all votes or consents, determine the results, and perform such further services as may be proper to insure fairness to all members. The decision, act, or certificate of a majority of the inspectors shall be effective in all respects as the decision, act, or certificate of all.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>On request of [the chairperson of any meeting/any member or his or her proxy], the inspectors shall make a report in writing of any challenge on matters determined by them and shall execute a certificate of any fact found by them. Any report or certificate made by any such inspector shall be prima facie evidence of the facts stated in it.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>Unless the bylaws otherwise provide, the board may, in advance of a members' meeting, appoint one or more inspectors to act at the meeting or any adjournment of such meeting. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006L8E"</field>N-PCL &s;§610(a). The above form provides for appointment of inspectors by the presiding officer from among those members present at the meeting. The oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector at such meeting with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability is required by statute. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EDA"</field>N-PCL &s;§610(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>If inspectors are not appointed pursuant to the bylaws or fail to qualify, the person presiding at a members' meeting may and on the request of any member entitled to vote thereat must make the appointment. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7I6"</field>N-PCL &s;§610(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"</field>The duties of inspectors are set forth in the statute. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F0N2"</field>N-PCL &s;§610(b).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00HTRY"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3410

<trace>30:118.50. Provision against discrimination in selection of directors</trace>
<trace> Members of the Board of Directors will be selected without regard to gender, race, color, culture, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender expression or mental or physical disability .</trace>

<trace>30:119.50 . Powers of directors <sep> Execution of c ontracts</trace>
<trace>The Board of Directors, except as otherwise provided in these  By l aws, may authorize any officer (s) or agent ( s ) in the name of and on behalf of the  Corporation, to enter into any contract or execute and deliver any instrument and such authority may  be general or confined to specific instances but, unless so authorized by the Board of Directors or  expressly authorized by these By l aws, no officer, agent or employee shall have any power or  authority to bind the Corporation by any contract or engagement or to pledge its credit or to render it  liable pecuniarily in any amount for any purpose.</trace>

30:120. Staggered terms of office
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id557f6101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|129|30:120"</field>The board of directors of the club shall consist of [number of members] members divided into [two/three] classes, each class to be as nearly equal in number as is possible. The term of office of directors of the first class shall expire at the first annual meeting of members after their election, [OPTIONAL: and] that of the second class shall expire at the second annual meeting after their election [OPTIONAL: and that of the third class shall expire at the third annual meeting after their election]. At each annual meeting after such classification, the number of directors equal to the number of the class whose terms expire at time of such meeting shall be elected to hold office until the [second/third] succeeding annual meeting.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|129|30:120"</field>The minimum number of directors of a not-for-profit corporation is set by statute at three. Subject to that limitation, the bylaws must specify the number of directors or make provision to enable the members or the board to fix the number. In the absence of such a provision, the number of directors will be three. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EDF"</field>N-PCL &s;§702(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|129|30:120"</field>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that directors elected or appointed at large shall be divided into either two, three, four, or five classes for the purpose of staggering their terms of office and that all or some of the directors elected or appointed otherwise than at large shall be divided into the same or a different number of classes, not exceeding five, for the same purpose. All classes shall be as nearly equal in number as possible and, if provision has been made for cumulative voting, no class shall include less than three directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7IB"</field>N-PCL &s;§704(a). The terms of office of the directors initially classified shall be as follows: (1) that of the first class shall expire at the next annual meeting of members if there be members or of the board if there be no members; (2) the second class at the second succeeding annual meeting; or (3) the third class, if any, at the third annual meeting, and so on. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LE6"</field>N-PCL &s;§704.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009EJ2"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3420
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C7NY"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>537</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>541</trace>

<trace>30:120.50. Conflict of interest</trace>

<trace>Whenever a director has a financial or personal interest in any matter comin g before the board of directors, the affected person must fully disclose the nature of the interest and withdraw from discussi ng . lobbying. and voting on the matter. Any transaction or vote involving a p otential conflict of interest will be approved only when a majority of disinterested directors determine that it is in the best interest of <finstr>[name of organization]</finstr> to do so. The minutes of meetings at which such votes are taken must record such disclosure ,  a bstention , and reasons for a pp roval.</trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace> ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009EJ2"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3420</trace>

30:121. Participation in directors' meeting by conference telephone or electronic communication
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5581d201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|130|30:121"</field>Members of the board of directors or of any committee of the board of directors [may participate and act/are prohibited from participating and acting] at any meeting of the board or such committee through the use of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|130|30:121"</field>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any one or more members of the board or of any committee thereof who is not physically present at a meeting of the board or a committee may participate by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means will constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LE9"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(c).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009EJ5"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C7O1"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§60<trace>2</trace>
30:122. Informal action by directors
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55844301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|131|30:122"</field>With the exceptions subsequently noted, any action required to be taken at a meeting of the board of directors or a committee of the board may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing or electronic, setting forth the action so taken, is signed or transmitted by all of the directors entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter under consideration or by all the members of such committee, as the case may be, provided that such procedure shall not be employed and shall not be effective to [[amend/enlarge/repeal] these bylaws/elect any officer/to fill any vacancy on the board of directors/[specification of other event]].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|131|30:122"</field>The consent shall be evidenced by one or more written approvals, each of which sets forth the action taken and bears the signature of one or more directors. All the approvals evidencing the consent shall be delivered to the secretary to be filed in the corporate records. The action taken shall be effective when all the directors have approved their consent unless the consent specifies a different effective date.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|131|30:122"</field>Unless <trace>otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee. </trace>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F0SX"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(b).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006LEB"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009EJ7"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§60<trace>2</trace>
<trace>30: 1 22.50. Action by unanimous consent<br></trace>
<trace>Any action required or permitted to be taken by the Board of Directors, or any committee thereof ("Committee"), may be taken without a meeting if all members of the Board or the Committee consent in writing to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the Board or Committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the Board or Committee.</trace>


<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace> ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006LEB"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</trace>

30:123. Directors' meetings
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5586b401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|132|30:123"</field>Every action or decision done or made by the board of directors shall be done or made at a meeting duly called and held as provided in the certificate of incorporation and these bylaws, and no action or decision shall be done or made by unanimous written consent in lieu of a meeting.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|132|30:123"</field>This provision is based on ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7O3"</field>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &s;§708(b), which provides that unless<trace> otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee.</trace>
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00F0SZ"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05STP0"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>595</trace>

<trace>30:123.40. Remov al</trace>
<trace>A member of the Board of Directors who is deemed to be no longer fit to serve on the Board of Directors will be removed by a <finstr>[percentage of vote]</finstr>% vote of the entire Board of Directors.</trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>

<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace><field>tk.ref.id="I00HU68"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;342 0, 3421</trace>

<trace>30:123.50. Vacancies</trace>
<trace>Vacancies on the Board may be temporarily filled by Presidential nomination and elected by the Board. Directors elected under this provision will serve until the next annual meeting. </trace>
<trace>2. Vacancies of Elected Director seats will be permanently filled by election at the next annual meeting. Directors elected to fill a vacancy will serve the remaining term of the seat vacated.</trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>

(4) Officers
30:124. Powers and duties of officers
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id558e0701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>President 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>The President shall be the principal executive officer and, subject to the control and direction of the Board, shall in general supervise and control all of the day-to-day social, charitable and business affairs of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]]. He or She shall preside at all meetings of the directors. The President shall have authority, subject to such rules as may be prescribed by the Board, to appoint such agents and employees of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]] as he or she shall deem necessary, to prescribe their powers, duties, and compensation, and to delegate authority to them. Such agents and employees shall hold office at the discretion of the President and the Board. The President shall have authority to sign, execute, and acknowledge, on behalf of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]], all deeds, mortgages, bonds, contracts, leases, and all other agreements, documents, and instruments necessary or proper to be executed in the course of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]]'s regular activities or business, or which shall be authorized by the Board.
►<field>fac.lo="n"</field>Vice Presidents
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>In the absence of the President, or in the event of the President's death, inability, or refusal to act, or in the event for any reason it shall be impracticable for the President to act personally, a Vice President (or in the event there be more than one Vice President, the Vice Presidents in the order designated by the Board, or in the absence of any designation, then in the order of their appointment) shall perform the duties of the President, and when so acting, shall have all the powers of and be subject to all the restrictions on the President. Any Vice President may sign, with the Secretary or Assistant Secretary, certificates representing interests in [[name of club]/[name of social organization]], if the issuance thereof shall have been authorized by the Board; and shall perform such other duties and have such authority as from time to time may be delegated or assigned to him or her by the President or the Board. The execution of any agreement, document, or instrument of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]] by any Vice President shall be conclusive evidence, as to third parties, of the Vice President's authority to act in the stead of the President.
►<field>fac.lo="n"</field>Secretary
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>The Secretary shall:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(i). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>keep (or cause to be kept) regular minutes of all meetings of the Board and all resolutions adopted by action of the directors or the Board in one or more books provided for that purpose;
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(ii). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>use his or her best efforts to ensure that all notices are duly given in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement or as required by law;
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(iii). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>be custodian of the records of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]];
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(iv). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>sign with the President, or a Vice President, certificates representing interests in [[name of club]/[name of social organization]], if the issuance thereof shall have been authorized by the Board; and
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(v). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>in general perform all duties incident to the office of Secretary and have such other duties and exercise such authority as from time to time may be delegated or assigned to him or her by the President or by the Board.
►<field>fac.lo="n"</field>Treasurer
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>The Treasurer shall:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(i). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>have charge and custody of and be responsible for all funds and securities of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]];
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(ii). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>receive and give receipts for moneys due and payable to [[name of club]/[name of social organization]] from any source whatsoever, and deposit all such moneys in the name of [[name of club]/[name of social organization]] in such banks, trust companies, or other depositaries as shall be selected by [[name of club]/[name of social organization]]; and
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(iii). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>in general perform all of the duties incident to the office of Treasurer and have such other duties and exercise such other authority as from time to time may be delegated or assigned to him or her by the President or by the Board.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"</field>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more vice-Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LFJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a). The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EKF"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(b).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C7PB"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
30:125. Powers and duties of Vice Presidents
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id559a3c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|134|30:125"</field>The Vice Presidents of the club, in the order of their seniority and rank, shall be [titles of officers]. Each Vice President shall have the authority and duties and shall perform the functions consonant with his or her department and area of interest, specified by the [board of directors/executive committee/[title of entity]]. In case of the inability of the President to act on account of absence, illness, or for any other reason, the President's power shall be assumed and duties discharged during the period of such inability or absence by the senior Vice President available, and the acts of the Vice President, duly authorized and performed under such conditions, shall be the acts of and shall be binding on the club. If a Vice President who has temporarily assumed the duties of the President is unable for any reason to continue to perform such duties, the same shall be performed by the Vice President next in seniority who is available for the purpose. A Vice President who acts as President under this bylaw shall report fully to the President and to the [board of directors/executive committee/[title of entity]] on the President's return to duty with respect to all actions taken and transactions accomplished by him or her during the absence or disability of the President.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|134|30:125"</field>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws.  ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"</field>The Secretary shall keep or cause to be kept in permanent form an accurate record of all transactions of [name of corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"</field>The Secretary shall send due notice of all meetings to members; notice of at least [number of days] days shall be provided prior to [type of meeting] meetings.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"</field>The Secretary shall notify all committee members of their appointments and the duties assigned to them.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"</field>The Secretary shall notify all applicants for membership of the action taken by [name of corporation].

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"</field>The Secretary shall keep a correct list of members, together with their current addresses and shall supply application forms to prospective members.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"</field>The Secretary shall act as custodian of all papers of [name of corporation] and its committees.

30:127. Salary

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55a40001b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|136|30:127"</field>No officer of the corporation shall receive, directly or indirectly, any salary, compensation, or emolument from the corporation, either as an officer or in any other capacity unless authorized by the concurring vote of two-thirds of all the directors or by the vote or written consent of not less than [number of members] members of the Executive Committee.

30:128. Duties of officers
COL
NFP

FCV
FTR

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55a67101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>OFFICERS ARTICLE 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>The Officers of the Club consist of a President, a Vice President, a Secretary, an Assistant Secretary, a Treasurer, and an Assistant Treasurer. The Governing Committee shall elect the Officers annually from its own body. The Officers shall hold office until the second [name of month] in [identification of year], next succeeding, and until their successors are respectively elected and assume their duties of office.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>The President, or in the President's absence, the Vice President, shall preside at all meetings of the Club and of the Governing Committee. In the absence of both, those present at a meeting shall elect their own presiding officer.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>The Secretary, or in the Secretary's absence, the Assistant Secretary, shall keep the records of the Club. The Secretary shall give notice of all meetings of the Club and of the Governing Committee, shall keep minutes of such meetings, and shall notify persons elected to membership of their election.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>The Treasurer, or in the Treasurer's absence, the Assistant Treasurer, shall collect all monies payable to the Club, shall keep the accounts of the Club, shall report on these accounts monthly to the Governing Committee, and prepare the annual report to be presented by the Governing Committee at the annual meeting of the members. The Treasurer shall pay all bills incurred in the operation of the Club on the approval of the House Committee or of such other Committee as the Governing Committee may, from time to time, designate. The Treasurer's accounts shall be audited annually.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>The President, or the Vice President, shall, with the Secretary or the Assistant Secretary, or the Treasurer or the Assistant Treasurer, sign all written contracts and obligations of the Club and, when so authorized by the Governing Committee, shall execute under their hands and seals, notes, bonds or other evidences of indebtedness, and shall sign, execute, and deliver deeds, conveyances, bills of sale, mortgages, or other pledges of any or all Club property, real or personal.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>Directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers <trace>and key persons </trace>must discharge the duties of their respective positions in good faith and with the care an ordinarily prudent person in a like position would exercise under similar circumstances.<trace> </trace>
<trace.deleted/><field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>The factors set forth in ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HU4V"</field>N-PCL &s;§552(e)(1) (Standard of conduct in managing and investing an institutional fund), if relevant, must be considered by a governing board delegating investment management of institutional funds pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LLE"</field>N-PCL &s;§514 (Delegation of investment management). ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EQA"</field>N-PCL &s;§717(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"</field>In discharging their duties, directors<trace>, and key perso ns</trace>acting in good faith may rely on information, opinions, reports, or statements, including financial statements and other financial data, in each case prepared or presented by: (1) one or more officers or employees of the corporation whom the director believes to be reliable and competent in the matters presented; (2) counsel, public accountants, or other persons as to matters which the directors<trace>, or k ey persons</trace> believe to be within such person's professional or expert competence; or (3) a committee of the board upon which they do not serve, duly designated in accordance with a provision of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, as to matter within its designated authority, which committee the directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers <trace>or key persons </trace>believe to merit confidence, as long as in so relying they shall be acting in good faith and with the proper degree of care. Persons shall not be considered to be acting in good faith if they have knowledge concerning the matter in question that would cause such reliance to be unwarranted. Persons who so perform their duties shall have no liability by reason of being or having been directors<trace>,</trace> <trace.deleted/>officers<trace> or key persons</trace> of the corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C7V6"</field>N-PCL &s;§717(b).

30:129. Duties of officers-- Two or more offices held by the same person
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55a8e201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|138|30:129"</field>Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of [titles of officers].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|138|30:129"</field>Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009EQC"</field>N-PCL &s;§713(a). This restriction apparently is imposed so that no officer may execute, acknowledge, or verify any instrument in more than one capacity if the instrument is required by law or by the bylaws to be executed, acknowledged, or verified by two or more officers.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C7V8"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00F104"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00HU50"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>

<trace>30:129.50. Term of office</trace>
<trace>Officers shall be elected at the first meeting of the Board of Directors and thereafter at each Annual Meeting of the Board of Directors. Unless a longer or shorter term is provided in the resolution of the Board of Directors electing an Officer, the term of office of each Officer  shall extend to the next Annual Meeting and until the Officer's successor is elected.</trace>

<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace> ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009ERI"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424</trace>
<trace> ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C7WE"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425</trace>

30:130. Limitation of terms
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55ab5301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|139|30:130"</field>No officer may be elected for more than two successive terms.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|139|30:130"</field>Each officer shall hold office for the term for which he or she is elected or appointed and until his or her successor has been elected or appointed and qualified. Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, all officers shall be elected or appointed annually. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LMM"</field>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &s;§713(c). <trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009ERI"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C7WE"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00F11A"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§531</trace>
30:131. Removal of officers
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55adc401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|140|30:131"</field>All Executive Officers are subject to removal at any time by the affirmative vote of a majority of the authorized directors then in office. All other officers and all heads of departments, managing directors, managers, assistant managers, agents, and employees of the association may be removed at any time by the officer appointing them or by any other superior officer or any committee or board authorized by the Board of Directors or Executive Committee.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|140|30:131"</field>Any officer elected or appointed by the board may be removed by the board with or without cause. An officer elected by the members may be removed, with or without cause, only by vote of the members, but the authority to act as an officer may be suspended by the board for cause. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HU66"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(a). The removal will be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the person so removed. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LMO"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(b). Election or appointment of an officer will not of itself create any contract rights. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009ERK"</field>N-PCL &s;§714(b).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C7WG"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00F11C"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>566 to 568</trace>


<trace>30:131.50. Resignation of officers</trace>

<trace>Any officer may resign at any time by giving written notice to the Chairperson or the <finstr>[title of other officer]</finstr> . Any such resignation will take effect at the time specified therein or, if  no time be specified, then upon delivery.</trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace>Research References</trace>

30:132. Vacancies

(5) Governing Committee
30:133. Powers and duties of governing committee
COL
NFP
CLS
FCV
FTR
TEM
MTD
►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55b78801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>GOVERNING COMMITTEE 
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee consists of [number of members] members of the Club and is divided into [number of classes] equal classes, and the terms of office of those constituting the oldest class expire on the second [name of month] of each [identification of year] or when their successors are elected.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee is entitled to fill all vacancies in the Committee until the next annual election.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>At each annual meeting of the Club, or at an adjourned annual meeting of the Club, there shall be elected to the Governing Committee [number of members] members to replace the out-going class, who shall hold office for [number of years] years, and any further members necessary to fill vacancies in unexpired terms, who shall hold office until the end of those terms.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>At the monthly meeting of the Governing Committee held in [name of month] in each year, the President shall, with the approval of the Governing Committee, appoint a Committee of [number of members] members of which [number of members] may be a member of the Governing Nominating Committee, to nominate candidates for election to the Governing Committee at the next annual meeting of the Club. The Nominating Committee shall post its nominations on the bulletin board in the Office of the Club at least [number of days] days before the date of the annual meeting. Other nominations may be made on the petition of not less than [number of members] members, and these other nominations shall be posted on the bulletin board in the Office of the Club at least [number of days] days before the annual meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The election of members of the Governing Committee is held by ballot, and for that purpose, the polls are open from [time of opening] to [time of closing] on the day of the annual meeting. The President shall appoint [number of inspectors] inspectors of election who shall receive and canvass the ballots and certify the result to the Secretary. The candidates receiving the largest number of votes up to the number of candidates required to fill vacancies in the outgoing and any other class are elected. In case the certificate of the inspectors shows that all the vacancies in the Governing Committee have not been filled at the election, the meeting shall be adjourned for [number of weeks] weeks at which adjourned meeting the election to fill those vacancies shall proceed as in this Constitution provided.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>Any member of the Governing Committee who is absent from [number of regular meetings] consecutive regular meetings, unless he or she previously obtained permission from the Committee or presents at the next regular meeting an excuse for his or her absence satisfactory to the Committee, will be removed from the Committee and ceases to be a member of the Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee shall meet once a month except during the months of [names of months]. Special meetings may be called by order of the President or of the House Committee or at the request of [number of members] members of the Governing Committee. A majority of its members constitutes a quorum of the Governing Committee at its meetings.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee of the Club shall present at the annual meeting of the members a report, verified by the President and Treasurer, or by a majority of the Governing Committee, showing the whole amount of real and personal property owned by it, where the property is located, and where and how it is invested, the amount and nature of the property acquired during the year immediately preceding the date of the report, and the manner of the acquisition, the amount applied, appropriated, or expended during the year immediately preceding the date of the report, and the purposes, objects, or persons to or for which applications, appropriations, or expenditures have been made, and the names and places of residence of the persons who have been admitted to membership during the year. This report shall be filed with the records of the association and an abstract of the report shall be entered in the minutes of the proceedings of the annual meeting at which the report is presented.
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>POWERS OF THE GOVERNING COMMITTEE
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee has general charge, control, and management of the affairs, funds, and property of the Club. It is entitled and shall carry out the purposes of the Club according to law and as provided in this Constitution, and, specifically, it is entitled to construe this Constitution and sole power to authorize the borrowing or investing of money on behalf of and for the purposes of the Club and to authorize and direct the execution of any documents necessary to that end.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee shall elect annually from its own body the officers as provided in Article [designation of article], Section [number of section].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The Governing Committee shall appoint annually the following Committees:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>A House Committee of [number of members] members, at least [number of members] members of whom, including the Chairperson, must be members of the Governing Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>A Library Committee of [number of members] members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>An Art Committee of [number of members] members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>A Squash Committee of [number of members] members.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>Any other committees as the Governing Committee may, from time to time, in its discretion, deem advisable.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>Without in any way limiting the general powers of the Governing Committee, the Committee's powers include the following power and authority:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>A. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To admit rules for their own government.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>B. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To admit members and to expel or to suspend them by ballot; a two-thirds vote of the entire Governing Committee expelling, and a majority vote of those present at a meeting suspending.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>C. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To prescribe rules for the admission of strangers.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>D. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To prescribe rules for the use of the Club by the members and for their conduct in the Club House.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>E. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To fix penalties for violation of the rules and to enforce the same.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>F. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To expel, suspend, or otherwise discipline a member for cause, including any conduct which in the opinion of the Governing Committee is improper and prejudicial to the Club. Any action under this section may be revoked or modified by subsequent vote of the Governing Committee.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>G. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To remit penalties and to suspend the operation of the penalties provided in Article [designation of article] by extending the time within which a member's indebtedness must be paid.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>H. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To call special meetings of the Club, the purposes of which shall be stated in the call for the meeting.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>I. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To fix from time to time initiation fees and dues.
►<field>fi.lvl="3"</field>J. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>To alter or rescind any rule.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field>The &ldquo;“Governing Committee&rdquo;” is in effect the board of directors of this club.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"</field><trace> The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace> To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SSWU"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I05OL7I"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05KDI6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace>592 to 594</trace>
(6) Adoption of Bylaws
30:134. Resolution adopting bylaws-- By directors
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55bedb01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"</field>No bylaws having been adopted governing the conduct of the internal affairs of this club, and the set of bylaws presented to this meeting being suitable for the purpose and their adoption being in the best interests of the club,
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"</field>It is therefore resolved on this [date of resolution], that the bylaws presented to this meeting become the bylaws of this club effective immediately.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"</field>It is further resolved that the bylaws be authenticated as such by the certificate of the secretary of this club and placed in the club's minute book. It is further resolved that a full and true copy of the bylaws, certified by the secretary, be kept at the principal office of the club for inspection by shareholders at all reasonable times during business hours.

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"</field>The initial bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting and, if no so adopted by the incorporators, by the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F174"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(a). The power to alter, amend or repeal the bylaws or to adopt new bylaws is vested in the members and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, also in the board of directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HUC0"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"</field>For purposes of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the initial bylaws of a corporation adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting (or by the board if not so adopted by the incorporators) will be deemed to have been adopted by the members. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LSJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(a).

30:136. Certificate of adoption of bylaws
FMS

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55c62e01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|145|30:136"</field>I, the undersigned, do certify:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|145|30:136"</field>I am the elected and acting [secretary/assistant secretary] of [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|145|30:136"</field>The foregoing bylaws, comprising [number of pages] pages, constitute [the original bylaws of the club as adopted at the organization meeting of the incorporators/a copy of the bylaws of the club as amended at the] meeting of the [members/board of directors] of the club, held on [date of meeting] at the club's principal office, located at [office address of club], [name of city], [name of county], State of New York.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|145|30:136"</field>In witness whereof, I have subscribed my name [OPTIONAL: and affixed the corporate seal of the club] this [ordinal number of day] day of [name of month] [identification of year].
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[[Name of secretary]/[Name <trace.deleted/><trace>of assistant</trace> secretary]]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Secretary/Assistant Secretary]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|145|30:136"</field>The initial bylaws of a not-for-profit corporation may be adopted by its incorporators at the organization meeting and, if not so adopted by the incorporators, by its board of directors. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LTR"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(a). Subject to the statutory provision governing limitations on the right to vote (►<field>st.ref.id="I009EYN"</field>N-PCL &s;§612) additional bylaws may be adopted by the members of a not-for-profit corporation at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors. In addition, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, new bylaws may be adopted by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C83J"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(b).

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55c89f01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>CERTIFICATE OF ADOPTION OF BYLAWS 
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|146|30:137"</field>I do hereby certify that the above stated Bylaws of [name of corporation] were approved by [name of corporation]'s membership on [date of approval] and constitute a complete copy of the Bylaws of the corporation.
