Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|146|30:137"</field>The initial bylaws of a not-for-profit corporation may be adopted by its incorporators at the organization meeting and, if not so adopted by the incorporators, by its board of directors. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HUDD"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(a). Subject to the statutory provision governing limitations on the right to vote (►<field>st.ref.id="I006LZH"</field>N-PCL &s;§612) additional bylaws may be adopted by the members of a not-for-profit corporation at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors. In addition, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, new bylaws may be adopted by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009F4D"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(b).
 <trace.deleted/>
<trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00HUJ1"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00KNNX"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;<trace.deleted/><trace>§118</trace>


<trace>30:137.50. Certificate of adoption of bylaws-- By initial board of directors</trace>

<trace>CERTIFICATE OF ADOPTION OF BYLAWS</trace>

<trace><p> We, the undersigned, are all of the initial directors or incorporators of this corporation, and we consent to, and hereby do, adopt the foregoing Bylaws, consisting of <finstr>[text number of pages]</finstr> (<finstr>[number of pages]</finstr>) pages as the Bylaws of this corporation.</trace>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|147|30:138"</field>The initial bylaws of a not-for-profit corporation may be adopted by its incorporators at the organization meeting and, if not so adopted by the incorporators, by its board of directors. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006LZJ"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(a). Subject to the statutory provision governing limitations on the right to vote (►<field>st.ref.id="I009F4F"</field>N-PCL &s;§612) additional bylaws may be adopted by the members of a not-for-profit corporation at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors. ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55cd8101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>CERTIFICATION 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|148|30:139"</field>I, [name of certifying officer], certify that I am the [President/Secretary] of [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation. In my capacity as [President/Secretary] I have access to the corporate documents and records of [name of corporation]. I certify that the attached document is a complete and correct copy of the bylaws of the corporation as they are in effect on this date. More specifically, this instrument is to certify that the attached document, consisting of [number of pages] pages, is a true and correct copy of the bylaws of [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation. It is further certified that the foregoing is a conformed copy that agrees with the original document and all amendments to the original. Additionally, it is certified that the attached bylaws are in full force and effect and have not been amended or modified subsequent to the date of their adoption.

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|148|30:139"</field>The initial bylaws of a not-for-profit corporation may be adopted by its incorporators at the organization meeting and, if not so adopted by the incorporators, by its board of directors. Subject to the statutory provision governing limitations on the right to vote (►<field>st.ref.id="I00C89D"</field>N-PCL &s;§612) additional bylaws may be adopted by the members of a not-for-profit corporation at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors. Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|149|30:140"</field>After the corporate existence has begun, an organization meeting of the initial directors or if directors are not designated in the certificate of incorporation, of the incorporator or incorporators, must be held. The minimum agenda of the organization meeting is set by statute. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006M0W"</field>N-PCL &s;§405(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|149|30:140"</field><trace>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee.</trace>. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009F5S"</field>N-PCL &s;§708(b).

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55dc2701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>The undersigned, being the Directors of [name of corporation] (the &ldquo;“Corporation&rdquo;”), a [name of state] nonprofit corporation, hereby adopt the following resolutions by unanimous written consent:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the Certificate of Incorporation of the Corporation filed on [date of filing] with the [name of state] Department of State, and it hereby is, ratified and approved in all respects;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the Bylaws of the Corporation attached hereto as Exhibit [designation of exhibit], including the Conflict of Interest Policy attached as Exhibit [designation of exhibit] to the Bylaws, are hereby approved and adopted in all respects as the bylaws of the Corporation;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that each of the officers and directors of the Corporation shall be provided with a copy of the Conflict of Interest Policy and required to execute and date a Conflict of Interest Statement and return such signed copy to the Secretary of the Corporation;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the number of Directors constituting the entire Board of Directors of the Corporation shall be [number of directors] directors;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the following persons be, and they hereby are, nominated and elected as members of the Board of Directors of the Corporation, to serve in accordance with the Bylaws of the Corporation until their respective successors are elected and qualified: [list of directors];
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the following persons be, and they hereby are, elected to the offices of the Corporation set forth opposite their respective names, to serve in accordance with the Bylaws of the Corporation, and at the discretion of the Board of Directors, until their respective successors are elected and qualified: [list of names] and [list of offices];
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that for the purpose of authorizing the Corporation to carry on its exempt purpose under the laws of any state as to which the officers of the Corporation determine such authorization is necessary or desirable, the officers of the Corporation be, and they hereby are, authorized in the name and on behalf of the Corporation to take such action as may be necessary or advisable to effect the qualification of the Corporation to carry on its exempt purpose as a foreign corporation in such state or states;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of the Corporation be, and they hereby are, authorized to (1) designate the bank or banks in which the funds of the Corporation shall be deposited, (2) take such steps as are necessary in order to open such accounts, (3) cause to be deposited in such accounts from time to time such funds of the Corporation as the officers may deem necessary or advisable, and (4) designate from time to time officers and agents of the Corporation authorized to sign or countersign checks, drafts or other orders for the payment of money issued in the name of the Corporation against any such account;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of the Corporation be, and they hereby are, authorized to pay all fees and expenses incident to and necessary for the organization and qualification of the Corporation, and to reimburse any person who has made any disbursements therefor, out of the funds of the Corporation;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of the Corporation be, and they hereby are, authorized to execute and file for, in the name of and on behalf of the Corporation, any and all documents, certificates and instruments necessary to obtain and evidence exemptions for the corporation from federal and New York income tax and any other tax deemed appropriate by such officer or officers;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of the Corporation be, and they hereby are, delegated the power to accept, on behalf of the Corporation, any contribution, gift, bequest or devise, whether outright or in trust, as a current or future interest, as real or personal property, or as tangible or intangible property, for the general purposes or any special purpose of the Corporation upon such terms and conditions as such officer(s) determine are necessary or appropriate;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of the Corporation be, and they hereby are, granted full power and authority to execute and deliver all such instruments, agreements, and documents, to pay all such fees and expenses, and to perform such other acts as such officer may determine to be necessary or convenient, and in the best interests of the Corporation, from time to time hereafter, to carry on the affairs of the Corporation, with the power of delegation, all in the name of the Corporation and on the Corporation's behalf and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>RESOLVED, that any of the officers of the Corporation be, and each of them hereby is authorized, empowered and directed, in the name and on behalf of the Corporation to (1) do all such acts and things; (2) execute, deliver and file, such agreements, certificates, instruments and other documents; (3) make such changes to any of the foregoing; and (4) pay such fees and expenses, in each case as may be necessary or desirable in order to carry out the foregoing resolutions, and that all of the acts and doings of such officers and directors, whether heretofore or hereafter taken, done or performed in furtherance of the above resolutions, are hereby ratified, approved, confirmed and authorized.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>This Consent may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original but all of which together will constitute one and the same instrument. Electronic, photocopied, scanned or faxed signatures shall be treated as original signatures and shall be binding upon the signer.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|150|30:141"</field>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned have signed this Consent the [ordinal number of day] day of [name of month] [identification of year].

30:142. Minutes of directors' organization meeting
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55e10901b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Pursuant to [notice/call and waiver of notice], the board of directors of [name of club], elected [at the first meeting of the membership held on [date of first meeting]/by unanimous written consent of the members in lieu of a meeting], assembled and held its first meeting at [address of club], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], on [date of first meeting], at [time of first meeting].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Present at the meeting were [names of all directors present], being all of the directors.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>[Name of temporary party] called the meeting to order and, on motion duly made and seconded, was appointed temporary [chairperson/[title of entity]]; [name of temporary secretary] was appointed temporary secretary.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>The election of officers was thereupon declared in order, and the following were duly elected: [name of President], President; [name of Vice President], Vice President; [name of secretary], secretary; and [name of treasurer], treasurer. [Name of President] took the chair and presided at the meeting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>The [chairperson/[title of entity]] then announced that the certificate of incorporation had been duly filed with the Department of State on [date of filing certificate of incorporation]. The secretary was instructed to cause a copy of the certificate of incorporation to be inserted in the front of the minute and bylaw book of the club.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>The secretary then presented a proposed form of bylaws for the club, which were read and considered, section by section. On motion duly made, seconded, and carried, it was
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Resolved, that the bylaws submitted by the secretary and read to this meeting are hereby adopted as the bylaws of the club, and the secretary is hereby instructed to certify two copies of the bylaws, one copy to be inserted in the minute book, the other to be kept at the principal office of the club and to be open to inspection by members at all reasonable times during office hours.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>On motion duly made, seconded, and carried, it was
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Resolved, that the form of corporate seal, conforming to the provisions of the bylaws, and making the following impression, is adopted as the seal of the club:
►<field>fac.lo="n"</field>[Seal]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>The secretary was authorized and directed to procure all appropriate corporate books.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>On motion duly made, seconded, and carried, it was
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Resolved, that [name of bank] is hereby selected as a depository for the monies, funds, and credit of the club, and that [names of employees], or any two of them, are authorized and empowered to draw checks (including checks payable to their own order or to bearer) on the above depository against the account of the club, and to endorse in the name of the club and receive payment of all checks, drafts, and commercial paper payable to the club either as payee or as endorsee;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Further resolved, that the authority hereby conferred shall remain in full force and effect until revoked, and until a formal written notice of revocation has been given to and received by [name of bank];
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Further resolved, that the certification of the secretary of the club as to the appointment of persons authorized as signatories of the club shall be binding on the club;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Further resolved, that the secretary of the club is hereby authorized and directed to deliver to [name of bank] a copy of these resolutions properly certified by [him/her].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>On motion duly made, seconded, and carried, it was
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>Resolved, that the principal office of the club for the transaction of business is hereby fixed at [office address of club], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>There being no further business, the meeting was adjourned.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of minutes]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of secretary]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|151|30:142"</field>The above minutes are intended as an outline of a meeting of newly elected directors following the annual meeting of the membership. It is assumed that the power to alter, amend, or repeal bylaws or to adopt new bylaws of this particular corporation rests with the board of directors as well as with the members, as is permitted by ►<field>st.ref.id="I006M6O"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(b). If the members have exclusive power in this area, the minutes will have to be altered accordingly.

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|153|30:144"</field>Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8GJ"</field>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &s;§711(a). Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director, nor to any director who submits a signed waiver of notice whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director.<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|153|30:144"</field>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board unless required by the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HUQB"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(b).

30:145. Resolution to adopt whistleblowers' policy
FMS

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55e85c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, [name of corporation] is committed to upholding the highest standards of ethical, moral and legal business conduct, and to transparency through open communication, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, trustees, officers, employees and volunteers of [name of corporation] are required to comply with applicable federal, state and local laws, and must faithfully implement and adhere to [name of corporation]'s own policies and procedures in conducting their duties and responsibilities, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, in accordance with the New York State Non-Profit Revitalization Act of 2013 (&ldquo;“the Act&rdquo;”), [name of corporation] must adopt a Whistleblower Policy to protect from retaliation persons who report suspected improper conduct, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, this provides an avenue for trustees, officers, employees and volunteers of [name of corporation] to report any suspected or actual conduct contrary to these standards without the fear of intimidation, harassment, discrimination or retaliation, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, this policy contains procedures for oversight, reporting, handling and investigating allegations of improper conduct as required under the Act, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, the [name of committee] Committee shall oversee the Whistleblower Policy, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, this policy document has been reviewed and approved by [name of corporation]'s legal counsel, and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>WHEREAS, the [name of committee] Committee has reviewed this policy and recommends it for approval by the Board, now, therefore, be it
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>RESOLVED, that the Board of Trustees of [name of corporation] adopts the proposed Whistleblower Policy, and be it finally
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|154|30:145"</field>RESOLVED, that copies of this adopted policy shall apply to and be distributed to trustees, officers, employees and volunteers of [name of corporation] at the time of appointment or hiring, and annually thereafter.

30:146. Resolution to adopt conflict of interest policy
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55eacd01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>WHEREAS, the Corporation is a New York not-for-profit corporation subject to the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>WHEREAS, the Nonprofit Revitalization Act, which was signed into law on December 18, 2013, made several changes to the provisions of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law that govern how not-for-profit corporations address scenarios that pose a conflict of interest; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>WHEREAS, in light of the foregoing, the Board wishes to amend its Policy on Conflict of Interest and Disclosure to reflect the changes of the Nonprofit Revitalization Act;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>NOW THEREFORE, it is hereby
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>RESOLVED, that the Amended and Restated Policy on Conflict of Interest and Disclosure in the form attached hereto as Exhibit [designation of exhibit] be, and hereby is, approved, ratified and adopted as and for the Policy on Conflict of Interest and Disclosure of the Corporation (the &ldquo;“Conflict of Interest Policy&rdquo;”), and that the Secretary of the Corporation be, and hereby is, instructed to file a copy of such Conflict of Interest Policy in the Corporation's minute book; and it is further
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of the Corporation be, and each of them hereby is, authorized and directed to take any and all further action and to execute, deliver and file any and all instruments and documents in the name and on behalf of the Corporation, and to pay any and all fees and expenses, as in his or her judgment may be necessary or advisable in order to carry out the intent and purpose of the foregoing resolutions.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|155|30:146"</field>For a discussion of the requirement to adopt a conflict of interest policy, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I006M81"</field>&s;§30:50.

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55ed3e01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>I, [[name of officer]/[name of director]/[name of key employee]] of [name of corporation], acknowledge the following:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>I have received a copy of the Conflict of Interest Policy of [name of corporation], adopted as Exhibit [designation of exhibit] to [name of corporation]'s Bylaws on [date of adoption];
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>I have read and understand the Policy and agree to comply with the Policy;
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>I will disclose any potential conflicts, other than those stated below, as they may arise before completion of my next conflict of interest statement; and
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>I understand that [name of corporation] is a charitable organization and in order to maintain its federal tax exemption it must engage primarily in activities which accomplish one or more of its tax-exempt purposes.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>5. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>I am an officer, director, trustee, member, owner (either as a sole proprietor or a partner), or employee of the following entities with which [name of corporation] has a relationship: [None/[identification of entities and statement of interest]].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>6. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>A relative of mine is an officer, director, trustee, member, owner (either as a sole proprietor or a partner), or employee of the following entities with which [name of corporation] has a relationship: [None/[identification of entities and statement of interest]].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>7. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>[Name of corporation] is a party to the following potential or pending transactions in which I have a direct or indirect interest: [None/[description of transactions]].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>8. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>[Name of corporation] is a party to the following potential or pending transactions in which a relative of mine has a direct or indirect interest: [None/[description of transactions]].
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of signature]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[[Name of officer]/[Name of<trace> </trace>director]/[Name of key employee]]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>The conflict of interest policy must require that prior to the initial election of any director, and annually thereafter, such director must complete, sign and submit to the secretary of the corporation or a designated compliance officer a written statement identifying, to the best of the director's knowledge, any entity of which such director is an officer, director, trustee, member, owner (either as a sole proprietor or a partner), or employee and with which the corporation has a relationship, and any transaction in which the corporation is a participant and in which the director might have a conflicting interest. The policy must require that each director annually resubmit such written statement. The secretary of the corporation or the designated compliance officer must provide a copy of all completed statements to the chair of the audit committee or, if there is no audit committee, to the chair of the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SS1K"</field>N-PCL &s;§715-a(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>For a discussion of the requirement to adopt a conflict of interest policy, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05OKC8"</field>&s;§30:50.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|156|30:147"</field>►<field>cc.ref.id="I00C8HV"</field>Ferris v. Lustgarten Foundation, 189 A.D.3d 1002, 138 N.Y.S.3d 517 (2d Dep't 2020) stating that the statute governing whistleblower policy of not-for-profit corporations created private right of action for employees who were retaliated against or subject to adverse employment consequences as a result of whistleblowing activities, where the statute was intended to protect employees who reported suspect actions of corporations in good faith, the legislative purpose was promoted by holding corporations accountable for retaliation against whistleblowers, and there was no regulatory agency to enforce a not-for-profit corporation's compliance with the statute.
<trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006MDR"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499

<trace>30:147.40. Resolution designating deposit ory</trace>

<trace>RESOLVED, that <finstr>[name of depository]</finstr> is designated as depository of <finstr>[name of corporation]</finstr> and that funds of <finstr>[name of corporation]</finstr> deposited in <finstr>[name of depository]</finstr> be subject to withdrawal upon checks, notes, drafts, bills of exchange, acceptances, undertakings of other orders for the payment of money when signed on behalf of <finstr>[name of corporation]</finstr> by <finstr>[number of officers]</finstr> of the following officers: <finstr>[names and titles of officers]</finstr></trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace>►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C8NJ"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425</trace>


<trace>30:147.50. Resolution approving financial report</trace>

<trace>RESOLVED, that the financial statements for the fiscal year ended <finstr>[end date of fiscal year]</finstr> , as present ed to the meeting, are accepted by the Member s as the Annual Report of Directors under Section 519 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</trace>

<trace>Notes to Form</trace>
<trace> The board must present at the annual meeting of members a report, verified by the president and treasurer or by a majority of the directors, or certified by an independent public or certified public accountant or a firm of such accountants selected by the board, showing in appropriate detail the following:</trace>
<trace>(1) The assets and liabilities, including the trust funds, of the corporation as of the end of a 12 month fiscal period terminating not more than six months prior to said meeting.</trace>
<trace>(2) The principal changes in assets and liabilities, including trust funds, during said fiscal period.</trace>
<trace>(3) The revenue or receipts of the corporation, both unrestricted and restricted to particular purposes during said fiscal period.</trace>
<trace>(4) The expenses or disbursements of the corporation, for both general and restricted purposes, during said fiscal period.</trace>
<trace>(5) The number of members of the corporation as of the date of the report, together with a statement of increase or decrease in such number during said fiscal period, and a statement of the place where the names and places of residence of the current members may be found.</trace>
<trace>The annual report of directors must be filed with the records of the corporation and either a copy or an abstract thereof entered in the minutes of the proceedings of the annual meeting of members. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FIN"</field>N-PCL &s;§519.</trace>


<trace>Research References</trace>
<trace>►<field>tk.ref.id="I00C8NJ"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</trace>

30:149. Resolution setting salaries of officers

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55f49101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|158|30:149"</field>Resolved, that the salary of the President of the club for services rendered to the club as President shall be $[dollar amount of salary] for [fiscal/calendar] year [identification of year], payable in such manner and at such times as the board shall direct;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|158|30:149"</field>Further resolved, that the salaries of the [titles of officers] of the club for services rendered to the club as [title of officer] shall be $[dollar amount of salary] for the [fiscal/calendar] year [identification of year], payable in such manner and at such times as the board shall direct;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|158|30:149"</field>Further resolved, that the salary of the treasurer of the club for services rendered to the club as treasurer shall be $[dollar amount of salary] for [fiscal/calendar] year [identification of year], payable in such manner and at such times as the board shall direct.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|158|30:149"</field>[Titles of other corporate officers and their respective salaries].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|158|30:149"</field>A not-for-profit corporation is permitted to pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8NL"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).

 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00F1SH"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390

 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006MDW"</field>Test in stockholders' actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358

<trace>30:149. 50. Resolution authorizing compensation of officers</trace>

<trace>WHEREAS some of the offices held by officers of <finstr>[name of corporation]</finstr> require substantial time commitment, on the order of hundreds of hours per year,</trace>
<trace>WHEREAS the ongoing and timely performance of these officers is critical to the continued existence of <finstr>[name of corporation]</finstr>, </trace>
<trace>NOW THEREFORE, it is hereby</trace>
<trace>RESOLVED, that effective <finstr>[specification of effective date]</finstr>, the following officers of the corporation will receive compensation, paid <finstr>[specification of time period]</finstr>: <finstr>[list of titles of offices and dollar amounts of compensation]</finstr></trace>
<trace>Notes to Form</trace>

<trace> ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|158|30:149"</field>A not-for-profit corporation is permitted to pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8NL"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).</trace>

30:150. Minutes of annual members' meeting; election of directors

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id55f70201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>MINUTES OF ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP MEETINGOF [NAME OF CLUB] 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The annual meeting of the members of [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation, was held at [address of corporation], [name of city], [name of county], New York, on [date of annual meeting], at [time of annual meeting], for the purpose of electing a board of directors to serve for the ensuing year, considering reports of the affairs of the club, and transacting such other business as might come before the meeting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>[The members entitled to vote who were present were as follows: [names of members]/There were present [number of members] members entitled to vote].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The total number of members entitled to vote being [total number of members], it was announced that a quorum was present for the transaction of business.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The President, [name of president], called the meeting to order and presided during its deliberations, and [name of secretary] acted as secretary of the meeting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The secretary certified that the meeting had been duly called, in accordance with the terms of the bylaws of the club, under and by means of a notice, duly mailed in writing to the members of the club, in the manner provided for by the bylaws. A copy of the notice immediately precedes the minutes of this meeting in the book of minutes of this club.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>[No objection being made, reading of the minutes of the last meeting of the members was dispensed with and, on motion duly made, seconded, and carried, the same were unanimously approved without reading/The secretary, on request, read the minutes of the annual meeting of the members of the company, held on [date of annual meeting], and they were on motion duly made, seconded, passed, and approved as read].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The secretary of the meeting then read the annual report of the [board of directors/President] of the club, together with the statement of income or profit and loss and the balance sheet of the club for the year ending [identification of year], which are attached. After due discussion, it was moved, seconded, and unanimously carried that the annual report of the [board of directors/President] be accepted and filed, and the statement of income or profit and loss and balance sheets, as submitted with such report, on motion duly made, seconded, and carried, were unanimously accepted. They are attached, following these minutes.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The President stated that the next business before the meeting was the election of a board of directors to serve for the ensuing year and called attention to the possibility of electing the directors by cumulative voting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>[OPTIONAL: The following were then nominated for the office of directors: [names of nominees]. There being no further nominations, nominations were closed. On motion duly made, seconded, and unanimously carried, the secretary was instructed to cast the ballots of all present and represented, in favor of the above candidates, allotting an equal number of the votes cast to each of them. The votes having been so cast, the following persons were declared to be the duly elected directors of the club for the ensuing year, or until the election and qualification of their successors: [names of elected directors].]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>[Description of proceedings concerning transaction of other business that came before meeting].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>There being no further business to transact, the meeting was adjourned.
 ►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Name of corporation]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>By:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of authorized representative]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of authorized representative]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Attested:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of secretary]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Corporate seal]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>[OPTIONAL: The following members or persons entitled to vote waive any deficiency of notice, consent to the holding of the meeting, approve the above minutes, and ratify and affirm all actions taken at the meeting: [names of members or persons entitled to vote].]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The first optional clause is applicable if a slate of candidates is elected without opposition.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>The second optional clause can be inserted in the minutes of small incorporated clubs or associations.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MDY"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|159|30:150"</field>At each election for directors, each member may, if provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, cumulate his or her votes and give one candidate a number of votes equal to the number of directors to be elected multiplied by the number of votes to which the member is entitled, or he or she may distribute the votes on the same principle among as many candidates as he or she sees fit. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SRNK"</field>N-PCL &s;§617.

 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I05OJY8"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3409

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>Present-- [number of members] members.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of nominee], Nominee, is nominated to succeed [name of corporate officer], who after an urgent appeal has declared [he/she] could serve no longer. All other candidates are renominated.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of person] was recognized by the Chair. [He/She] spoke as follows: [recitation of words of person].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of President], President, asked that [citation of bylaw] of the existing bylaws be read. They are as follows: [recitation of bylaws].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of executive secretary], Executive Secretary, then presented and moved for adoption the following proposed amendments to the bylaws of [name of corporation]. They are as follows:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Recitation of proposed amendments].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion by [name of movant 1], seconded by [name of seconding party 1], and carried it was
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>Resolved that the amendments to the bylaws proposed by [name of executive secretary], Executive Secretary, with the exception of [specification of exception], are adopted.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>The Chair called for a vote by the showing of hands and the resolution was unanimously carried.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of movant 2] then moved for the adoption of the following amendment to the bylaws: [specification of amendment].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion by [name of movant 3], seconded by [name of seconding party 2] and carried unanimously, it was
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>Resolved, that the above amendment be adopted.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of offeror] then offered [his/her] proposed [specification of proposal] of the bylaws as originally read.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Name of movant 4] offered an amendment to [accept a vote by a written signature proxy/[specification of amendment]], and this was accepted by [name of acceptor].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion, duly made, seconded, and unanimously carried, it was [specification of discussion].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion by [name of movant 5], seconded by [name of seconding party 3], and carried, the following members of the corporation were placed in nomination for election as Trustees: [names of members nominated for election as trustees].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Recitation of discussion].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion by [name of movant 6], seconded by [name of seconding party 4], the report of the Treasurer was received with a rising vote of thanks.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion by [name of movant 7], seconded by [name of seconding party 5] and carried, the nominations were closed.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>On motion duly made, seconded, and carried, the nominees were unanimously elected.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>[Recitation of statement by new President].

►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of executive secretary]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MF6"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>At each election for directors, each member may, if provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, cumulate his or her votes and give one candidate a number of votes equal to the number of directors to be elected multiplied by the number of votes to which the member is entitled, or he or she may distribute the votes on the same principle among as many candidates as he or she sees fit. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FK2"</field>N-PCL &s;§617.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|160|30:151"</field>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed, and new bylaws may be made, by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SRC4"</field>N-PCL &s;§602.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I05OJMS"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3409

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|161|30:152"</field>[Name of chairperson] chaired the meeting, and [name of secretary] acted as secretary.

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|161|30:152"</field>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SRBY"</field>N-PCL &s;§603(c).

30:153. Resolution levying assessment

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5600c601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|162|30:153"</field>Resolved by the directors of [name of club] that a special assessment shall be levied on the members of such club in the amount of $[dollar amount of assessment per member] per member.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|162|30:153"</field>The secretary of [name of club] is directed to notify the members of this assessment. Such assessment shall be due and payable [number of days] days after notification by the secretary.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|162|30:153"</field>Initiation fees, dues, or assessments may be levied on all classes of members alike or in different amounts or proportions for different classes of members, as the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, but in all cases the fees, dues, and assessments payable by members of one class shall be determined upon the same basis. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SRBU"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(b).

<trace>30:153.60. Resolution appointing committee chairs</trace>

<trace>RESOLVED, that the following persons are appointed to serve as the chair of the committees set forth next to their names until their respective successors are appointed or until their earlier resignations: <finstr>[names of chairs and committees]</finstr></trace>

<trace>30:153. 7 0. Resolution appointing committee members</trace>

<trace>RESOLVED, that <finstr>[names of members]</finstr> are appointed as members of the <finstr>[name of committee 1]</finstr> committee, all until their respective successors are appointed or until their earlier resignations.</trace>
<trace>RESOLVED, that <finstr>[names of members]</finstr> are appointed as members of the <finstr>[name of committee 2]</finstr> committee, all until their respective successors are appointed or until their earlier resignations.</trace>
<trace>RESOLVED, that <finstr>[names of members]</finstr> are appointed as members of the <finstr>[name of committee 3]</finstr> committee, all until their respective successors are appointed or until their earlier resignations.</trace>

30:154. Resolution by directors delegating authority to executive committee
FMS

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56033701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|164|30:154"</field>[Recitation of bylaws providing for appointment of executive committee and that such appointment is desirable];
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|164|30:154"</field>Resolved that [names of directors] constitute an executive committee of this board to manage the affairs of this club as if a full quorum of this board were so acting and that [specification of procedure of meeting].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|164|30:154"</field><trace> The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. </trace>To the extent provided in the resolution, in the certificate of incorporation, or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F1ZP"</field>N-PCL &s;§712(a).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00HV4L"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006MM6"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace>592 to 594</trace>

<trace>30:154.50. Resolution ratifying actions by the board</trace>

<trace>RESOLVED, that any and all actions heretofore taken by the directors or officers of the Corporation, for and on behalf of the Corporation, are hereby ratified, confirmed , and approved in their entirety, and it is further;</trace>
<trace>RESOLVED, that the directors and officers of the Corporation be, and the same hereby are, authorized, empowered , and directed to do all things and acts and to execute all documents as may be necessary or advisable and properly carry on the business of the Corporation.</trace>

►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.morerows="3"</field><field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>To:<trace> [name of governing body]</trace>

►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>[address of governing body]




►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>[name of city], [name of county],




►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>State of New York




 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|165|30:155"</field>I, [name of member], a member of [name of organization], allege that there is reasonable cause to believe that [name of accused member], a member of this organization, has [description of accused member's actions], in violation of [specification of rule alleged to be violated].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|165|30:155"</field>Demand is made that appropriate hearing and notice of such hearing be afforded to [name of accused member] and that [title of entity], after such hearing, fine, suspend, or expel [name of accused member] or take such other action with respect to the matter as [title of entity] may deem proper.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of complaint]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of member]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|165|30:155"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FR2"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C8VY"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c); see also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00F20U"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011) holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MM9"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009FR5"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3404
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C8W1"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>831 to 834</trace>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|166|30:156"</field>[Name of accused member] is [suspended from membership in [name of corporation] from [begin date of suspension] until [end date of suspension]/expelled from membership in [name of corporation] effective [effective date of expulsion]].

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|166|30:156"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F20X"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00HV5T"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I05SR94"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FR7"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id560cfb01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|167|30:157"</field>It appearing that [name of member], a member of [name of corporation], has not paid [the annual dues/a duly levied assessment], due and payable effective [effective date of payment], and that [name of member] has remained in default since that date, and, the secretary having notified [name of member] on [date of notification] of the default, and that membership would be subject to forfeiture if the sum was not paid by [due date of payment];
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|167|30:157"</field>It is therefore resolved, pursuant to Article [designation of article], Section [number of section], of the [Certificate of Incorporation/Bylaws] of this club, that all rights of membership of [name of member] and any rights or interest of [name of member] in the property of the club are forfeited for nonpayment of [dues/the assessment].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|167|30:157"</field>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MRY"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I009FWU"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C91Q"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.

b. Meetings; Calls and Notices
30:158. Call and waiver of notice of directors' organization meeting
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56144e01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|168|30:158"</field>We, the undersigned, being all of the directors of [name of club], hereby call the first meeting of the board of directors of such club, to be held at [address of club], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], on [date of first meeting], at [time of first meeting], and by this call waive any and all requirements as to notice of the time, place, and purposes of such meeting and consent that the meeting be held at the time and place set forth above for the purpose of transacting any business whatsoever that may be brought before the meeting, including without limitation, the adoption of bylaws, election of officers, and such other business as may come before the meeting.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Names of directors]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|168|30:158"</field>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MS1"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(a). Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice whether before or after the meeting or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior thereto or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009FWX"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(c). Consequently, careful note of the directors present at each meeting should be taken in the corporate minutes.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|168|30:158"</field>The first or organization meeting of the initial directors is to be held at the call of any director who must give at least five days' notice of such meeting by mail to each other director, which notice must set forth the time and place of the meeting. Notice need not be given to any director who submits a signed waiver of notice before or after the meeting or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to or at its commencement, the lack of notice to him or her. If there are more than two directors, a majority will constitute a quorum and the act of the majority will be the act of the directors. A director may act at an organization meeting by proxy or by an attorney-in-fact. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00C91T"</field>N-PCL &s;§405(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|168|30:158"</field>The minimum agenda for the organization is set by statute. It includes: (1) adopting bylaws; (2) electing directors to hold office as provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; and (3) transacting such other business as may come before the meeting. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00F26P"</field>N-PCL &s;§405(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|168|30:158"</field>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006MS3"</field>N-PCL &s;§711(b).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I009FWZ"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00C91V"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§60<trace>0</trace>

 ►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I01V1PY"</field>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field>Notice is hereby given that the annual meeting of members of [name of club] will be held at the office of the club, at [office address of club], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], on [date of annual meeting], at [time of annual meeting].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field>The purposes of the annual meeting are as follows:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field>To elect directors for the ensuing year;
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field>To receive and consider reports of the affairs of the club; and
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field>To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting.
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I006UOD"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|173|30:163"</field>For statutory provisions regarding fixing a record date for voting, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I009NT9"</field>N-PCL &s;§611.
<trace.deleted/>

 ►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I01WG37"</field>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|175|30:165"</field>A special meeting of the members of [name of club] will be held at the principal office of the club at [office address of club], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], on [date of special meeting], at [time of special meeting], for the purpose of [description of purpose]. [OPTIONAL: The close of business on [date of closing], has been fixed as the record date for determining members entitled to vote at such meeting, or any adjournment thereof.]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|175|30:165"</field>By order of the board of directors.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|175|30:165"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I006UOI"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|175|30:165"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009NTE"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.
<trace.deleted/>
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00I382"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3411
 For statutory provisions regarding fixing a record date for voting, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SB4M"</field>N-PCL &s;§611
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05O3FA"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>901 to 907</trace>

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|176|30:166"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail. </trace>
<trace.deleted/>►<field>st.ref.id="I05JVPY"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|176|30:166"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006UPQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|176|30:166"</field>In the absence of a provision fixing the number or proportion of members entitled to vote who are entitled to call a meeting, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|178|30:167"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006UPV"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(a).

30:168. Notice of assessment
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id562cb801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Letterhead of club]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>To all members:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|179|30:168"</field>Notice is given that, at a meeting of the board of directors held on [date of directors' meeting], an assessment of $[dollar amount of assessment per member] per member was levied on the membership of the club payable to the treasurer at the club's principal office at [office address of club], [name of city], [name of county], State of New York. This assessment becomes due and payable on [due date of payment]. An assessment on any member remaining unpaid at that time will result in the suspension of all membership privileges and rights and may result in termination of the membership under the provisions of the club bylaws.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|179|30:168"</field>Termination of membership may result for nonpayment of fees, dues, and assessments if provided for in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SAQQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I05O31E"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I05JVC2"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.

 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006UVL"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3404

 ►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I01Z984"</field>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|180|30:169"</field>Notice is given that [your annual dues/an assessment levied on you by [the board of directors/[title of entity]] on [date of levy]] of [$[dollar amount of dues]/$[dollar amount of assessment]] remains unpaid and has been overdue since [due date of payment]. In accordance with Article [designation of article], Section [number of section] of the [bylaws/[specification of other document]] of this organization, [you will be expelled from the organization unless the above amount is paid within [number of days] days from the date of this notice/you are hereby suspended from this organization until such time as the above amount is paid in full].

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|180|30:169"</field>Termination of membership may result for nonpayment of fees, dues, and assessments if provided for in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CH5D"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00FAA9"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I00I3F5"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006UVN"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3404
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009O0J"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>828, 829</trace>

 ►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I01ZASW"</field>
