►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.morerows="1"</field><field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>To:<trace> [name of member]</trace>

►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field><trace.deleted/>


►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>[address of member]




 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|181|30:170"</field>You are notified that a special meeting of the board of directors of [name of club] will be held at [address of club], [name of city], [name of county], State of New York, on [date of special meeting], at [time of special meeting], to consider the propriety of [expelling/suspending] you from membership in [name of club] for alleged violation by you of [specification of rule violated] as follows: [description of accused member's actions].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|181|30:170"</field>You are requested to attend the above meeting. You will be permitted to answer these charges, to present relevant evidence, and to oppose the proposal to [expel/suspend] you from membership.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|181|30:170"</field>[OPTIONAL: You are notified that should the above proceedings result in the termination of your membership in the club, all your rights as a member of the club, including any interest in its property, will thereby be terminated.]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|181|30:170"</field>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties, including termination of membership, upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CH5F"</field>N-PCL &s;§507(c). See also ►<field>cc.ref.id="I006UVQ"</field>Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep't 2011), holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation's bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with ►<field>st.ref.id="I009O0M"</field>N-PCL &s;§507 requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members' voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|183|30:172"</field>A certificate of change that changes only the address of the corporation's registered agent may be signed and delivered to the Department of State by the registered agent, instead of the corporation. The information required in such a certificate is somewhat different from the information required when filed by the corporation. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SANW"</field>N-PCL &s;§803-A(b).

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|184|30:173"</field>Please be advised that, pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I05FNJW"</field>Section 803-A of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, the undersigned, as registered agent for [name of corporation], will, not less than thirty (30) days from the date of this notice, file with the Department of State a certificate of change designating a new post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|184|30:173"</field>The certificate of change will set forth such new post office address as follows: [specification of new post office address], [name of city], [name of state], [zip code of new post office address].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|184|30:173"</field>The corporation has the right to object to the filing of the above-described certificate of change. Should this be the case, the corporation must notify the undersigned of the objection within the next thirty (30) days. If, within that time, the undersigned receives an objection from the corporation, the certificate of change will not be filed.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of registered agent]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|184|30:173"</field>Prior to filing with the Department of State a certificate of change that changes only the post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State, which certificate is signed and delivered to the Department of State by the registered agent, the agent must notify the corporation of the change and allow time for the corporation to object to it. The certificate of change filed by the registered agent must contain a statement that the agent has mailed a notice of the proposed change to the corporation not less than 30 days prior to the date of delivery to the Department of State and that the corporation has not objected to it. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006V2L"</field>N-PCL &s;§803-A(b).

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|185|30:174"</field>Please be advised that, pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAH9"</field>Section 803-A of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the undersigned, as registered agent for [name of corporation], will, not less than thirty (30) days from the date of this notice, file with the Department of State a certificate of change designating a new address for the undersigned.

The certificate of change filed by the registered agent must contain a statement that the agent has mailed a notice of the proposed change to the corporation not less than 30 days prior to the date of delivery to the Department of State, and that the corporation has not objected to it. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SACG"</field>N-PCL &s;§803-A(b).

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56452201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>ib.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|186|30:175"</field><field>ib.du="0"</field>►<field>im.format="pdf"</field><field>im.id="I02CB5N"</field>

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|186|30:175"</field>The above form, revised 3/17, is available from the New York State Department of State, ►<field>url.ref.id="I05FN8G"</field><url>http://www.dos.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|186|30:175"</field>The fee for filing a certificate of resignation, which is subject to change, is $30. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006V2Q"</field>N-PCL &s;§104-A(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|186|30:175"</field>The certificate of resignation must be signed by the registered agent and must contain the provisions set forth in the statute. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009O7M"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|186|30:175"</field>The designation of a registered agent will terminate 30 days after the filing by the Department of State of a certificate of resignation or a certificate containing a revocation or change of the designation, whichever is filed earlier. A certificate designating a new registered agent may be delivered to the Department of State by the corporation within such 30-day period or thereafter. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHCI"</field>N-PCL &s;§305(d).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00FAHE"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3451

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56479301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>ib.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|187|30:176"</field><field>ib.du="0"</field>►<field>im.format="pdf"</field><field>im.id="I03NOY9"</field>

 ►<field>image.link.href="./Images/NYLB 30 (revision copy)-Images.pdf"</field>Image #I03P34H goes here
►<field>im.format="tif"</field><field>im.id="I06AGWV"</field>
 ►<field>image.link.href="./Images/NYLB 30 (revision copy)-Images.pdf"</field>Image #I06AGWV goes here
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|187|30:176"</field>The above form, revised 1/23, is available from the New York State Department of State, ►<field>url.ref.id="I006V2S"</field><url>http://www.dos.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|187|30:176"</field>Corrections prior to filing by Department of State: Any certificate or other instrument relating to a domestic or foreign corporation submitted to the Department of State under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law may be corrected with respect to any typographical, or similar nonmaterial error apparent on the face of the certificate or instrument, prior to the filing of such certificate or instrument by the Department of State. Such correction will be effected by the Department of State upon authorization in writing by the incorporator in a form acceptable to the Department. Such authorization may be delivered by mail or sent by electronic mail to the Department. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009O7O"</field>N-PCL &s;§105(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|187|30:176"</field>Corrections following incorporation: Any certificate or other instrument relating to a domestic or foreign corporation filed by the Department of State under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law may be corrected with respect to any typographical or similar nonmaterial error apparent on the face or defect in the execution thereof including the deletion of any matter not permitted to be stated therein. A certificate, entitled &ldquo;“Certificate of correction of ____ (correct title of certificate and name of corporation)&rdquo;” must be signed and delivered to the Department of State by mail or electronic mail. It must set forth the name of the corporation, the date the certificate to be corrected was filed by the Department of State, the provision in the certificate as corrected or eliminated and if the execution was defective, the proper execution. The filing of the certificate by the Department of State will not alter the effective time of the instrument being corrected, which will remain as its original effective time, and will not affect any right or liability accrued or incurred before such filing. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHCK"</field>N-PCL &s;§105(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|187|30:176"</field>A corporate name may not be changed or corrected under this section other than to correct any typographical or similar nonmaterial error. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAHG"</field>N-PCL &s;§105(c).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I006V3Y"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I009O8U"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>154, 155</trace>
4. Amendment of Certificate of Incorporation
30:177. Resolution proposing amendment to certificate of incorporation
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id564ee601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>Resolved, that the board of directors of [name of corporation] hereby proposes that the certificate of incorporation of the corporation be amended as follows:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>Article [designation of article] of the certificate of incorporation be amended to read as follows: [recitation of article].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>That a new article be added to the certificate of incorporation to be numbered and to read as follows: [recitation of new article].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>That Article [designation of article] of the certificate of incorporation be deleted.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>Resolved further, that the proposed [amendment/amendments] of the certificate of incorporation be submitted to a vote at [the next annual meeting of the members/a special meeting of members to be held at [location and address of meeting], [name of city], State of New York, on [date of meeting], at [time of meeting]].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>Resolved further, that the secretary give notice of such meeting and such proposed [amendment/amendments] as required by the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and by the bylaws of this corporation to the extent that they are not inconsistent with those provisions.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>A not-for-profit corporation may not reduce its corporate duration by amendment to the certificate of incorporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHDQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§801(b)(4).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>The procedure to amend the certificate of incorporation is set forth in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. If there are members entitled to vote thereon, an amendment may be adopted by a majority vote of such members at a meeting of members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAIM"</field>N-PCL &s;§802(a)(1). If there are no members entitled to vote on it, an amendment may be adopted by a majority of the entire board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00I3NI"</field>N-PCL &s;§802(a)(2).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>To accomplish any amendment, a certificate of amendment must be signed and delivered to the Department of State. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006V40"</field>N-PCL &s;§803(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>For form drafting principles relating to amendment of the certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I009O8W"</field>&s;§30:42.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|188|30:177"</field>For form of certificate of amendment of certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00CHDS"</field>&s;§30:187.

 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00FAIO"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374

30:178. Notice to members of special meeting to consider proposed amendments to certificate of incorporation
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56515701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|189|30:178"</field>A special meeting of the members of [[name of club]/[name of association]], a New York not-for-profit corporation, will be held at [[address of club]/[address of association]], [name of city], New York, on [date of special meeting], at [time of special meeting], for the purpose of amending the certificate of incorporation of [[name of club]/[name of association]] pursuant to a resolution of the board of directors adopted on [date of adoption], as follows: [description of resolution].
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of secretary]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|189|30:178"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace>See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05SA9M"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|189|30:178"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of such notice, either in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05O2KA"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.
<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|189|30:178"</field>Any number of amendments may be submitted to the members and voted on by them at one meeting.
Research References

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5653c801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>Resolved, that the board of directors of [name of corporation] hereby amends the certificate of incorporation of the corporation as follows:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>The location of the corporation is to be changed from the current location, [current address of corporation], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], to the new location of [new address of corporation], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state]. Consequently, Article [designation of article] of the certificate of incorporation, which contains this information, shall be amended to read as follows: [recitation of amended article].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>The post office address to which the Secretary of State shall mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State is to be changed from the current address, [specification of current address], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], to the new address of [specification of new address], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state]. Consequently, Article [designation of article] of the certificate of incorporation, which contains this information, shall be amended to read as follows: [recitation of amended article].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>The designation of the corporation's registered agent and the address of the registered agent are to be changed from the current designation and address, [current designation of registered agent] and [address of registered agent], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], to the new designation and address of [new designation of registered agent] and [address of registered agent], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state]. Consequently, Article [designation of article] of the certificate of incorporation, which contains this information, shall be amended to read as follows: [recitation of amended article].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>The address of the corporation's registered agent, [name of registered agent], is to be changed from the current address, [current address of registered agent], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state] to the new address of [new address of registered agent], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state]. Consequently, Article [designation of article] of the certificate of incorporation, which contains this information, shall be amended to read as follows: [recitation of amended article].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>Resolved further, that the [titles of officers] are authorized to draft, execute, and deliver to the Department of State an appropriate certificate of amendment of the certificate of incorporation to accomplish the [amendment/amendments] of the certificate of incorporation as set forth above.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>Any one or more of the following changes may be authorized by or pursuant to authorization of the board: (1) to specify or change the location of the office of the corporation; (2) to specify or change the post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any notice required by law; and (3) to make, revoke, or change the designation of a registered agent or to specify or change the address of its registered agent. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006V9Q"</field>N-PCL &s;§802(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>The above changes of the certificate of incorporation may be accomplished by filing a certificate of change, instead of a certificate of amendment of the certificate of incorporation. See ►<field>x.ref.id="I05S9Y6"</field>&ss;§§30:171 et seq.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|190|30:179"</field>For form of certificate of amendment, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I05O28U"</field>&s;§30:187.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|191|30:180"</field>WHEREAS the members have determined that it is in the best interests of [name of corporation] to amend the Certificate of Incorporation to state that the number of members of the Board of Directors, as well as the times and manner of their appointment, shall be provided by [name of corporation]'s Bylaws.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|191|30:180"</field>NOW, THEREFORE, it is hereby:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|191|30:180"</field>RESOLVED, that the Certificate of Amendment to the Certificate of Incorporation of [name of corporation] in the form attached as Exhibit [designation of exhibit] hereto (the &ldquo;“Certificate of Amendment&rdquo;”) is hereby adopted and approved;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|191|30:180"</field>RESOLVED, that the President, Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer and any other officer of [name of corporation] (the &ldquo;“Authorized Officers&rdquo;”) be, and each of them hereby is, authorized and directed to execute, deliver and file the Certificate of Amendment with the Department of State of the State of New York and to pay any fees related to such filing;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|191|30:180"</field>RESOLVED, that the Authorized Officers be, and each of them hereby is, authorized, empowered and directed to take all such further action and to execute, deliver and file all such further agreements, certificates, instruments and documents, in the name and on behalf of the Company and to pay or cause to be paid all expenses as they or any one of them shall deem necessary, desirable, advisable or appropriate to consummate, effectuate, carry out or further the transactions contemplated by and the intent and purposes of the foregoing resolutions.

30:181. Resolution of members to amend certificate of incorporation-- Additional provision
FMS

COL
FCV

EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5658aa01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>WHEREAS, [name of corporation] was formed under the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>WHEREAS, the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law requires the unanimous consent of members to approve an action taken without a meeting, unless a provision of the certificate of incorporation, not inconsistent with the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, allows for the written consent of less than all of the members; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>WHEREAS, the Members desire to add a provision to the certificate of incorporation of [name of corporation] to allow Members to approve an action taken without a meeting by written consent of less than all of the Members; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>WHEREAS, the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law requires the amendments to the certificate of incorporation include the post office address of the office without the state at which the books and records of the corporation shall be kept and the designation of the Secretary of State as agent for service of process; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>WHEREAS, the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law requires that amendments to the certificate of incorporation be authorized by a majority vote of the Members at a meeting, the affirmative votes cast in favor of the amendment being at least equal to a quorum; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>WHEREAS, pursuant to the bylaws of [name of corporation], Members entitled to cast 100 votes or one-tenth of the total number of votes entitled to be cast thereat, whichever is less, present in person or by proxy, shall constitute a quorum at a meeting of Members for the transaction of any business;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>NOW THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, that the Members hereby approve and authorize the amendment of [name of corporation]'s certificate of incorporation to (i) allow [name of corporation] Members to approve an action taken without a meeting by written consent of less that all of the members, (ii) to add the post office address of the office without the state at which the books and records of the corporation shall be kept, and (iii) to designate the Secretary of State as agent for service of process; and further
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>RESOLVED, that the Members hereby authorize and direct the President, Secretary or other Officer of [name of corporation] to execute and file a certificate of amendment with the New York Department of State substantially in form of the draft attached hereto, subject to such changes as may be requested or required by the Department of State or otherwise in order to file such amendment; and further
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|192|30:181"</field>RESOLVED, that the Members hereby authorize and direct the President, Secretary or other Officer of [name of corporation] to take all necessary and proper actions to effectuate such amendment.
Notes to Form

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|193|30:182"</field>Resolved further, that the [titles of officers] are authorized to draft, execute, and deliver to the Department of State an appropriate certificate of amendment of the certificate of incorporation to accomplish the [amendment/amendments] of the certificate of incorporation as set forth in this resolution.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|193|30:182"</field>The procedure to amend the certificate of incorporation is set forth in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. If there are members entitled to vote on it, an amendment may be adopted by a majority vote of such members at a meeting of members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05O28K"</field>N-PCL &s;§802(a)(1). If there are no members entitled to vote on it, an amendment may be adopted by a majority of the entire board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05JUJ8"</field>N-PCL &s;§802(a)(2).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|193|30:182"</field>To accomplish any amendment, a certificate of amendment must be signed and delivered to the Department of State. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAOL"</field>N-PCL &s;§803(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|193|30:182"</field>For form of certificate of amendment of certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00I3TH"</field>&s;§30:187.

 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00KWYD"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id567ad801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|197|30:186"</field>The undersigned, being all the members of [[name of club]/[name of association]], a New York not-for-profit corporation, hereby consent to and adopt the following amendments to the corporation's certificate of incorporation:
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|197|30:186"</field>[Text of amendments].
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of consent]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Names of members]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|197|30:186"</field>For statutory provisions relating to approval by written consent of members, see ►<field>st.ref.id="I006VGV"</field>N-PCL &s;§614.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|197|30:186"</field>To accomplish any amendment, a certificate of amendment must be signed and delivered to the Department of State. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009OLR"</field>N-PCL &s;§803(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|197|30:186"</field>For form of certificate of amendment of certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00CHQN"</field>&s;§30:187.

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>The above form, revised 12/22, is available from the New York State Department of State, ►<field>url.ref.id="I05S9JW"</field><url>http://www.dos.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>Any number of amendments or changes may be included in one certificate of amendment under ►<field>st.ref.id="I05O1UK"</field>&s;§803. The certificate of amendment may also include any amendments or changes permitted by other sections of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. In such case, the certificate of amendment must set forth any additional statement required by any other section of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law which specifies the contents of a certificate to effect such amendment or change. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05JU58"</field>N-PCL &s;§803.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>Certain consents or approvals must be endorsed or attached to the certificate of amendment in instances where the amendment: (1) adds, changes, or eliminates a purpose, power, or provision the inclusion of which in a certificate of incorporation requires the consent or approval of a governmental body or officer or any other person or body; or (2) changes the name of a corporation whose certificate of incorporation had such consent or approval. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05FMFW"</field>N-PCL &s;§804(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>The fee for filing a certificate of amendment, which is subject to change, is currently $30. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006VH0"</field>N-PCL &s;§104-A(f).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the certificate of amendment to the county in which the office of the corporation is located. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009OLW"</field>N-PCL &s;§104(g).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>For discussion concerning execution of corporate documents, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00CHQS"</field>&s;§30:34.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>For form drafting principles for amendments to a certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00FAVO"</field>&s;§30:42.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|198|30:187"</field>A certificate of amendment of a certificate of incorporation must be entitled &ldquo;“Certificate of Amendment of the Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation) Under &s;§803 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.&rdquo;” ►<field>st.ref.id="I00I40K"</field>N-PCL &s;§803(a).

30:189. Directors' resolution authorizing filing of restated certificate of incorporation
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56849c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|200|30:189"</field>Resolved, that pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAVQ"</field>Section 805 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the President and secretary of this corporation are hereby authorized and directed to execute and file a restated certificate of incorporation [as amended previously without any further amendment or change as it is now in force and effect/and to include in it [specification of one or more of amendments or changes that may be authorized by board under &s;§802(c)]].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|200|30:189"</field>Such restated certificate of incorporation shall be the certificate of incorporation of the corporation.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|200|30:189"</field>A corporation, when authorized by the board of directors, may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation without making any amendment or change thereby, except that it may include any one or more of the amendments or changes which may be authorized by the board without a vote of shareholders or members. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I006VI8"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(a). In the alternative, a corporation may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation as amended by the restated certificate, to effect any one or more of the amendments or changes authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, when authorized by the statutory provision. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009ON4"</field>N-PCL &s;§802, governing amendment or change. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHS0"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|200|30:189"</field>Any amendment or change under these sections of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law (►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAWW"</field>N-PCL &s;§805) is subject to any other section, not inconsistent with these sections, which would be applicable if a separate certificate were filed to effect the amendment or change. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00I41S"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(d).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00KX6O"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I006VIA"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>156, 157</trace>
30:190. Restated certificate of incorporation without new amendments or changes

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56870d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>RESTATED CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF [NAME OF CORPORATION] UNDER ►<field>st.ref.id="I009ON6"</field>SECTION 805 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>Pursuant to the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHS2"</field>Section 805 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the undersigned corporation, as authorized by its board of directors, adopts the following restated certificate of incorporation.
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>The name of the corporation is [name of corporation]. [The name of the corporation has never been changed/The name under which the corporation was originally formed was [former name of corporation]].
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>The corporation's certificate of incorporation was filed by the Department of State on [date of filing certificate of incorporation], under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>This restated certificate of incorporation is authorized by the board of directors of the corporation.
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>The text of the certificate of incorporation, as previously amended, is hereby restated without further amendment or change to read as follows: [recitation of complete text].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>In witness whereof, the corporation, through its President and secretary, has executed this restated certificate of incorporation on [date of execution].
 ►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Name of corporation]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>By:

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of authorized representative]

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Attested:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of secretary]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Corporate seal]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>A corporation, when authorized by the board of directors, may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation without making any amendment or change thereby, except that it may include any one or more of the amendments or changes which may be authorized by the board without a vote of shareholders or members. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FAWY"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(a). In the alternative, a corporation may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation as amended by the restated certificate, to effect any one or more of the amendments or changes authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, when authorized by the statutory provision (►<field>st.ref.id="I00I41U"</field>N-PCL &s;§802) governing amendment or change. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05S95U"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>Any amendment or change under these sections of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law (►<field>st.ref.id="I05O1GI"</field>N-PCL &s;§805) is subject to any other section, not inconsistent with these sections, which would be applicable if a separate certificate were filed to effect the amendment or change. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHXQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(d).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>The fee for filing a restated certificate of incorporation, which is subject to change, is currently $30. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FB2M"</field>N-PCL &s;§104-A(h).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the restated certificate of incorporation to the county in which the office of the corporation is located. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00I47I"</field>N-PCL &s;§104(g).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>Upon filing by the Department of State, the original certificate of incorporation will be superseded, and the restated certificate of incorporation, including any amendments and changes made in it, will be the certificate of incorporation of the corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00KXCE"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(f).
Paragraph 4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>If the restated certificate merely restates and integrates but does not substantively amend the certificate of incorporation as previously amended, then the certificate should include a statement that the text of the certificate of incorporation, as amended previously, is thereby restated without further amendment or change to read as set forth in full. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00NQHA"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(b)(3).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>A restated certificate of incorporation need not include statements as to the incorporator(s) or as to the first directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I006VO0"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>. See ►<field>cc.ref.id="I009OSW"</field>Nathan Littauer Hospital Ass'n v. Spitzer, 287 A.D.2d 202, 734 N.Y.S.2d 671 (3d Dep't 2001) (reservation of enumerated powers contained in not-for-profit hospital's restated certificate of incorporation to its newly created parent corporation was not a change in, elimination of, or addition to corporate powers, such as would trigger Supreme Court review and approval of proposed affiliation of corporation with another corporation under newly created common parent).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|201|30:190"</field>For discussion of relevant form drafting principles for a restated certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00CHXS"</field>&s;§30:42.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00FB2O"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00I47K"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>156, 157</trace>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>The certificate of incorporation is amended or changed to effect [an amendment/change/certain amendments/changes] authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, specifically: [specification of each amendment or change]. The text of the certificate of incorporation, as amended heretofore, is hereby restated as further amended or changed to read as follows: [recitation of complete text].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>In witness whereof, the corporation, through its President and secretary, has executed this restated certificate of incorporation on [date of execution].

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>A corporation, when authorized by the board of directors, may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation without making any amendment or change thereby, except that it may include any one or more of the amendments or changes which may be authorized by the board without a vote of shareholders or members. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009OSZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(a). In the alternative, a corporation may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation as amended by the restated certificate, to effect any one or more of the amendments or changes authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, when authorized by the statutory provision (►<field>st.ref.id="I006VO5"</field>N-PCL &s;§802) governing amendment or change. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I009OT1"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>Any amendment or change under these sections of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law (►<field>st.ref.id="I00CHXX"</field>N-PCL &s;§805) is subject to any other section, not inconsistent with these sections, which would be applicable if a separate certificate were filed to effect the amendment or change. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00FB2T"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(d).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>The fee for filing a restated certificate of incorporation, which is subject to change, is currently $30. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00I47P"</field>N-PCL &s;§104-A(h).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the restated certificate of incorporation to the county in which the office of the corporation is located. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00KXCL"</field>N-PCL &s;§104(g).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>Upon filing by the Department of State, the original certificate of incorporation will be superseded, and the restated certificate of incorporation, including any amendments and changes made to it, will be the certificate of incorporation of the corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00NQHH"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(f).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>For form drafting principles drafting principles for a restated certificate of incorporation, see ►<field>x.ref.id="I00QJMD"</field>&s;§30:42.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I05S936"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05O1DU"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>156, 157</trace>
Paragraph 4. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>If the restated certificate restates the text of the certificate of incorporation as amended or changed thereby, then the restated certificate should include a statement that the certificate of incorporation is amended or changed to effect one or more of the amendments or changed authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, specifying each such amendment or change and that the text of the certificate of incorporation, as amended previously, is thereby restated as further amended or changed to read as therein set forth in full. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05JTOI"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(b)(4).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>A restated certificate of incorporation need not include statements as to the incorporator(s) or as to the first directors. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05FLZ6"</field>N-PCL &s;§805(c).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"</field>See ►<field>cc.ref.id="I00I48U"</field>Nathan Littauer Hospital Ass'n v. Spitzer, 287 A.D.2d 202, 734 N.Y.S.2d 671 (3d Dep't 2001) (reservation of enumerated powers contained in not-for-profit hospital's restated certificate of incorporation to its newly created parent corporation was not a change in, elimination of, or addition to corporate powers, such as would trigger Supreme Court review and approval of proposed affiliation of corporation with another corporation under newly created common parent).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00KXDQ"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00NQIM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>156, 157</trace>
5. Amendment of Bylaws
30:192. Members' resolution to amend bylaws
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR

MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id5690d101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"</field>Whereas, Article [designation of article], Section [number of section] of the Bylaws of this corporation provides as follows: [recitation of bylaw]; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"</field>Whereas, it is deemed to be in the best interest of the corporation to amend the above-quoted bylaw in order that [description of reasons for amendment].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"</field>Resolved, by [majority/[fraction of votes]] vote of the members, that Article [designation of article], Section [number of section] of the Bylaws of this corporation be and hereby is amended so as to read as follows: [recitation of amended bylaw].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"</field>Subject to any limitations on the right to vote specified in ►<field>st.ref.id="I05S930"</field>N-PCL &s;§612, bylaws of a not-for-profit corporation may be adopted, amended, or repealed by the members at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, by the board. ►<field>st.ref.id="I009OU9"</field>N-PCL &s;§602(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"</field>Where the board of directors has not been precluded from amending the bylaws, the above resolution may be adapted for use in such a situation.

30:195. Directors' resolution to amend bylaws
FMS
NFP
COL
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56982401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"</field>WHEREAS, [name of corporation] is a New York not-for-profit corporation subject to the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"</field>WHEREAS, the Nonprofit Revitalization Act, which was signed into law on December 18, 2013, made several changes to the provisions of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law relating to corporate governance of New York not- for-profit corporations, including but not limited to authorizing notice and waiver of notice of Board meetings by electronic means, prohibiting employees from serving as Board chair, and requiring that the Board or a designated audit committee comprising independent directors oversee accounting and financial reporting processes and annual audits; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"</field>WHEREAS, in light of the foregoing, the Board wishes to amend its Bylaws to reflect the changes to the Nonprofit Revitalization Act;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"</field>NOW THEREFORE, it is hereby
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"</field>RESOLVED, that the Amended and Restated Bylaws in the form attached hereto as Exhibit [designation of exhibit] be, and hereby are, approved, ratified and adopted as and for the Bylaws of [name of corporation] (the &ldquo;“Bylaws&rdquo;”), and that the Secretary of [name of corporation] be, and hereby is, instructed to file a copy of such Bylaws in [name of corporation]'s minute book; and it is further
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"</field>RESOLVED, that the officers of [name of corporation] be, and each of them hereby is, authorized and directed to take any and all further action and to execute, deliver and file any and all instruments and documents in the name and on behalf of [name of corporation], and to pay any and all fees and expenses, as in his or her judgment may be necessary or advisable in order to carry out the intent and purpose of the foregoing resolutions.

6. Merger or Consolidation
30:197. Plan of merger
FMS

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id569f7701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>PLAN OF MERGER 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>Plan of merger of [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation.
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section One.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The names of the constituent corporations are [name of corporation 1] and [name of corporation 2]. [OPTIONAL: If the name of any constituent corporation has been changed add the following: The name under which [[name of corporation 1]/[name of corporation 2]] was formed is [name of corporation when formed].]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The name of the surviving corporation is [name of surviving corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Two.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>As to each constituent corporation, the membership and holders of any certificates evidencing capital contributions or subventions, including their number, classification, and voting rights are as follows: [list of required information for each constituent corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Three.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The terms and conditions of the proposed merger, including the manner and basis of converting membership or other interest in each constituent corporation into membership or other interest in the surviving corporation, or the cash or other consideration to be paid or delivered in exchange for membership or other interest in each constituent corporation are as follows: [list of terms and conditions of merger].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Four.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The certificate of incorporation of the surviving corporation will contain the following amendments or changes after the merger: [[Specification of amendments]/[Specification of changes]].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Five.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>This plan shall become effective on approval by the members of the corporation, either by unanimous written consent, in compliance with ►<field>st.ref.id="I007ZKM"</field>Section 614 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, or by affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the members of the corporation, in compliance with ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASPI"</field>Section 613(c) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Six.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The proposed merger shall become effective upon the filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State, unless, prior to delivery of such certificate to the Department of State for filing, it is agreed between the boards of directors of the constituent corporations that a later effective date is advisable, in which event the certificate of merger shall contain a provision specifying such later effective date as is agreed upon between such boards, but which date under ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DLUE"</field>N-PCL &s;§905(a) may not exceed 30 days subsequent to the filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Seven.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>Notwithstanding authorization of this plan by the members of either of the constituent corporations, if at any time prior to the filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State it becomes the opinion of the board of directors of either of the constituent corporations that events or circumstances have occurred which render it inadvisable to consummate the merger, this plan of merger may be abandoned. The filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State shall conclusively establish that this plan has not been abandoned.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of certificate of merger]
 ►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Name of corporation 1]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>By:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of authorized representative 1]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of authorized representative 1]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Attested:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of secretary 1]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Corporate seal 1]
 ►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Name of corporation 2]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>By:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of authorized representative 2]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of authorized representative 2]
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Attested:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of secretary 2]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Corporate seal 2]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The board of directors of each corporation proposing to participate in a merger or consolidation must adopt<trace>, by a vote of two-thirds of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time, or by a vote of the number of directors required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law,</trace> a plan of merger or consolidation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q1A6"</field>N-PCL &s;§902(a).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00ASQO"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DLVK"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>1288</trace>
Section One. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>The optional provision is required if the name of any constituent corporation has been changed from the name under which the corporation was originally formed. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q1A2"</field>N-PCL &s;§902(a)(1).
Section Seven. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"</field>At any time prior to the filing of the certificate of merger or consolidation, the plan of merger or consolidation may be abandoned pursuant to a provision for such abandonment, if any, contained in the plan of merger or consolidation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASQQ"</field>N-PCL &s;§903(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DLVM"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>1291</trace>

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56a1e801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>PLAN OF CONSOLIDATION 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>Plan of consolidation of [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation.
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section One.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The names of the constituent corporations are [name of corporation 1] and [name of corporation 2]. [OPTIONAL: If the name of any constituent corporation has been changed add the following: The name under which [[name of corporation 1]/[name of corporation 2]] was formed is [name of corporation when formed].]
►<field>sel.tp="alt"</field>[EITHER:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The name of the consolidated corporation is [name of consolidated corporation].[OR:]
 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The name of the consolidated corporation has not yet been determined. The name of the consolidated corporation shall be determined in the following manner: [specification of method for determining name of consolidated corporation].<trace.deleted/>
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Two.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>As to each constituent corporation, the membership and holders of any certificates evidencing capital contributions or subventions, including their number, classification, and voting rights are as follows: [list of required information for each constituent corporation].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Three.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The terms and conditions of the proposed consolidation, including the manner and basis of converting membership or other interest in each constituent corporation into membership or other interest in the surviving corporation, or the cash or other consideration to be paid or delivered in exchange for membership or other interest in each constituent corporation are as follows: [list of terms and conditions of consolidation].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Four.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The certificate of incorporation of the consolidated corporation shall contain the following statements required to be included in a certificate of incorporation for a corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law: [description of required statements].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>Other statements as to facts not available at the time of adoption by the board of the Plan of Consolidation may also be included.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Five.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>This Plan shall become effective on approval by the members of the corporation, either by unanimous written consent, in compliance with ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q0YS"</field>Section 614 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, or by affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the members of the corporation, in compliance with ►<field>st.ref.id="I05LT9G"</field>Section 613(c) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Six.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The proposed consolidation shall become effective upon the filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State, unless, prior to delivery of such certificate to the Department of State for filing, it is agreed between the boards of directors of the constituent corporations that a later effective date is advisable, in which event the certificate of consolidation shall contain a provision specifying such later effective date as is agreed upon between such boards, but which date under ►<field>st.ref.id="I05HLK4"</field>N-PCL &s;§905(a) may not exceed 30 days subsequent to the filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Seven.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>Notwithstanding authorization of this Plan by the members of either of the constituent corporations, if, at any time prior to the filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State, it becomes the opinion of the board of directors of either of the constituent corporations that events or circumstances have occurred which render it inadvisable to consummate the consolidation, this Plan of Consolidation may be abandoned. The filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State shall conclusively establish that this Plan has not been abandoned.

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of certificate of consolidation]
 ►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Name of corporation 1]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>By:
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of authorized representative 1]

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Attested:

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Corporate seal 1]
 ►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Name of corporation 2]

 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of authorized representative 2]

Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The board of directors of each corporation proposing to participate in a consolidation must adopt<trace>, by a vote of two-thirds of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time, or by a vote of the number of directors required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law,</trace> a plan of consolidation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I007ZRK"</field>N-PCL &s;§902(a).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00ASWG"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM1C"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>1288</trace>
Section One. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>The optional provision is required if the name of any constituent corporation has been changed from the name under which the corporation was originally formed. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GF68"</field>N-PCL &s;§902(a)(1).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>Unlike a merger, where the name of the surviving corporation is known, it may be in the case of a consolidation, where the two corporations consolidate into a new corporation, that the corporate name will not be determined at the time the plan for consolidation is drafted. The statute allows for this by permitting the method to be used for determining the name of the consolidated corporation to be stated rather than the name itself. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8B4"</field>N-PCL &s;§902(a)(1).
Section Seven. 
Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"</field>At any time prior to the filing of the certificate of consolidation, the plan of consolidation may be abandoned pursuant to a provision for such abandonment, if any, contained in the plan of consolidation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00M1G0"</field>N-PCL &s;§903(b).
Research References
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I05Q0YI"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &s;§<trace.deleted/><trace>1291</trace>

<trace.deleted/>
<trace.deleted/>
30:199. Directors' resolution adopting plan of merger

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56a6ca01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"</field>Whereas, in the opinion of the board of directors, it is deemed to be in the best interests of this corporation that the corporation be merged with [name of other corporation];
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"</field>Therefore, be it resolved, that the board of directors of this corporation adopt the Plan of Merger; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"</field>Resolved further, that the board of directors of this corporation recommend that the corporation be merged; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"</field>Resolved further, that the officers and directors of this corporation submit to a vote at the [annual/special] meeting of the members the adoption of the Plan of Merger. Such meeting of the members shall be held at [location of meeting], in [name of city], State of New York, on [date of meeting], at [time of meeting].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"</field>The board of each constituent corporation, upon approving the plan of merger or consolidation, must submit such plan to a vote of the members. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q0YC"</field>N-PCL &s;§903(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"</field>If any merging corporation has no members entitled to vote on the plan of merger, the plan of merger is deemed approved by the members of the corporation when it is adopted by the board of that corporation pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ASWL"</field>&s;§902. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM1H"</field>N-PCL &s;§903(a).

30:201. Notice of special meeting of members to consider directors' recommendation to merger
FMS

TEM

 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56abac01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>To: The members of [name of corporation]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"</field>Notice is hereby given that a special meeting of the members of [name of corporation] will be held at the principal office of the corporation at [office address of corporation], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], on [date of special meeting], at [time of special meeting] for the following purposes:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(1). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"</field>To consider and act on a recommendation of the board of directors that the corporation be merged. A copy of [the plan of merger/an outline of the material features of the plan] accompany this notice. Please review it carefully.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(2). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"</field>To consider and act on any other business that may come before the meeting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"</field>By order of the board of directors.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice of special meeting]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"</field><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM2M"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"</field>Notice of meeting must be given to each member whether or not the member is entitled to vote. ►<field>st.ref.id="I007ZSX"</field>N-PCL &s;§903(a).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00ASXT"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00DM2P"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>901 to 907</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>1290</trace>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"</field>Whereas, more than two-thirds of the members present and voting have voted to authorize such [merger/consolidation]; it is
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"</field>Resolved, that [name of corporation], a New York not-for-profit corporation, be [merged/consolidated] as proposed in the Plan of [Merger/Consolidation]; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"</field>Further resolved, that the appropriate officers of the club are directed to execute and file the requisite certificate of [merger/consolidation] with the New York Department of State and to take such further action as may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the intent of this resolution.

►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"</field>The names of the constituent corporations are [name of corporation 1] and [name of corporation 2].  ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"</field>The merger of [name of corporation 2] and [name of corporation 1] was authorized with respect to [name of corporation 2] by [specification of manner of authorization].

7. Dissolution
30:205. Directors' resolution recommending dissolution
FMS
NFP
COL
REO
FCV
FTR
EBL
TEM
MTD
 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56c1a501b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"</field>Whereas, in the opinion of the board of directors, it is deemed to be in the best interests of this corporation that the corporation be dissolved;
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"</field>Therefore, be it resolved, that the board of directors of this corporation recommend that the corporation be dissolved; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"</field>Resolved further, that the officers and directors of this corporation submit to a vote at the [annual/special] meeting of the members the adoption of this resolution. Such meeting of the members shall be held at [location of meeting], in the [name of city], State of New York, on [date of meeting], at [time of meeting].
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"</field>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM8H"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"</field>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q0K8"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§1001 et seq.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law also makes provision for the dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation by an action for dissolution brought by the Attorney General based on one or more specified, statutory grounds. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05LSUW"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§1101 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I05HL5K"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I05DDG8"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J8IB"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M1N7"</field>Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00OUS3"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>

30:207. Notice of special meeting of members to consider directors' recommendation to dissolve
