 ►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56d2bc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>►<field>fcap.ref="manual"</field>►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>To: The members of [name of club]
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>Notice is hereby given that a special meeting of the members of [name of club] will be held at the principal office of the club at [office address of club], [name of city], [name of county], [name of state], on [date of special meeting], at [time of special meeting] for the following purposes:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(1). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>To consider and act on a recommendation of the board of directors that the club be dissolved.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>(2). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>To consider and act on any other business that may come before the meeting.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>By order of the board of directors.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice of special meeting]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>[Title of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field><trace.deleted/><trace>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail.</trace> ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q0HS"</field>N-PCL &s;§605(a).
<trace.deleted/>
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member's authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting, shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05DDDS"</field>N-PCL &s;§606.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I008002"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00AT4Y"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§1001 et seq.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"</field>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law also makes provision for the dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation by an action for dissolution brought by the Attorney General based on one or more specified, statutory grounds. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DM9U"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§1101 et seq.
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00GFEQ"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390

 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00M1OI"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00OUTE"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00RNYA"</field>Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00UH36"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>901 to 907</trace>, <trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"</field>Whereas, more than two-thirds of the members present and voting have voted to authorize such dissolution; it is

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"</field>This form is based on the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFKI"</field>N-PCL &s;§614. That section provides that, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken at any meeting of the members by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may be taken without a meeting if all the members entitled to vote thereon consent thereto in writing or electronically. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00J8PE"</field>N-PCL &s;§614(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"</field>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I05Q05Y"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"</field>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05LSGM"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§1001 et seq.

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"</field>WHEREAS, the sale of [name of corporation]'s buildings and real property shall be authorized by a majority of [name of corporation]'s Board of Directors pursuant to ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFLQ"</field>Section 509(b) of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law which requires the sale of real property to be approved by a majority of a corporation's board of directors; and
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"</field>WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of [name of corporation] to dissolve under the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.

30:212. Plan of complete liquidation and dissolution
FMS
NFP
COL

FCV

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56f4ea01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>PLAN OF COMPLETE LIQUIDATION AND DISSOLUTION 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>Plan of complete liquidation and dissolution of [name of club], a New York not-for-profit corporation, subsequently called the Corporation.
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section One.  APPROVAL OF PLAN
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>This plan shall become effective on approval by the members of the corporation, either by unanimous written consent, in compliance with ►<field>st.ref.id="I05HKOU"</field>Section 614 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, or by affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the members of the corporation, in compliance with ►<field>st.ref.id="I05DCZI"</field>Section 1002(a) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Two.  COLLECTION OF ASSETS AND PAYMENT OF OBLIGATIONS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>After approval and adoption of the plan by the members, the corporation shall proceed to collect its assets and to sell, exchange, convey, or otherwise dispose of or reduce to cash all of such assets, except such assets as may be distributed in kind to the members in pro rata distributions, and to pay, satisfy, and discharge or make provision for payment, satisfaction, and discharge of its liabilities and obligations, including unascertained or contingent liabilities and obligations. Such sale, exchange, conveyance, or other disposition of the assets of the corporation shall be completed as quickly as possible after the approval and adoption of the plan by the members.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>Section Three.  DISTRIBUTION OF ASSETS
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>As soon as practicable, the corporation shall:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(a). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>Make one or more pro rata distributions to members, in cash or in kind, of assets of the corporation legally available for distribution in accordance with the provisions of the corporation's certificate of incorporation [OPTIONAL: and bylaws] governing the distributive rights of members [OPTIONAL: and classes of members], specifically [recitation of sections of certificate of incorporation and/or bylaws];
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(b). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>All assets held by the corporation for a [charitable/eleemosynary/benevolent/educational/[specification of usage of assets]] use, consisting of [list of assets], which assets are not held upon a condition requiring return, transfer, or conveyance by reason of the dissolution of the corporation, shall be transferred or conveyed to [list of one or more domestic or foreign corporations, societies, or organizations engaged in activities substantially similar to those of dissolving corporation], pursuant to the plan of distribution to be subsequently adopted by the corporation;
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(c). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>All assets held by the corporation upon a condition requiring return, transfer, or conveyance by reason of the dissolution of the corporation shall be returned, transferred, or conveyed in accordance with the requirements appertaining thereto; and
►<field>fi.lvl="2"</field>(d). 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>Dissolve and file a formal certificate of dissolution in compliance with the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>A nonjudicial dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation must be initiated by the adoption by its board of directors of a plan for its dissolution and the distribution of its assets. This plan must implement any provision in the certificate of incorporation prescribing the distributive rights of its members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I008077"</field>N-PCL &s;§1001(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATC3"</field>N-PCL &s;§515(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>If the corporation is a charitable corporation and has no assets to distribute and no liabilities at the time of dissolution, the plan of dissolution shall include a statement to that effect. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DMGZ"</field>N-PCL &s;§1001(b).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>The board must submit its plan to the members of the corporation for approval. The dissolution is deemed authorized when the plan is approved by the statutory two-thirds vote of the members. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00GFLV"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"</field>The plan of dissolution must also be approved by any governmental body or officer whose approval was required for the formation of the corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05PZS2"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(c). Moreover, the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets must have annexed thereto the approval of the Attorney General in the case of a charitable corporation, and in the case of any noncharitable corporation which at the time of dissolution holds assets legally required to be used for a particular purpose. Application to the Attorney General for such approval must be by verified petition, with the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets and certified copies of the consents prescribed by statute annexed thereto. ►<field>st.ref.id="I05LS2Q"</field>N-PCL &s;§1002(d).
Research References
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00DMMM"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390
 ►<field>tk.ref.id="I00GFRI"</field>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00J8WE"</field>Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00M21A"</field>Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318
 ►<field>rc.ref.id="I00OV66"</field>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &ss;§§<trace.deleted/><trace>1328 to 1336</trace>
30:213. Plan of dissolution

►<field>form.du="0"</field><field>form.fid="Id56f9cc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0"</field>Plan of Dissolution of [Name of Corporation] 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"</field>The Board of Directors (&ldquo;“Directors&rdquo;”) of [name of corporation] does hereby resolve and recommend to its sole member for approval that the corporation be dissolved. The Directors considered the advisability of voluntarily dissolving the corporation. All of the Directors determined that dissolution was advisable and in the best interest of the corporation and agreed to this resolution by unanimous written consent without a meeting. They adopted the following plan:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"</field>Following resolution of the Board of Directors adopting a Plan of Dissolution, the board shall submit the plan to its sole member for approval.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"</field>No approval of the dissolution of the corporation by any governmental body or officer is required.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"</field>The corporation has no assets or liabilities.
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"</field>A Certificate of Dissolution shall be signed by an authorized director or officer and all required approvals shall be attached thereto.
Notes to Form

 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"</field>See Notes following ►<field>x.ref.id="I0080CX"</field>&s;§30:212.

►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.morerows="1"</field><field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>To:<trace> [name of creditor]</trace>

►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field><trace.deleted/>


►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>[address of creditor]




 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>Pursuant to the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080CZ"</field>Section 1007 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, you are hereby notified as follows:
 
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>1. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>The undersigned corporation has been dissolved effective [effective date of dissolution].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>2. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>If you have a claim against the dissolved corporation, you must send your claim, including [description of required information about claim], to the following address: [name of corporation], Attention: [name of individual], [address of individual], [name of city], New York [zip code of individual's address].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>3. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>Your claim package must be received by the dissolved corporation no later than [due date of receipt].
►<field>fi.lvl="1"</field>4. 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>IF YOUR CLAIM IS NOT RECEIVED ON OR BEFORE THE DEADLINE SPECIFIED IN PARAGRAPH 3, ABOVE, IT WILL BE FOREVER BARRED PURSUANT TO ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATHV"</field>Section 1007 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of notice]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of person issuing notice]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>At any time after the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets has been authorized or approved pursuant to statute, and prior to filing the certificate of dissolution, the corporation may give a notice requiring all creditors and claimants to present their claims in writing and in detail at a specified place and by a specified day, which shall not be less than six months after the first publication of such notice. The notice must be published at least once a week for two successive weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in the county in which the office of the corporation was located on the date of authorization of its plan of dissolution and distribution of assets as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. ►<field>st.ref.id="I00DMMR"</field>N-PCL &s;§1007(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>On or before the date of the first publication of such notice, the corporation must mail a copy thereof, postage prepaid, to each person believed to be a creditor of or claimant against the corporation whose current name and address are known to or can with due diligence be ascertained by the corporation. ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080D2"</field>N-PCL &s;§1007(a).
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"</field>Any creditor who does not file a claim as provided in the notice published in the newspaper and/or mailed to known creditors will be forever barred from suing on the claim or otherwise realizing upon or enforcing it, with certain exceptions. See ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATHY"</field>N-PCL &s;§1007(b).

►<field>row.date.updated="0"</field>►<field>entry.resize="same"</field><field>entry.style="block"</field>Re: [description of claim of creditor]




 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"</field>With regard to the above-referenced claim, you are hereby notified that [name of club], a dissolved not-for-profit corporation, rejects such claim [in its entirety/[specification of portion of claim rejected]].
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"</field>You are further notified that, pursuant to the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I0080E7"</field>Section 1007(b) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, any claim(s) disputed by a dissolved not-for-profit corporation may be submitted for determination to the Supreme Court in the judicial district where the office of the dissolved corporation was located at the date of its dissolution. A special proceeding in the Supreme Court may be instituted upon the petition of the corporation or that of a creditor, claimant, and certain others.
►<field>fvs.amt="1"</field>
 ►<field>fal.lo="n"</field>Dated: [date of rejection]
►<field>fsig.pos="r"</field>►<field>fal.lo="y"</field> ______________ <br>[Name of corporate officer]
Notes to Form

Drafter's Note 
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"</field>The above form is based on the provisions of ►<field>st.ref.id="I00ATJ3"</field>N-PCL &ss;§§1007, 1008.
 ►<field>p.ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"</field>If, after sending the notice to the creditor, the dissolved corporation rejects the claim, in whole or in part, the dissolved corporation should notify the creditor of such rejection and explain what remedies exist in the situation.
